Reviews.Title: “Read this before you book it”
Reviews.Author: juliaSouthport
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights here and thought I had done my homework on Tripadvisor and had found a gem like Spalletti Trevelli in Rome which was truly exceptional. Al Ponte should not be listed as a hotel but a B and B at best. There are no communal areas to sit in apart from the breakfast room and the terrace overlooking the canal, no turn down service or room service and no complimentary water in the room. Our bedroom adjacent to the breakast room was large but very dark and depressing as the curtains had to remain closed so that other guests sitting on the terrace couldn't see directly into the room, and for the same reason external shutters were closed early evening until mid morning - why pay for a view and then be deprived of it!. The room was sometimes cold and when I asked at the desk for some heating in our room at 5 pm I was told that it was not the policy of the hotel to have the heating on in summer (it is mid April!) and was offered more blankets and pillows. The bed consisted of 2 twins put together with a ridge down the middle, not a criminal offence but ROCK HARD and the pillows , although plenty of them were lumpy. One of the brothers /owners arranged for extra blankets to be laid on top of the mattress but it was still very uncomfortable and I didn't have the guts to admit it when asked if there had been any improvement. . Breakfast- very ordinary. I love a good selection of freshly prepared fruits but not here- we had a choice of whole apples pears and kiwi ( not forgetting the tinned peaches) so on our third morning we asked for an orange and in all fairness we were brought an orange or two on subsequent mornings. For 400 euros a night I would have expected freshly squeezed orange juice for breakfast and also freshly baked bread with delicious pastries but my expectations must be higher than most of other reviewers. Roasalba the waitress was a delight - we had great coffees and the omelettes and crepes looked appetizing but why not make the buffet table more appealing? I do feel guilty writing all this because the staff/owners were so accommodating when we saw them and seemed genuinely concerned that we should enjoy our stay there. It's a great pity that we didn't particularly and I want to share this with others.

Reviews.Title: “Truly exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Deborah S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Al Ponte Antico in April 2011. It was a truly memorable experience for all the right reasons. Each morning we ate our delicious breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal watching the endlessly entertaining morning rush hour of boats. There are many reasons to stay here but, above all, the personal service at this hotel is truly exceptional. Matteo, Bruno and every member of staff treat every guest as if they were royalty or like the dearest old friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Venetian Experience”
Reviews.Author: JillS212
Reviews.Content: Much of what we experienced has already been said in many other reviews but we felt we had to share our experience at the Al Ponte Antico. Arriving via water taxi from the airport right to the hotel entrance is quite easy and effortless and takes away any concerns with having to navigate through Venice's cobblestone streets with your luggage. The hotel itself is quite charming and really has a lot of personality. The front entrance is down a quiet little side street and the hotel is furnished and decorated with lots of personal touches. The location is superb and allows easy access into all of Venice's great neighborhoods. It is a stone's throw away from the Rialto Bridge and the outside terrace overlooks the Grand Canal and the bridge. The rooms are nice and clean and the bathrooms are spacious. Our particular room did not have a view but honestly, that was not an issue for us. We do not vacation to spend time in a hotel room so the vast majority of our day was out exploring all that Venice has to offer. When we wanted to sit and relax and people watch along the canal, we sat outside on the main terrace of the hotel enjoying an afternoon coffee. Speaking of the coffee, the hotel's custom built espresso machine makes the absolute finest espresso and cappuccino that we have ever had. It is truly a work of art and made mostly every other coffee we had during the rest of our trip pale in comparison. The owners, Bruno and Matteo, along with the rest of the hotel staff are truly special. They really make you feel like family and are so helpful with sightseeing and restaurant recommendations. They make your stay in Venice feel like you are staying with friends/family and the personal level of service was unmatched compared to other hotels we have stayed at in Europe. We were only at the beginning of our vacation in Italy but we were sad to leave Venice and I cried as the water taxi whisked us away from the Ponte Antico and took us to the train station while Bruno waved us goodbye. I think that says a lot about how we felt about our stay at the Al Ponte Antico.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class Venice”
Reviews.Author: annb30
Reviews.Content: We arrived by water taxi straight from the airport. As the hotel is right on the Grand Canal, you are dropped off right at the front entrance, effortless. We were welcomed by our first names, given a brief but informative tour of the hotel and left to settle into our room which was at water level looking out onto the Grand Canal. During our 3 night stay, we were always greeted by Matteo, Bruno and all staff by our first names, nothing was ever too much trouble for any member of staff. They gave us great advice on what, where and when to visit the places we wanted to see. This hotel is a very special place to stay because of the location, history and service. Above all, make sure you take time to sit on the terrace overlooking the Rialto Bridge and Grand Canal. After a day sightseeing, 3pm, relaxing on the terrace in the sun with a Bellini, watching the world go by...Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Venetian Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny717
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Al Ponte Antico Hotel. The hotel is easy to find and close to the Rialto Vaporetto stop and the Alilaguna which takes you to the airport.The room was amazing, overlooking the Grande Canal and the Rialto Bridge. Matteo and Bruno make you feel welcome from the moment you first arrive. They were extremely helpful with sightseeing and restaurant tips. Although chilly when we were there, breakfast on the Terrace overlooking the hustle and bustle of the Canal is truly memorable. And the breakfasts were delicious - both the omelette and the crepes are worth mentioning!! A Wonderful Venetian Experience!

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure about the rating...”
Reviews.Author: Solcito63
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my first impression of the hotel was terrible. WeÂ´re given -I guess- the worst room of all the hotel. It was dark, dark and dark and when I opened the windows searching for a hint of light all I found was a gray thick wall almost reachable by my hand. Without opening the luggage we asked for another room but weÂ´re told at the front desk the hotel was fully booked. Lucky of us, later that day one of the owners offered to change the room to another one for the following night, which he did and this was a large room with a great view of the canal; although the first dark room and this one shared the same hard rock pillows and some mold in the baths. Yes, breakfast was superb and the fact that the owners run the place personally and call each guest by their first name is kind and nice; but at the end of the day IÂ´m not so sure that those things are worth the price we paid for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch experience, the definition of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: MartinPer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary in March and were extremely impressed by this boutique hotel. Not only is the location fantastic and the rooms full of character and detail but the service is second to none. The owner Matteo, his brother Bruno and the rest of the staff are extremely attentive an courteous and made our stay truly memorable. The breakfast was of a very high quality - if the weather allows it is very special to sit outside on the terrace overlooking the grand canal and Rialto bridge. If you are looking for quality and that little extra on your holiday we cannot recommend this hotel warmly enough. Matteo and Bruno are true role models for other aspiring hoteliers out there.

Reviews.Title: “"A very special hotel with a very special atmosphere."”
Reviews.Author: Maxime2
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through the reviews on Trip Advisor and it was perfect from start to finish. It will always hold a special place in our hearts and we would never stay anywhere else when we hopefully visit Venice some day again. We spent 4 nights in February in this very special hotel with unforgettable friendly staff who go beyond the call of duty to make your stay memorable. If you go you must book a room with a view of the Rialto. Thank you again Bruno and Matteo and all of your staff for such a wonderful holiday we will never forget our stay with you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: Bebop11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Venice after a long flight. Matteo, the owner, was standing at the door and greated us by name, and asked if he could do anything to help us relax. We didn't even say who we were and he was escorting us to our room. Talk about a great first impression! The hotel is small and gorgeous inside. The decore is pure Venetian; our room had a rich blue and gold silk wallpaper on the walls and ornate wood furniture. Matteo's staff was unbelievable helpful and recommended some of the best restaurants in the city. All in all, I will never stay in any other hotel in Venice. The Al Ponte Antico is the best place to stay in Venice and maybe in all of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be in anyone's top 10”
Reviews.Author: PeterOsborne
Reviews.Content: As others have discovered this is a special hotel for many reasons, but one thing is for sure, you will have to go very far and stay in a lot of hotels to find anywhere with better, friendlier, more obliging and helpful staff. A high standard is clearly what they aim for and they certainly succeed. We stayed overnight on the way back from the Dolomites and will not hesitate to return. The location is ideal, the furnishings and ambience of the building perfect, the views sensational, breakfast just right. Also the restaurant recommendation was exactly right so thanks to Matteo, Bruno and all the staff for delivering our first 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel made our Venetian holiday”
Reviews.Author: Dsuem
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, giving us recommendations for everything from how to best organize our sightseeing to where to find delicious non-touristy restaurants. Their guidance allowed us to have a personal experience in Venice. The room itself was large, clean, comfortable, and well-decorated. The breakfast was lovely, with a great buffet as well as eggs prepared to order in a very charming room. Drinks on the terrace overlooking the Rialto bridge made a perfect respite between sightseeing and dinner. Arriving from the airport by water taxi was an enchanting introduction to the city. This hotel is truly a jewel set in the middle of Venice's bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Service over and above the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: Pierreaulit
Reviews.Content: Matteo, Bruno and all of the staff at the hotel couldn't have been kinder. Tomas, the most entertaining night porter was fabulous too. The personal level of service was so friendly and their kind advice, even down to restaurant reccommendations, could not be faulted. My wife and I stayed there for four nights for my sixtieth birthday as a treat from my son. We stayed in one of the smaller darker rooms with a courtyard but apart from the overly warm room had a great experience. Breakfast on the verandah overlooking the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge was a great start to our days. Drinks at night in the same place was even more enjoyable. We found a wonderful family restaurant, Ristorante 1251 opposite the Chiesa di St. Appolinaire, the first night great, the second night was stunning and I defy you to find a better value, honest and fun restaurant in Venice. As to Al Ponte Antico they were even kind to our friends who visited us, offering them breakfast and drinks. All the Venetian staff from managers, to Oliver at breakfast, Stefano on the desk and Rosealba cooking excellent omelettes for breakfast. Follow Matteo's advice and get lost in the city and Bruno's to miss out the main streets and wander through the old Jewish quarter. Fabulous and thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Judeinglasses
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Al Ponte Antico during a weekend stay. The hotel (or Palace) interior is stunning and every detail is thought through. With many small hotels you get a variation in room size and although we elected to have a standard room we were able to see one of the rooms facing the canal and it was truly sumptuous. Rosabla prepares freshly cooked eggs in any style you want for breakfast and comes to the table in person to ask what you would like and how. Bruno and Matteo look after almost every other aspect ensuring that you have all the information you need to enjoy your stay both in the hotel and in Venice. Located next to the Rialto Bridge it is a few minutes walk from anywhere and also next door to the Vaporetto (water bus) stop. We used the Alilaguna boat from the airport, landed next to the Rialto and the hotel was a very short walk from there. The hotel is also one of the few with its own balcony where you can enjoy a drink and watch the world sail by!

Reviews.Title: “What can I say, it was just fabulous”
Reviews.Author: marduk1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels and the Al Ponte Antico ranks right up there with the very best. The building and the interior decor are absolutely stunning and the rooms are generous in size. The location is just perfect, a few minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge. But what makes this hotel outstanding is the staff, they make the effort to speak to you by name and are helpful and friendly but not intrusive. They are also extremely knowledgable about Venice and are up to date with their recommendations. To give an example of how helpful the staff are - we arrived well after midnight but were still greeted at the door and offered a drink at the bar before being shown to our room. Throw in an excellent complimentary breakfast and you have a hotel that must be very close to perfect. One suggestion about getting to the hotel from the airport - taking a private water taxi direct to the hotel's wharf rather than a public vaporetto saves a lot of time. It's not cheap, about 110 Euros for up to 4 people versus 15 Euros per person for the vaporetto but it is a much more pleasant way to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, though not earth-moving”
Reviews.Author: jollyolexpat
Reviews.Content: Spent just a night here a couple weeks back, and everything was very, very good, though wonder if it merits quite the laudatory praise and extremely high ranking on TA. Had done quite a bit of research, and I guess I expected to be more bowled over than I was, merely based on everyone's reviews. It's true that nearly everything is fairly perfect: ideal location just steps from the Rialto Bridge, majestic common area/dining room (from 14th or 15th century, I think), good breakfast, attentive service from quite possibly the nicest people in all of Venice. The room is where I think the standard fell just a little short - we had the most basic of rooms and nothing was wrong with it at all, decent size with ample and nice furnishings, upholstered walls/curtains, comfortable bed, huge bathroom...it was very dark, which is great for sleeping but a little disorienting during the day, maybe only a concern if you like to lounge around your room a lot, and the room was immediately off the dining area where breakfast is served. In fact, at least 3 or 4 of the 9 rooms seem to be. Again, we had a baseline priced room so this may just be what's to be expected, but we were very nervous about noise in the morning when people would be dining. We were lucky in that we may have been some of the only people in the hotel on this particular day - we heard the staff setting up but that's about it. The bathroom was well-equipped, with robes and slippers, which was great, only a shampoo/body wash combo for amenities (pet peeve of mine; maybe I'm uppity but I think a four star hotel should have a body lotion and/or hair conditioner), and the only really unfortunate thing was the shower head would not stay up so you had to use it as a handheld. If we spent more than one day there, would certainly have said something, but basically - room 3 needs just a little servicing! All said, most everything is absolutely true, great location, great value, and truly the nicest people, my only slight word of caution would be to take some of these Trip Advisor reviews with a grain of salt!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: mgcvbr
Reviews.Content: This is a very small hotel located near the Rialto Bridge. The service is just like every other reviewer has written, outstanding! Don't expect the formality of classic big hotels, here they will really make you feel at home. Well decorated small rooms, excellent location. Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service! So friendly! Location perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Vedelw
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend this hotel enough! Right in the heart of Venice! Bruno who owns the hotel! Couldn't be nicer! He loves what he does! We had the perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsGourlay
Reviews.Content: We had the main suite for the first night of our honeymoon. We arrived to a beautiful display of champagne chocolate and petals with a lovely hand written card. Our room Located on the ground floor at first put me off until I realised it was due to the private sitting room with opening bay windows overlooking the Rialto bridge. The room was well heated and very quaintly decorated. My only complaint on the room was the mattress was very hard, not just hard very very hard. The staff / managment / owners of whom seem to take 4 hour shifts on reception all could do no more to be helpful and courteous.. We where only in Venice for the one night before moving on and with there guidance we managed to achieve all the major tourist traps and secure a booking at a lovely recommended restaurant. Location wise could simply not be better located to all the major sites. Would stay again and it deserves it's status as one of Venice's best hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Magical!”
Reviews.Author: Fierydormouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the Junior suite. Expensive - but well worth every penny! Service was friendly and kind. I really think if I had asked for a bevvy of mermaids to frolick in the canal for my entertainment every morning, they would have tried their best to arrange it! Such nice people. Breakfast was great, excellent choice - my favourite was the banana and chocolate pancakes! The dining room/bar is beautiful, although I understand in summer guests eat on the terrace looking over the bridge, which must also be lovely. The junior suite is stunning - opening directly onto the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge. The room was beautifully furnished and very large. The bathroom was quite small (for a suite) but perfectly clean and functional. Put simply, I cannot rate this place highly enough. Quite possibly it's the best hotel I have ever stayed in and we very much hope to go back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden jewel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Traveladvisortoo
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at their private dock to when you depart they will take care of you in sublime style. Friendly and warm staff day and night. Charming breakfast/afternoon drink room overlooking the canal and Rialto Bridge. Centrally located. Boutique feel. The place to stay. Only nine rooms so book early.

Reviews.Title: “*****Incredible!*****”
Reviews.Author: WorldWide B
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at Al Ponte Antico you're greated by such warmth and gusto! The hotel is right in the heart of Venice, but sheltered from the hustle and bustle down a quaint little street. The hoteliers inform you of the building's history - a 14th Century Palace, no less, and the rooms are sensational. Breakfast is an event in itself you'll look forward to each morning! You can choose from hot and cold dishes and Rosalda will cook you any egg/pancake/crepe or omellette dish you like! The staff are always on hand to make divine coffees and teas and engage in conversations. Teamed with the incredible beauty of 'Al Ponte Antico' is the charm and kindness of its staff and owners. They delight in telling you the history of Venice/the hotel and how to get free Gondala rides to see the glass factories on Murano as well as other insider tips! I can't recommend this hotel enough - not only will you have a restful, indulgent stay (the beds are exceptionally comfortable!) but you'll feel instantly at home. Unforgettable hotel - can't wait to go back! x

Reviews.Title: “A very well run small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 1FussyTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Al Ponte Antico for four nights at the end November. This was our first trip to Venice and I spent quite a bit of time researching options online (including reading numerous TripAdvisor reviews). We were looking for a higher-end hotel with a room in the â‚¬400-500 per night bracket. In many locations this would not be a problem, but in Venice this was a bit of a challenge. Looking through all the well known luxury hotels I was disconcerted by the number of reports of poor service that guests received. I selected this hotel based on its good service reviews and then hoped for the best. Luckily we weren't disappointed. We caught a water taxi from Marco Polo airport to the hotel. This a great way to arrive. First impressions were good, with Oliver taking great care to make us feel welcome. The hotel itself is small, with only 9 rooms. We booked a junior suite, overlooking the Grand Canal. The room was a resonable size and pleasantly decorated. Its main downside was the bathroom, which was very 'cosy' with a small shower cubicle and a shower that only delivered warm (rather than hot) water. I enjoyed the view over the Grand Canal and agree with other writers' comments that it's a pity the Rialto Bridge is covered in graffitti. Obviously that not the hotel's fault! Positives of the hotel are: - The staff. They are outstanding at their jobs and provide the sort of welcome that all small hotels should offer. - Location. Overlooking the Grand Canal and in such close proximity to the Rialto Bridge. - The breakfast/bar area. There is a nice small buffet in the mornings and they also cook pancakes and omelettes to order. - The building and its decor. There aren't really many negatives. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but there are so many places to eat within a few minutes' walk that this isn't an issue. Overall I feel this is a tremendous hotel and wish Bruno, Matteo, their family and colleagues the continued success that they deserve.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Rob N
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice 3 times. This hotel is the "top of the top", by far the best in Venice I've stayed in, but also one of the best hotels I've stayed in the world. The service of the brothers running their father's hotel was fantastic, in particular their recommendations for dinner were superb. The breakfast was also great, in an excellently-decorated room with gold-specked plaster and wonderful old master paintings, the service fantastic and the eggs were the best I've ever had. Our room was a canal view room on the ground floor, with the landing dock as our private verandah, with a view of the Rialto - unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Berlin68
Reviews.Content: Last October we stayed for 4 nights at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel. We found this wonderful boutique hotel through Tripadvisor. The hotel is located in an old venetian palace right at the Grand Canal and has been rejuvenated with a lot of love, taste and attention to detail. Our room was very cozy and the service was outstanding. The terrace where one can have breakfast or drinks in the evening offers a splendid view on the famous Rialto bridge and the always busy Grand Canal. The owners, Matteo and his brother Bruno, both multi-lingual, gave us such a warm welcome that we felt like coming home. During the entire stay they provided a first class service which made our visit to Venice an extremely pleasant one. Matteo and Bruno answered all our questions promptly and gave us excellent advice (on museums, markets, restaurants, shops, boat trips, etc.) going well beyond what a travel guide book normally offers. One important highlight of the day was the FUNtastic breakfast. Wonderful coffees, tasty omelets, crepes, fruits, etc., etc. Breakfast in paradise can not be better. We recommend with great pleasure the Al Ponte Antico to anyone who would like to experience a joyful visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: AntjeMuller
Reviews.Content: The hotel stays in a true venetian palace with a great view of the Grand Canal and the Rialto bridge. The room is very cozy and the service is the best that a hotel can offer. Thanks a lot for all the staff of Al Ponte Antico. You made our stay in Venice just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way!”
Reviews.Author: MrAllardice
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in an excellent location with exceptionally helpful staff. I would strongly recommend to anyone, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A Venetian Paradise..”
Reviews.Author: Peter_and_Gemma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at Al Ponte Antico on our honeymoon, booking the Junior Suite to match the occasion. We were not to be disappointed. We were warmly greeted by Matteo on arrival and he gave us a short tour of his hotel, before showing us to the Suite. It was simply breath-taking with wonderful views from our room onto the bustling Grand Canal & the famous Rialto bridge. Matteo had also left us a nice chilled bottle of fine Prosecco which was a lovely touch. The friendliness & warmth from the other members of staff matched Matteo's hospitality. Bruno, Oliver, Thomas & Rosalda greeted us by name on first meeting us and their friendliness was true & genuine. Bruno and Oliver were especially helpful in recommending places to visit in Venice...and the wonderful Rosalda made our breakfast each morning a real joy. The breakfast buffet was extensive and quite simply delicious. It was a little too chilly to take breakfast on the terrace when we visited in November, but the staff still ensured we had a lovely table in the dining area facing out onto the Grand Canal. Don't hesitate to book this hotel, OK it's a little more expensive than others, but we felt it was worth every single penny for the quite wonderful Venetian experience we had. Thank you Matteo, Oliver, Bruno, Rosalda and Thomas...you made our honeymoon an un-forgettable experience. Peter and Gemma (Belfast, Northern Ireland)

Reviews.Title: “There are no other hotels in Venice....only Al Ponte Antico”
Reviews.Author: Dilo-Jake
Reviews.Content: The only thing more dear than the hotel is feeling that you are so welcome in their special place in Venice. This hotel is very popular and with Matteo and Bruno unwilling to let the hotels popularity get to their head they deliver hospitality as if you were the first and most important customer. Rooms are a piece of art as are the common areas of the hotel. Breakfasts are as good as they get. The only negative is that by writing ANOTHER good review it becomes increasingly difficult to book on short notice to this fabulous spot in such a fabulous City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: Exceptional hotel with attentive service from the multi-lingual Bruno, Matteo, Oliver (thanks for the prosecos and Aperol) and others. Ample hot breakfasts with eggs and coffees prepared to order. Special thanks to Rosalba! Spacious room with period furnishings. Minibar included. We had Room 101 which looked across the terrace to the canal, and yet there was no noise from the canal which we noticed. While very close to the Rialto Bridge, it is an easy walk to St. Mark's as well as to other neighborhoods. And, even tho located near a large department store, the hotel itself is very quiet. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Virgin Islands National Park, St. John
Reviews.Title: “Living in a friends palace”
Reviews.Author: ISLANDATTORNEY
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel thru trip advisor, and we're very glad we did. We had to overcome hesitation at the price, but I have to say we were delighted with our "splurge". The location is perfect, with a terrace for breakfast -- or anytime -- for overlooking the canal. We are senior citizens & need a balance between wandering & resting. This gave us the perfect spot for both. When we needed a break, we could perch on the terrace & watch the fascinating world on the water go by. The room was palatial and the owners treated us like visiting friends. They both came to personally see us off on our water taxi to the airport with kisses. Imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrilor
Reviews.Content: A very special hotel. Superb period features and very comfortable palatial bedroom with view onto the Grand Canal. The most important thing is the quality of service. I do not believe I have ever stayed anywhere where the owners and staff are so attentive to their guests. Nothing is too much trouble. They all remember your names and always have time to talk to you and provide as much information as you need. Breakfast was of a high quality and could be eaten on the terrace overlookig the Rialto bridge if you wanted. The owners recommended us to an excellent restaurant ( Fiaschetteria Toscana) which they booked for us which I think helped to make sure we got a good table I would unhesitatingly recommend it to anyone wanting a quality friendly hotel in the centre of Venice

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it is perfect”
Reviews.Author: goinsoon
Reviews.Content: No need to say more. It is all true. Two nights were not enough. Thank you Mateo, Bruno and Oliver for the most wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to propose”
Reviews.Author: FerdyPoint
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered Al Ponte Antico we knew this was a really special boutique hotel. The team were welcoming and knew our names and could not do enough to ensure we enjoyed their Hotel and their City. Our room overlooking the canal was magnificent and close to the terrace offerring a stunning view over the Rialto Bridge. Matteo and Bruno and all the team were perfect hosts and so pleased to help us when we asked about directions, vaporetti etc etc. In a city where tourist restaurants abound they also offered us wise suggestions on restaurants which meant we ate like Venetians not out of towners. This really is a brilliant hotel and I have to say is probably the best I've stayed in; including some big hitters in various cities. So perfect was the view from the terrace I abandoned plans to propose in the Piazza and did it here instead. A special memory of a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: notrichbutchoosy
Reviews.Content: No wonder this is on the Top 25 best hotel list! Beautifuly decorated rooms and hotel. The service was absolutely amazing. Wonderfully charming and helpful owners. They really took care of us and had the best tips on local restaurants and places to visit. The location is unbeatable with unforgetable breakfast views from the hotel balcony to the Rialto. Once in a lifetime unforgettable experience for us and I would really love to go back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel in a great part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mark787
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Antico is a converted 14-century palazzo in the Cannaregio district that is run by a couple of brothers who insist upon personalized service for all the guests. The hotel and its rooms are absolutely gorgeous. Breakfast was the best we had in Italy (especially the made-to-order crepes) and the breakfast terrace overlooking the Grand Canal is stunning. Cannaregio is not nearly as touristy as San Marco but offers plenty of shops and restaurants. It's a short 10-minute walk to the heart of Piazza San Marco. Love the Al Ponte Antico!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad & the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: chitowngirl55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Al Ponte Antico for 3 nights in September. The owner of the hotel warmly greeted us and gave us a tour of the common areas of the small hotel. Decorated in the Venetian style, the dining room is a lovely setting to enjoy the breakfast buffet that included an assortment of pastries, meats and cheeses, fruit and made to order omelets. Cappuccinos and lattes are offered each morning and drinks are served throughout the afternoon and evening which can be enjoyed on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. Now for the not-so-good: our room, located directly behind the computer desk in the dining area, was very dark due to insufficient lighting and one small window, the bed and pillows were very hard, the worn blanket was not covered with a top sheet, and the air conditioning was not able to properly cool the room due to its high ceilings. The low ceiling in the bathroom made standing in the tub to shower impossible for a person over 5'7" tall. Finally to the ugly: this hotel is located on the famous Grand Canal with a view of the equally famous Rialto Bridge. The Rialto Bridge is covered with graffiti and has a steady stream of tourists elbowing their way across throughout the day to buy cheap souvenirs. The Grand Canal is Venice's equivalent to Chicago's Eisenhower Expressway. As lifelong urban residents, we prefer a more quiet location and would choose a hotel in an area further from St. Mark's Plaza. If you prefer to be close to St. Mark's this hotel would be an advantage.

Reviews.Title: “The new Doge”
Reviews.Author: Gastro_7
Reviews.Content: Truly, a night in the "Jr. Suite" was beyond my means, so (unknown to the wife) I went for broke and booked four nights. We previously stayed at their sister Venetian facility, Locanda Orseolo, so we knew that in addition to the exceptional, friendly and professional staff, there would also be a wonderful buffett breakfast (including chocolate, banana crepes by Matteo). What I didn't realize was how fabulous the "Jr. Suite" (108) actually was. The entire hotel is outstanding, but in that room in particular, I felt as thought I'd been annointed the new Doge of Venice. I hereby declare this to have been the most worthwhile extravagence of my life. Our sincere thanks to Oliver, Armando, Max, Tommaso, Rosalba, Menelio and (of course) Matteo (who's really not that handsome - it's the clothes) for an exceptional experience at the Al Ponte Antico.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: KMuckey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel to round out the last few days of our vacation. The service was impeccable, and the location was great. The rooms were decorated in true Venetian style and thankfully had "air conditioning". The bed was a little hard, but we slept well after walking and sightseeing all day. This boutique hotel only has 9 rooms and we got one of the rooms with a view of the canal. We could see the Rialto Bridge from our window. It was also great to step out of our room and have breakfast available. This hotel has a neat sitting area along the canal and you can just enjoy watching the boat traffic. I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Tropicalsplendor
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Antico delivers the ultimate Venetian experience -- awakening to chocolate/banana/creme crepes and cafe latte overlooking the Grand Canal and Rialto bridge, gazing upon gondolas as they glide up the canal. Does it get any better than this??? This petite, restored castle along the Grand Canal welcomes its guests with warmth and expertise. The walls and flooring are in pristine condition, and artifacts along the ceilings of the main room are being restored to their original castle condition. All on staff are professional and knowledgeable, finding us those special dining gems where the true Italians spent their evenings, giving us a glimpse of the true experience. The guests who share this space are the most discriminating, so many joy-filled hours were spent chatting it up with Brits and Scots on the deck, to the wee hours of the morning, enjoying fine wine and beer. Matteo and Oliver are two of the finest hoteliers Iâ€™ve ever experienced. They guided us through Venice, adding joy to our trip! My son and I stayed in the deluxe room (blue and gold) featured on the website -- just off the patio, it is an ideal location with a view of the Grand Canal. A fine choice! It was quite large, with a sitting area -- perfect for relaxing after a warm summer day out in the bustle. Everything was spotlessly manicured. Nice robes and complimentary slippers provided. The buffet was to die for!!! Best of all was the service. If youâ€™re looking for a special spot to be pampered and spoiled, you have found it! Your wish is their command! I canâ€™t imagine staying anywhere else! I had considered the Danieli, but it was a tad too lavish. This is the perfect spot, although well-hidden.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MacTuffin
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as we wanted a Venetian experience rather than some corporate chain and we weren't disappointed! A small and somewhat quirky 'palazzo' but it's sumptuous decor, perfect location and very attentive staff made ours a truly wonderful stay in Venice. Matteo and his team go out of their way to make it special and I would thoroughly recommend guests to take Bruno's daily tips for exploring the city & it's sights. His morning briefings over breakfast meant we got a sense of the real Venice, without missing any of the major attractions - no mean feat in a town jammed full of us tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, quiet location, and lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Irone
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more delighted with this hotel. Matteo and Oliver offered excellent restaurant suggestions and arranged a water taxi at 5 AM to the airport! Everything was seamless. The only thing I would have liked was a bit more light in our inside room. The cleanliness of this boutique hotel and friendliness of staff were exceptional. We would definitely return but book a room on the lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Janstroh
Reviews.Content: Truly, I could not afford one night in the canal front "Jr. Suite" so, unknown to my wife, I booked four. We've stayed previously at their sister Venetian facility, Locanda Orseolo, so we knew that the staff would be exceptional, friendly and the ultimate professionals. There also would be a wonderful buffet breakfast (chocolate banana crepes by Matteo). What I didn't realize was how fabulous the "Jr Suite" ( Rm. 108) actually was. In that room you are transformed into the reigning Dodge of Venice. I hereby declare this to have been my most WORTHWHILE extravagence ever ! Sincere thanks to Matteo (he's not that handsome.. it's really the clothes), Oliver, Armando, Max, Tommaso, Rosalba & Menelio for our exceptional experience at the Al Ponte Antico.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: BigWorldViews
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Venice! My wife and I arrived at the Al Ponte Antico hotel by water taxi and were greeted by Mateo as the boat arrived. His greeted us by our first names and this was the start of a service level second to none. Our room was a good size and beautifully decorated in a style perfectly suited to a Venice experience. The bathroom was large with double sinks, the bed was very comfortable and the entire room was spotless. Air conditioning was fantastic, a welcome relief to escape the humidity during the hot afternoons. The decor in the breakfast room was amazing, original ceilings and tapestries however the crown jewel of the hotel is the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. If you truly want to experience Venice, the unique opportunity to overlook the Grand Canal, seeing the city come to life on the water is one not to be missed. It's also a great spot to relax at night, enjoy a drink or just take in the scenery. Breakfast buffet (included) was very nice and included a choice of eggs or crepes, both of which were excellent! We also appreciated the use of the computer located in the breakfast area. Wireless is also available throughout the hotel. The hotel is centrally located, very close to the Rialto bridge. It's also only a short walk (10 minutes) to St. Mark's Square. The staff are professional and always willing to help. Plenty of suggestions for dinner and sites to see and always a pleasant greeting on return! Mateo and staff made us feel that they genuinely cared that our stay in Venice would be a memorable one! When we return to Venice, this is the hotel we will choose.

Reviews.Title: “3 Glorious Days on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: RedondoDave
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find on TripAdvisor. We arrived on foot and the directions given to us were excellent. Oliver and Matteo welcomed us to the hotel and we had a beautiful room overlooking the Grand Canal. Oliver helped us with our sightseeing and gave us great suggestions for restaurants. We enjoyed having a drink with a snack in the afternoon on the terrace watching the busy canal. Our room was very large with high ceilings. The breakfasts were great with a crepe or eggs cooked to order. Look forward to returning sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream!”
Reviews.Author: DorienD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Al Ponte Antico to celebrate our 25th anniversary; everything the other reviewers write is true. The warm welcome with champagne for our celebration,the helpful advice, the lovely little talks and the beautiful clean rooms and superb breakfast. The most beautiful is the balcony that everybody can use. We had a room with view on the Canal Grande but you don't need it, you can sit the whole day on the balcony and watch the traffic. Tip: spend money on a watertaxi to get to the hotel, it's worth it! Matteo thank you again and we hope to come back. Hubert and Dorien

Reviews.Title: “One of my all time favorites”
Reviews.Author: CBinPV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were treated like royalty by the entire staff at this beautiful little boutique hotel overlooking the Grand Canal with a view of the Rialto Bridge in Venice. We were late getting to our hotel and the staff called us by name when we walked in the door and told us they were worried about us. It was very romantic at night setting on the terrace watching the gondolas go by while listening to a jazz concert on the the other side of the canal and drinking one of their specialty drinks from the bar. The room was small but comfortable and beautifully decorated in perfect Italian. They also serve a great breakfast buffet. I cannot say enough about our wonderful experience. My only regret is that we did not stay long enough.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RBK00007
Reviews.Content: great hotel, great location, great staff. Highly recommend. RK

Reviews.Title: “A Small Oasis Near the Rialto Bridge”
Reviews.Author: Carole I
Reviews.Content: Thanks solely to Trip Advisor, we chose the Al Ponte Antico for three days in late September, 2011. I rate it most highly for its amazing, helpful staff; the stunning breakfast with a millionaire's view of the canal and the bridge; the quiet, well-equipped rooms. When we arrived, Max hustled our friends with their luggage most expertly over to the sister hotel, where they were staying. We received detailed maps, personalized suggestions for restaurants, superb care with transportation, etc. Yes, the hotel was old and small (hello, it is Venice), but the young owners have done their best to make it welcoming and atmospheric. Nine rooms, tucked away from the very busy streets. NOTE: we were told that in August on weekends, the cruise ships can disgorge as many as 35,000 people at one time. Ugh. I would check with the cruise line before I booked that city. We arrived with Azamara Quest, a small boutique cruise line, and will choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sacullucas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days in this Hotel. We were delighted! This is a small hotel that made our stay in Venice a dream come true. The location is excellent: close to the Ponte Rialto. From there is easy to walk all around the city. The place is beautifully decorated. The service was fantastic! Mateo, the owner and his crew were making sure that every detail was taken care off. Mateo cooked breakfast one morning, and we could tell that he enjoyed making the guests feel at home. Every one from the hotel greeted us (all the family) by our names and gave us great recommendations for visiting places, restaurants, etc. You won't find this kind of service in any "standard" hotel even if it is much more expensive. The hotel has a patio that overlooks the Grand Canal were we had breakfast and some snacks when we came back. Visiting Venice staying at Al Ponte Antico made our trip so much enjoyable that next time in Venice this will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Fender69
Reviews.Content: The owner and staff are simply terrific. Friendly helpful and totally committed to making your stay in Venice a great experience. The location and outside patio are terrific as is the breakfast and large clean rooms. To be highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel - the best!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel - we can't imagine a more wonderful place to stay in Venice! The location, the rooms and times on the terrace (breakfast in the mornings, cocktails in the afternoons) were surpassed only by the incredible warmth and hospitality of the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ryers
Reviews.Content: I dont know where to start really, we booked this hotel as part of our daughter and new son in laws wedding present and from start to finish we could not fault this hotel from the rooms which were beautiful to the little terrace which overlooked the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge and the wonderful staff who carried out our every wish with charm and efficiancy. The staff also have the knack of remembering everyones name after only being told once, how do they do that? Breakfast every morning was a delight as Minni would cook you whatever you wanted from Bacon and Eggs to delicious pancakes and the best coffe in Italy made exactly how you wanted it after only being told once. We sat on the terrace every morning whatching the whole of life passing by on the canal. So lucky too as on the day we arrived there was a regatta on the canal with a wonderful historic proccession followed by boat racing of which we had a ringside view. To the owner Matteo and all his staff Oliver, Max, Rosaba, David, Armand, Minni and last but not least the lovely lovely Thomas Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and Service on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: JanelleTroy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms in August 2011 on our first family trip to Venice. My husband and I were in Room 102, a canal view "Deluxe" room just to the right of the breakfast room on the 2nd floor, while the kids were in Room 104, a "Classic" room away from the canal on the same floor. The windows of Room 102 open directly onto a slightly-blindered view of the Grand Canal (see photo of view from room) while the windows of the other Deluxe room on this floor, Room 101, have more panoramic views of the Grand Canal but look out directly onto the breakfast patio where people congregate in the morning and afternoons/evenings for drinks. Personally we preferred the privacy of Room 102 since we spent quite a bit of time mornings and afternoons on the breakfast patio to enjoy the panoramic views of the Rialto Bridge and up the Grand Canal. Room 104 is a darker room, overlooking the entrance to the hotel at the end of a narrow alley. Both rooms were very clean and had high ceilings. The bathroom in 102 is small and the shower a little tight but the ceiling is high and the shower itself was great. The bathroom in 104 is bigger, but due to the architecture of the building the ceiling over the tub/shower is really low (definitely less than 6 feet). Both rooms had ample closet space but not a lot of drawer space. We really did not think the beds were too hard per other reviews, and the rooms are quiet at night â€“we had no problem sleeping. The only thing I did not love about the rooms was something that did not bother the rest of the family and is not something I have seen mentioned in other reviews, so maybe I am very sensitive, but I personally found that the smell of the cleaning products used in the rooms was somewhat overwhelming â€“ not an antiseptic/bleach or citrusy scent, but more of a heavily perfumed scent that gave me a headache. Perhaps it would have dissipated if we had kept the windows open, but it was just so very hot and humid outside that we really could not do that. During our stay, Oliviero, who introduced himself to the kids as Oliver, really took us under his wing and gave us directions and recommendations (and me Italian lessons, which I desperately needed). He is very engaging and the kids loved him. Also Rosalba was incredibly sweet and attentive at breakfast. A short walk over the Rialto Bridge we had the best dinner of our trip to Italy at Al Paradiso, on Calle Paradiso â€“ great lambchops and the best seafood risotto ever, and a minor celebrity sighting - Gerry Bamman (Uncle Frank from Home Alone)!

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing time”
Reviews.Author: goodtrips01
Reviews.Content: This was my family's (husband and parents) third time to Venice. This hotel and the staff made me fall in love with Venice like I didn't think was possible! The staff were honestly nicer than any staff of any hotel I have ever been to. To say they make you feel truly welcome is an understatement. The view from the terrace (where we spent many hours) was mesmerizing.And the Spritzes served are wonderful (perfectly strong and tasty). Breakfasts were beautiful (lovely omelets). My parents had a room right next to the terrace and we had one next to the landing dock (one deluxe and one superior room) Both rooms were quiet and dark thanks to very good windows and shutters. Arrive by private water taxi right to the hotel for a lovely start to your stay.My mother said this was her favorite hotel in the world...followed by the Villa Ducale in Sicily. It was unforgettable. You must stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Room for Caution!”
Reviews.Author: BobMc
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant hotel which is very well situated near the Rialto Bridge, The view from the terrace is fantastic but unless one has a forward facing room the remainder are dark and somewhat depressing though well appointed. The staff could not do more to make ones stay comfortable and we would have given the hotel a higher score had we been able to secure forward facing room. In fairness to Mateao the owner, at the time of booking we realised that we were not going to get a front facing room but we lived in hope of cancelation. So, would we go back? Yes but only if we could book a canal view. One last tip, take the water taxi form the airport. The hotel has its own quay which makes transfers very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view! Fantastic service! Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa0330
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all the grand reviews on Trip Advisor. It really is a "must stay". The minute we arrived on the hotel's private dock on the grand canal, we felt as though we were the most important guest they've ever had. We were met immediately by David and the owner: Matteo. They took care of our luggage (and we had plenty since this was a cruise vacation), they showed us to our room, and then proceeded to show us to the most fantastic part of the hotel--the patio area looking out over the grand canal and the Rialto Bridge. My visit to Venice could have been fine had I just stayed on that patio watching all the business of the grand canal sipping fine wine or cappuccinos. One thing I have to add is to splurge and take a water taxi to the hotel. You will love the scenery along the way. The hotel has its own private dock, so you are transported directly to the hotel. Unless you want to wander around the small walking streets of Venice with your luggage in tow, you will not regret the water taxi route. The room was large and had a great view of the canal. We felt somewhat like we were living back in the victorian era. The bathroom was small, but had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable, especially after walking the streets of Venice. Matteo and staff were always attentive and friendly. The recommendation they gave for dinner was fabulous. We would have never thought to go to the small restaurant thinking a place on the canal would have been preferred. The breakfast was a feast! Made to order eggs, hot & cold food, fresh fruit and delicious cappuccinos. We definitely ate plenty to get us through the strolls around Venice and St. Mark's Square. Our only regret is that we had only one night here. This hotel is the ONLY place we will stay when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The best service I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Francesca B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a beautiful, tranquil retreat in the center of an extremely crowded city. Matteo, the owner, showed us around the hotel with pride, but it was Oliver, the manager, who gave us the most personal service I have ever had. The entire staff was wonderful. One example: when we went to breakfast after our first night, the server called my children by their names without being introduced to them!

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic Return to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Scode
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice for our 25th Wedding Anniversary - it was the most wonderful return after 25th years! Matteo and his team of staff were so helpful and hospitable hosts. Situated right on the canal we had the most spectacular view of the rialto. We sat with a glass of champagne waving at all the gondoliers passing by - it truly was as good as that! The canival was on during our stay and although at times very busy it was wonderful to see all the fabulous costumes. The breakfast room - one of the old palace rooms - elegantly furnished but all gave intimacy and the staff waited on us each morning with a great smile and full of chatter for the day! They were always able to suggest places to visit and give us great advice on where to eat each evening. We were never disappointed. The perfect place to stay with the perfect hosts - a real family run boutique hotel - 5* standard! We hope to be back ... thank you Matteo!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and superb service”
Reviews.Author: CarolynHa
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel by default, as we were transferred from their sister Locanda Orseolo - but I was more than happy with this arrangement. Our initial dealings with the staff were friendly, and when we arrived early with our bags, having disembarked from our cruise at 10am, we were welcomed and shown around the property and amenities, with apologies that our room was not ready. We had never expected it to be, and were very surprised that we were able to use it within the hour - which we had spent catching our breath and using the hotels wifi to catch up on some urgent business, sitting on the breakfast balcony. We had an internal room, the door came straight off from the bar area - but we would never have known it - it was peaceful. No view, but a beautiful room. High ceilings, and what a ceiling... the whole place has the most amazing internal architecture. The bathroom was huge - double vanity and large shower over bath, as well as another small area to store our luggage. The views from the balcony over the Grand Canal and Rialto bridge are stunning. We felt very spoiled. But, was makes this hotel are its staff - all those we dealt with made us feel more than welcome, used our names and recognised us even if they hadn't met us. Our late return from dinner introduced us to another staff person we had never seen before, but he knew our names before we had even asked for our key, and made conversation about our plans for the next day. Matteo himself gave us a great suggestion for dinner and even called to make the booking for us. This place was memorable for us not just for the amazing location, but also for the staff who took time to talk to us and make us feel at home. Breakfast was another fantastic experience, and we were sad to leave for the next part of our journey. Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “Dreaming of Our Return to Venice and the Al Ponte Antico Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rlohall
Reviews.Content: Venice was the first stop for me and my husband on our honeymoon in Italy, and what a way to kick off our honeymoon! We chose to stay at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel based on the stellar reviews found on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed...this hotel is amazing and lives up to the 5 star reviews! I donâ€™t think I can adequately articulate the fabulousness of this hotel, its employees, and their very warm hospitality. The hotel's location is conveniently close to the Rialto Bridge but tucked away at the end of a quiet side street. The hotel has a private dock which made for easy arrival and departure via water taxi. We splurged and booked the Junior Suite, which has a large window that opens to the Grand Canal. This view is amazing! You are right on the water and have the best view of the Rialto Bridge and all the activity on the Grand Canal. The Junior Suite is quite large with a nice sitting area and desk by the window. The bathroom was a bit narrow and our room's walls seemed thin but these two issues were not enough of a bother to deter us from staying here again. In fact, I am dying to return to Venice and this hotel! Mateo, Rosalba, Oliver, Tommaso, etc., were so wonderful to us and made us feel so special. They all went above and beyond to make our stay a special one. Because it was our honeymoon, we were treated to a bottle of prosecco, which we enjoyed on our first night as we gazed out at our window at a moonlit Rialto Bridge and listened to the sounds of the passing boats and gondolas and the waves lapping against the hotel. Mateo was also so nice as to mail some letters for us back to the US. I think the best memories for us, which my husband and I still talk about, were those mornings spent on the terrace enjoying the most lovely breakfast in full view of the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge. Mateo's omelets were delicious, as was the rest of the buffet of fresh fruits, pastries, yogurts, etc. And sweet Rosalba always made sure my coffee cup was full. My husband and I still reminisce about those mornings, breathing the fresh morning air, watching the morning traffic on the Grand Canal, eating the most wonderful breakfast, and planning our day in beautiful Venice. It was truly a magnificent start to our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Perch Family Hotels are the best!”
Reviews.Author: 30thanniversary
Reviews.Content: First we stayed in another family hotel in Venice the Locanda Orseola and it did not disappoint in any way. How can this hotel be any less spectacular with Mateo Peruch now running it?! His wife Barbara still runs the other one. I would like to know of other hotels they own and run in Europe. Stay with the Peruch Family! Like us, you'll be happy with your choice

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to keep this fabulous hotel a secret (selfish I know!)”
Reviews.Author: motherofthebride35
Reviews.Content: I first visited this FABULOUS HOTEL just after it opened with Mateo in charge. (Four years ago) It was my sixtieth birthday and my friends and I virtually filled the entire hotel. Following a life threatening health scare I truly did feel that not only had I survived, but in this beautiful hotel I had found Heaven on earth. You have to go to understand the fabulous position, the care and attention of all the staff and the wonderful Mateo SO CARING and THOUGHTFUL How ever did they remember all of our names? Armando and Oliver were also great recommending restaurants for the evening. I came home and started to write a glowing review and then (selfishly) decided that I wanted to keep this special place to myself . Clearly not everyone felt like me and hence its high ratings. The position of this hotel is fantastic over looking the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge. To arrive in the early evening (just as the lights are coming on) by water taxi is absolutely magical, just like stepping back in time. The taxi from the airport is not cheap but it is worth it as it is MUCH faster than the water bus and a great way to see part of the grand canal.On arrival you pull up to the front of the Hotel and are treated like honoured guests. The decor is typically Venetian...stunning! Not all the rooms have a canal view but this does not matter at all as the balcony is where you can have a drink, eat breakfast and if you are there for the first Sunday in September watch the regatta. I love it so much I have tried to go back every year ever since I found this heavenly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If booked, change your plans”
Reviews.Author: gone-frequently
Reviews.Content: The bottom line for this boutique hotel is - If you can't obtain a reservation for your travel date, change your date! We stayed three days and could have stayed longer simply for the hotel and it's staff. We are considering trying several of Matteo's other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: rick486
Reviews.Content: Can't add anything to the superlatives already made in other reviews on this hotel. The owner Matteo and staff (Oliver and others) made our stay memorable with wonderfully attentive service. As stated by others, the morning breakfasts was sumptuous and the morning view from the patio of all the boat traffic on the Grand Canal was magnificant. Recommend the "Venice Spritzer" on the patio from Oliver and staff after a hot day of walking around Venice. On most occasions, we were the only ones out there enjoying the view of the Rialto bridge about a block away. On our last day Oliver arranged for our water taxi to pick us up from the front dock at the hotel and take us directly to our ship. Hotel is down a tiny alleyway from the main "street" and is easy to miss when first locating the hotel. Wireless internet is included (I think) but if you didn't bring your laptop, there is one available in the breakfast area which is connected to the internet. Hotel is very centrally located to all areas of Venice

Reviews.Title: “So glad we choose this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sandandsunloverMD
Reviews.Content: There is only one place to stay in Venice that is centrally located, offering personal service, and a spectacular veranda overlooking the Grand Canal -- the Al Ponte Antico! Every morning we enjoyed our eggs and crepes made to order out on the veranda with the most impeccable service. Every evening we enjoyed a drink out on the veranda as we watched all the traffic along the canal and the lights. We had a beautiful view of the Rialto Bridge. This is a small hotel with great attention to those staying here. You are immediately greeted by your name every time you return after a day's touring. Because it is a small hotel, the rooms are all very different and unique. Matteo, the owner, and his staff are like family with a goal to ensure their guest's comfort. We were a family of 5 using three rooms and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Maria186534
Reviews.Content: What a welcome,a gorgeouse hotel with the most attentive staff. We had a fantastic stay thanks to our wonderful host Matteo and his lovely staff. This small hotel is right in the heart of Venice and is a welcomed escape from the hustle and bustle just outside. This is a must to stay in if you are visiting Venice. Thank you Matteo so much. Maria & Barry

Reviews.Title: “the most elegant hotel of our european trip”
Reviews.Author: sunshine34217
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights a this wonderful boutique hotel (only 9 rooms) The staff and the owner were the great but the best part was our nightly cappucino out on the balcony overlooking the canal and the Realto Bridge. It was breathtaking and very romantic. After our dinner and night on the town it was just a beautiful place to end a wonderful evening. Breakfast -which was incredible- was served there also. The owner, Matteo, has a few other similar hotels which we would love to visit. Everything about our stay was unsurpassable!

Reviews.Title: “Oh yes! Spot on!”
Reviews.Author: Christian_Jacobs
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed in this hotel during our visit to Venice. We have visited Venice few times before but this was the best ever and although the stay was a little bit more expensive but it was worth every penny!!! It has made our stay wonderful and we are planning the trip and saving the money to come back next year!! If you ever go to Venice don't hesitate to stay in the place as it's based on Grand Canal and you are in the heart of wonderful city of the mystery and charm! You can enjoy the Grand Canal in solitude from this place and if you are not the one for the tourist crowds try it out! Unforgettable holiday indeed! Memories will be cherished forever!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: nniko
Reviews.Content: This hotel is expensive, but other than that there's nothing to complain about and plenty to love. It's in a lovingly-remodeled old palace right on the Grand Canal, with beautiful furnishings, an ideal location very near the Rialto Bridge, and wonderful views from the canal-side rooms and from the hotel's canal-side terrace. It's very small and family-run, and the owner was clearly very proud of it when he showed us around after check-in. The breakfast buffet was wonderful - many many dishes, including some hot dishes made to order. The staff was always extremely helpful and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Second time as wonderful as the first”
Reviews.Author: jchBCS
Reviews.Content: We first visited this hotel in 2008 and enjoyed every minute of it so we returned again this year for four nights. Venice, of course, is a mystical place, and it somehow manages to inspire even with the relentless crowds that dominate all the most famous sites. The Al Ponte Antico is the perfect island of tranquility away from the crowds, where you can view the Grand Canal in relative solitude. The hotel's balcony/patio overlooks that canal, with an expansive view extending from the Rialto Bridge on one side, to several hundred yards of historic buildings along the banks of the canal as it curves out of sight on the other. My wife and I found this view to be endlessly entertaining as the city's ordinary life went on before us, with delivery boats, garbage boats, taxi boats, police boats, vaporettos, gondolas and countless other means of water transport passing before us. Having a spritz in our hands as we took all this in was an added bonus! I think that the charms of Venice would suffice to reward any journey there. However, the ideal location of the Al Ponte Antico, combined with the warm and attentive owner and staff, makes ones stay in Venice truly memorable. The hotel is Paruch family owned and Mateo Paruch spends at least half of each day at the hotel, and is a pleasure to chat with. Among many other courtesies, he suggested and reserved excellent restaurants for our dinners every evening. Also, knowing that the day of our arrival was my birthday, he saw to it that a chilled bottle of Prosecco awaited us in our room. His staff, Max, Rosalba, Armando, Oliver and Tommaso, are all friendly and pleasant -- and efficient. From when we first arrived at the dock until we left, we were addressed by our first names and were made to feel part of a very warm family. Incidentally, our room was very comfortable, with effective air conditioning (which was essential when we were there), a spacious bathroom and a shower that, unlike most we encountered in Italy, you could actually move around in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: DDtravelTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband, two adult children and I stayed at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel in Venice for two nights. The owner was an absolute delight and glad to help in any way. Our room faced the Grand Canal. We felt like we were on the water and could touch the boats passing. Such a fun experience! The upstairs veranda was a lovely place to start the day with a very nice breakfast included in the price. The rooms are well appointed with period pieces, modern bathroom setups and working AC. Five minute walk to St. Mark's Square and 2 minutes to Rialta Bridge---fantastic location!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradisio”
Reviews.Author: trishgio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel and were treated as Venetian nobility by the entire staff of the hotel. It is a small boutique hotel located directly on the Grand Canal with a view of the Rialto bridge.The personal attention from the staff, who know everyone by their first names make it seem more like you are staying in someone's private villa. The hotel's location is perfect being close to all of the major sites and not very far from Piazzale San Marco which is a hub of activity. The owner, Matteo, and his staff (Oliviero & Tomas) could not have done more to make our stay exceptional. My husband and I had a very spacious room over the terrace where breakfast is served and right off the gorgeous dining room. Ask the staff to make you one of their refreshing Venetian Spritz cocktails. We highly recommend the Al Ponte Antico and will definitely return to this hotel. Thanks so much for such a memorable stay. You made all of the difference. :)

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Love2GoAnywhere
Reviews.Content: Our visit began with my husband and I being greeted at the taxi dock by the owner. After a quick tour, we were shown our gorgeous room sand our luggage had already been delivered. The room was simply sumptuous with beautiful fabric covered walls and matching fabric throughout. The view from the room was of the Grand Canal, just past the Rialto Bridge. Watching Venice's version of traffic was a fun spectacle each day. Mateo, the owner, listened carefully to our requests and always more than delivered. We were greeted by name by every staff member. They remembered our preferences and gave good suggestions for dining and sightseeing. Whenever in Venice, this will be the first choice for where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Venetian delight near to everything but hidden away.”
Reviews.Author: CarpeNox
Reviews.Content: My wife son and I stayed for four nights at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel and were treated as Venetian nobility of the past must have lived. It is called a hotel but the small size and personal attention from the staff make it seem more like you are staying in someone's private home. And that home happens to be on the Grand Canal. The location is ideal being close to all of the major sites and just minutes from the Rialto Bridge. But it is also hidden down a small calle so you have privacy. There is a private canal entrance if you arrive by water taxi. The owner, Matteo, and his staff could not have done more to make our stay exceptional. My wife and I had a very spacious room with a view of Grand Canal. We were right next to the terrace where breakfast is served with a view that epitomizes La Serenissima. We cannot recommend the Al Ponte Antico more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Had to be dragged kicking and screaming out of the hotel for flight home”
Reviews.Author: Enright74
Reviews.Content: What a hotel!! The service is absolutely second to none, the room was great, the view of the Rialto bridge and the Grand Canal was spectacular, we could willingly have stayed on the terrace all day and watched Venice at work and at play Would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: kevoSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our wonderful stay commenced with arriving by water taxi at the Hotel's private berth to be met by the charming Oliver. We were made to feel welcome from the very beginning. To have a room opening up onto the Grande Canal with views to the nearby Rialto Bridge was like being in Paradise. All day there was activity on the Canal, from early morning when the tradesmen, etc would go past in their boats laden with building materials or large linen bags for the many hotels. Then all the ferries packed with workers and later on the relaxing gondolas. The room was large, with beautiful furnishings. The entire Hotel was tastefully decorated. The terrace on the first floor is incredible You can have breakfast there or just wander out and sit any time during the day or night. One of the recommended restaurants in particular, and about 2 minutes from the Hotel, was excellent. It is Barababao and has lovely efficient but friendly staff, including the Owner. Fish dishes are great and the value very good, including the wines. There were however some disappointments with the Hotel. WiFi reception was very intermittent and access expired every 24 hours. This was quite annoying. The hot breakfast was brilliant as you could order any style of eggs, including choice of omelettes Also very nice cappucinnos. Unfortunately the choice of fruit was very poor, with one variety only of tinned fruit and a very small selection of whole fruit. Nothing really to have with your cereal. We ended up buying our own fruit at shops. There was also a very limited range of cereals. A better breakfast would be expected of such a high class Hotel. Staff at breakfast were extremely friendly. The great bar area, where breakfast is held in the mornings is always available. However, despite the fact that there is always someone available to pour you a drink or coffee, you may receive a shock when you pay your room bill at the end. The extras, ie drinks and coffee, mount up and you are not aware of the cost when you have them. Often the front desk is unattended as the receptionist may be upstairs pouring drinks in the bar or elsewhere. We noticed this when we arrived as the water taxi driver went inside to find someone to help with our bags but it took some time to find someone. The driver was not impressed. Also inconvenient when you return to the Hotel and have to wait for someone to appear so you can retrieve your key. Our room in general was clean, but the first day we noticed small pieces of glass on the floor and rug. Despite notifying staff there were still pieces there when we departed several days later. Meant wearing shoes the entire time. We loved the Hotel and would definitely stay again, just that a few minor improvements would improve the Hotel to match the high tariff and the Hotel's rating.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: BethAmherst_NH
Reviews.Content: I agree with all that has been said here. The experience of this hotel compares to none. It starts when they greet you by name when you step in the door of the hotel. Sitting on the balcony in the morning, overlooking the canal, with breakfast, watching all the deliveries by boat as the city awakes or at the end of the day with a Spritz, watching the activity of the canal, this was the place! The only complaint, we were in Room 4 and the ceiling into the bathroom was very low, my husband who is 6'3'', hit his head walking in the doorway to the bathroom and was unable to stand erect in the shower due to the low ceiling. Small annoyance compared to everything else wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “5-star service and grand canal win over small defects”
Reviews.Author: ScottN
Reviews.Content: The prize of this hotel is the small outdoor terrace overlooking the Grand Canal a stones throw from the Rialto Bridge. Nothing was more relaxing than having breakfast or a snack out here and watch the gondolas and canal traffic right next to you. All the canal-view rooms were booked (there are only a few rooms with the canal view) but I would certainly try to book one if you can. We booked a private water taxi to arrive and depart from the hotel with our luggage, and I advise this to avoid the hassle of trying and find the front (or back?) entrance from the alleyway. Not all hotels in Venice are easily accessible to all boats from the water, but this hotel is. In such a large tourist city, we knew we could count on the staff of the hotel to be our advocates and take care of us. They were disciplined in greeting us by our names (and I got to know all of their names too) and always went "the extra mile" to please us and resolve any questions or problems. Need to find the status of a specific gallery? No problem. They even offered a cup of coffee to our guides that came to pick us up. As I was bringing an aged parent, they made sure to give us a room on the ground (floor "0") to avoid stairs. The included breakfast included eggs to order, canned juices, yogurt, various pastries, fruit and coffee. The layout probably differs from room to room, but we found the organization a bit difficult to maneuver around; the room was not large in the first place and there was very little room for positioning luggage in a convenient place. Repositioning one or two pieces of furniture along one wall would have been helpful to us. The bathroom was very large with great fixtures. Our room needed a lot of small repairs. For instance, our room was classic Venetian with fabric damask wallpaper, Persian rugs and murano glass sconces. However, the a/c unit vibrated and even chirped like a cricket at times, so I put my overnighter on top to one side to apply pressure and stop it. Also, the a/c blower barely worked but it was sufficient to keep the room from becoming stifling. The main flush pad on the toilet was broken; we made do with the "little" flush. Some of the towels, bathrobes and sheets were getting pretty old, but were clean. There were some 1" holes in the wallpaper next to the bathroom door, possibly from some attachment that had been taken off the wall.
