There was some mold starting to grow on the rim of the shower stall floor and it needed a good scrubbing or recaulking. There were some services I am used to that were not available. There are no english TV stations provided, but we were provided with free wireless which "usually" worked from the room and got our CNN/BBC news through my iPhone (!!) using Slingbox. They also do not normally provide laundry services, but the marvelous staff found a local service and got it done for me (I was desperate). This is not a grand 5-star hotel like the Danieli where we stayed the last time. But we believe we received a more authentic experience based on hotel and location to get a more intimate portrait of Venice. Despite the small shortcomings, staying in this charming villa with caring staff was a great experience that greatly enhanced our stay in Venice. And did I mention how wonderful breakfast on the outside terrace is?

Reviews.Title: “The best service I have ever encountered from any hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: GlennKent
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe just what an unbelievable pleasure it was to stay at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel for our wedding anniversary. From the moment we arrived Matteo and his team treated us like royalty - a bottle of champagne in an ice bucket on rose petals with a lovely note signed by the staff was waiting for us in our room. Matteo, the owner was always absolutley charming. We were consistently treated as though we were the only guests staying in the hotel, nothing was too much for them to do for us. On the few times we saw other guests (it only has 9 rooms) I noticed that they treated everyone in exactly the same way. The hotel itself is quite simply beautiful - the attention to detail is amazing and you feel like you are living in an authentic Venitian Palace. We stayed in a Superior Room (101) with ridiculously high ceilings and fantastic views of the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge - I would imagine you would need to stay in at least a SR to ensure the views although you would need to check with the hotel. Location is in my view, perfect (about 6 minute walk to St Marks Sq) and the view from the terrace is sensational (nothing better than a cold beer while admiring the views after a long day of walking around town). Once you get your bearings and learn the short cuts, you will be very impressed with how quickly you can reach other parts of the city in just a short walk. I religously use Trip Adviser for selecting all hotels I stay at but can never be bothered to write a review afterwards - however, arrived home last night and felt I just had to write something, it was that good. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. If you are going to Venice, stay here. I think it would be impossible for anyone not to rank this hotel as one of the best hotel experiences anywhere in the world. My wife and I have been together for 12 years and we have never gone back to the same place twice as we like to have lots of different experiences of places and hotels. This hotel has just become the exception to the rule. See you again soon Matteo and Oliver!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bookcruises
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel with outstanding service. Quiet rooms and great location. This is the first small boutique hotel my wife has ever loved. The bar stayed open until 3am just for us to talk with our friends! Can't wait for their new Tuscany property to open!

Reviews.Title: “If you weren't staying there, you were jealous of those who were!”
Reviews.Author: Deb194960
Reviews.Content: This little jewel can be seen from the Grand Canal as you head toward the Bridge of Sighs. And sigh you will when you stay here. The staff, including both owner/manager brothers of the family, are charming and welcoming beyond words. They ALL know your name by the time you have walked in the door. I spent more time on the balcony of this hotel watching the canal traffic with a glass of wine than I did exploring Venice during the day. What a beautiful hotel and worth every penny of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect view, perfect service - perfect hotel for a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Krissy042911
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Antico was the first place my husband and I stayed during our honeymoon in Italy. It was the perfect choice! The view of the grand canal and Rialto Bridge was unbeatable, and we spent almost every evening in Venice sitting on the balcony outside watching the boats go by. The decor of the Al Ponte is also breathtaking - from the restored ancient wooden ceilings, to the Murano glass chandeliers, to the fine art on the walls - no expense was spared. Between the buffet and the made-to-order eggs and crepes, the breakfasts we had at Al Ponte were the best we had during our honeymoon. The bar was complementary and open 24/7. The service at Al Ponte was also exceptional, providing recommendations and helping us make reservations whenever we wanted. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice, especially those on their honeymoon or looking to make their stay extra memorable. And a word to the wise for anyone going to Venice for the first time - you need to wander down some of the smaller alleys to find the entrance to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Phenomenal!!!”
Reviews.Author: melliott1418
Reviews.Content: Started our trip here and it couldn't have been better! The location on the Grand Canal very near Rialto Bridge is the best. Grab a bottle of wine, sit on the balcony in the evening and watch the gondolas and boats on the Grand Canal...magical! Matteo and the whole team made our stay extra special with their lovely welcome, tremendous hospitality and terrific service! Just wish we had been there longer...guess there is always next time!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time and as brilliant as ever”
Reviews.Author: Hermionemccullough
Reviews.Content: thanks again to all the team at Al Ponte Antico. The warm welcome, (water taxi to private dock at the hotel and then welcomed by the team), and the excellent service (thanks for looking after us so well from wonderful breakfast on the balcony, to pre dinner drinks and of course your recommendations and bookings for dinner - all three restaurants were wonderful) This hotel is in an excellent location, with a picturesque balcony over looking the grand canal right - excellent base to explore this beautiful city. And the staff feel like friends. thanks again - hopefully we will be back soon (and definately looking forward to visiting your new hotel in Tuscany next year.) x

Reviews.Title: “magnificent”
Reviews.Author: DrBBest
Reviews.Content: where to begin, this hotel has captured the essence of its surroundings through impeccable service. customized guest experience is its strength. if you plan a trip to venice this is it look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Canal View on Breakfast Terrace”
Reviews.Author: TravelforFun17
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience, beginning with directions to the hotel's location from Rialto Vaparreto stop through the cobblestone, winding streets, up and over a bridge or two! Thank you, Oliver, for warm welcome! Beautiful, spacious room with large bathroom, comfortable bed. Only down-side was interior view without adequate sunlight. However, that was easily remedied by enjoying breakfast and leisure afternoons on the terrace with full view of the Rialto Bridge and all the activity on the Grand Canal. Delicious breakfast, outstanding service throughout. Location is convenient to pastry shops, gelato, restaurants, and a very old pink church! Walk anywhere from here. Magical!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: fkmaj
Reviews.Content: I was at Al Ponte Antico Hotel with my husband for Easter Holidays a couple of years ago and I just can not forget the great there. Mateo and his crew were just great! Giving hints on where to go and where to eat, we got the most out of Venice. In the end of the stay I wonder how I could live without MateoÂ´s breakfast! Can not praise it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in perfect location. Amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: IanS68
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is in a great location, has great spacious rooms with views of the grand canal, provides a great balcony overlooking the rialto bridge where you can have breakfast and enjoy a late afternoon drink. However, what really stands it apart is the level of service provided by the staff. Every member of staff was extremely attentive and friendly. Nothing was too much effort for them. I spend a lot of time in hotels, but have never received better service.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissmo!”
Reviews.Author: PookaNewYork
Reviews.Content: This beautiful small palazzo was perfect in every way. From the gracious hosts, to the beautiful rooms, the fantastic view, the amazing location, the delicious cappuccinos, the impeccable service and the welcoming staff..it was truly a wonderful experience. My son and I spent five perfect days in Venice last week and so throughly enjoyed this marvellous city. Our experience was enhanced by the kind, helpful and welcoming treatment by all of the members of this fantastic hotel. I would return to this hotel without question if I have the opportunity to visit this magical city again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast on the terrace”
Reviews.Author: jlr541
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and personal service. We loved having breakfast on the terrace with its beautiful view of the Rialto bridge and grand canal. I would definitely recommend this lovely hotel. The owner and his staff are so helpful and patient. They will make you feel like a personal friend! My only challenge -- and it was my fault for not being prepared -- were with the mosquitoes at night. I came home with lots of bites. It's not the hotel...just Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: WilliamBrodie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Venice last year and i hope we will come back. The hotel has a superb location, overlooking the the Rialto Bridge. It's a family hotel with an eccellent service. I found everything I've seen on the site. We were very lucky with the weather and the hotel is simply amazing. My personal advice for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our visit!”
Reviews.Author: SomnioAmo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel by water taxi, docked right out front...the hotel is located on the Grand Canal. We were greeted by an extremely professional and hospitable young man, our bags were attended to and we were introduced to the owner of the hotel. He was extremely friendly and helpful and was eager to tell us all about the hotel and show us around before showing us to our room. We felt that anything we needed or wanted could be arranged. We booked a Deluxe Room with a view of the Grand Canal for one night. The room was amazing, with a great view. The bathroom was very no-frills but clean and did its job well. The bed was hard, but we had no issues falling asleep. The free wi-fi was great. One of the best parts of the hotel was the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and the beautiful parlor with bar. When we were at the hotel, we spent most of our time here...and the staff was always very willing to provide us with anything from the bar, and even gathered some breakfast for us when we woke up late. I would love to return to this hotel as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for an amazing place to stay in venice - this is it!”
Reviews.Author: Teeee4444
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my wifes 40th Birthday as a result of the Trip Advisor Reports. I was determined not to book somewhere we could be let down on our first visit to Venice and all our expectations were surpassed. Not a big Hotel but loads of personality and right close to where everything is going on but quiet at the same time. We stayed in the Junior Suite with double doors opening straight out onto the Grand Canal - amazing - if you like the water and want to watch the Venice world go by on the Grand Canal whilst sitting back in totally comfortable surroundings you will love this room and hotel. The staff - Mattheo, Bruno and all others were fantastic and you could not ask for better service. The hotel is very personal and the staff do greet you by your names all the time but it is not "in your face" or without sincerity. Also, if you have not been before you must arrive in Venice by the water taxi - drops you right to the Hotel! Genuinely the best hotel experience we have had.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay In Venice”
Reviews.Author: rmcareer
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor we booked a stay at this hotel (room 109 also based on reviews) during Carnival last weekend. What can I say except that I can't imagine ever staying at a hotel I like better. The hotel staff we spoke with including Oliver, Thomas and the owner, Matteo, were all extremely courteous, gracious and helpful. Our room was on the ground level and overlooked the Grand Canal right next to the Rialto Bridge. Since I have not yet come across a more beautiful place in all of my travels, the perfection of this hotel location, the staff, and room allowed me to enjoy Venice to it's fullest. My husband and I spent a sunny Saturday afternoon drinking wine on a patio off room 109, looking at the Rialto bridge and watching gondolas pass by with all the Carnival crowds. Life does not get better. Although there was quite a bit of nightlife the thick windows and shutters blocked out noise and made it easy to get a good nights sleep. The room was very spacious (although we spent most of our time on the patio) and the bathroom was luxurious. When I return to Venice, I will be staying at the Al Ponte Antico.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: zepfville
Reviews.Content: Our room opened up on the canal which was truly amazing. Everything with the room was perfect. The bathroom is a little small which didn't bother us. What really sets this hotel apart from others is the amazing service. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bergerman2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for part of our vacation in Italy. The breakfast was very good, and the hospitality was fantastic! All of the hotel employee's on all of the shifts were great. The fact the know your name's makes you feel even more welcome. We would definitely stay here again, and we plan to!

Reviews.Title: “Special Hotel, Special People in a Special City”
Reviews.Author: meotin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic stay in Venice. From the minute we arrived by water taxi at this hotel we were made to feel that we had arrived to stay with friends in a very special place. There is not one thing that is too much trouble for anyone here. We have travelled to many hotels in many places but have never encountered such nice people. We had read all of the reviews and were sure it couldn't be that good but believe me it is. We were fortunate enough to have room 108 , the suite overlooking The Grand Canal. I still can not believe the view and the atmosphere you can feel from the canal. Breakfast is everything you have read from reviews and more. We are definitely going back to Venice and would only ever stay here, Many thanks again to all at the hotel for a trip of a lifetime!!.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard25London
Reviews.Content: We chose Al Ponte Antico based on its Tripadvisor rating and we weren't disappointed. I would have no hesitation staying again. We were travelling with our daughter so chose a deluxe room (102) which has a sofa bed and views straight onto the Grand Canal. Yes, several of the rooms open straight onto the breakfast salon/bar (see earlier review) but this isn't an issue in my view - this is an old building so walls and doors are thick enough to keep the bedrooms quiet. The best aspects of this hotel are its location, its ambience and, last but not least, its staff, who couldn't be more helpful. Bruno and his colleagues try very hard to make sure everything is OK not just for my wife and I but also for my daughter. They are more than happy to provide restaurant and bar recommendations (all of which turned out to be very good of course). The breakfast was also very good and, despite being January, it was nice to have the option of sitting out on the small terrace and watch the world go by on the Canal with a coffee or a hot chocolate. A magical couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay was just as memorable”
Reviews.Author: johnston255
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this superb hotel. 9 rooms only the hotel exudes all that you would want from a small establishment who really try to offer the best in service. This year Bruno, Gigi and friends greeted as if we were long lost friends when we arrived. It had been 12 months since we stayed. We had the same room and the same superb outlook on to the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge. During our stay we had many lovely discussions with Bruno (family Peruch owner) and Gigi their long time, hard working friend. OK we love to discuss all matters from geography, Venice, politics, family values, etc. They are not only good listeners but actively participated in they two way discussions. Now if you want a large bathroom this is not the place for you; if you want a soft bed this is not the place for you. BUT if you want simply the friendliest hotel in one of the great settings in the world then I can only but recommend Al Ponte Antico to you. PS: they have just acquired a country property (RELAIS DUE TERRE) near Pienza in Tuscany. We loved their company so much we drove there (we were doing a Tuscan stay/drive) just to see it. Closed but its going to be a spell binding place to stay. Matteo and Barbara Peruch, we cant wait!

Reviews.Title: “Thia hotel was all that we could have wanted in a hotel in venice.”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyLincoln_R_I_
Reviews.Content: Actually, we stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of the concierge at the Hotel Augustus in Fano, Italy. She was so right. We stayed here about 4 years ago, actually, and have recommended this to anyone we knew going to Venice. Hopefully, we will return to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Excellent Location, Excellent View...”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFiliz
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay in this butique luxury hotel. Even though we had no reservation with them the owner himself picked us up from the Rialto Bridge and gave us a good rate. The hotel staff was very welcoming. They all called us with our names and I think that shows caring and respect. The service was beyond excellence that sometimes we felt "Is this for real". After staying in this hotel you expect more from other hotels too which sometimes can be a problem:))) I can not thank enough for the hospitality they have shown to us. Thank you Filiz & Yusuf

Reviews.Title: “Charming and gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: franjmc
Reviews.Content: I found the Al Ponte Antico here on TA and had to convince my husband to pay the extra money needed to stay in the Junior Suite. I feel it was money well spent. The room (9) is right on the Grand Canal with a lovely sitting room, which our daughter used as her bedroom as it has a comfortable convertible couch. Firstly, the location is great, with a private dock for water taxis. I really think it's the best way to get to the hotel, and at 100 Euro from the airport, let's face it, if you are staying here, you can probably afford that cost too! Secondly, the staff are all brilliantly trained, very friendly and helpful. The owner, Matteo is quite possibly the most elegant man I've ever met, with his perfectly tailored clothes, exquisite manners and flawless grooming. I am sure he charms everyone he meets. His staff range in age and personality, but are all lovely. In particular Tomaso at night, was always welcoming and with a quick wit, entertained us greatly. Oliver is a charming young man who seems to know everything there is to know about his home town, and is so friendly and accommodating, he also makes a really great spritz. Rosalba is there at the breakfast room every morning with a smile and a coffee, she's just adorable. The breakfast room is quite simply, spectacular, it's like nothing I've seen before, comfortable, luxurious and perfectly appointed. The terrace is such a lovely area, we spent way too much time there photographing the view, watching the world go by and drinking Oliver and Matteo's brilliant spritzs. We stayed for a full week, and I think that most people don't get the opportunity to stay such a long time, and so we really got to know the staff after the scripting was done with. They may seem a little practiced to some, but they are all there to help and make your stay as memorable as possible. The room we stayed in was large and comfortable. I wasn't particularly thrilled with the bed, it was a bit hard, but nothing that would stop me from staying again. The bathroom was nicely done, small, but perfectly fine. Yes, the ceiling is low, but this is a really old building, so that is to be expected, surely. Probably the only things that I would change if the hotel asked me to, would be the strange, laminate sliding door to the bathroom, which I thought really distracted from the lovely fabric wrapped walls, and the fact that the television was positioned so that the cords were dragged a way from the power point. Not anything major. I wasn't particularly enamoured by the restaurant suggestions, but then, I am from a Sicilian family, and the food of the north is probably just not what I'm used to. There is a lovely little cake store at the end of the lane where the hotel is situated that have some delicious treats. The coffee is so-so, but the food is really lovely. Overall, I loved this hotel, I would stay again, and Matteo is completely correct, I do miss Venice. I dream of it and count the days until I can return. When I do, I hope that I will be staying at the Al Ponte Antico again.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, Great Service, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ItalianinJapan
Reviews.Content: We really recommend this hotel. If you go to Venice and have the opportunity you should stay at this hotel. It has added the extra touch to our great vacation in Venice. Very nice service from very friendly and professional people. Many thanks, Grazie Mille

Reviews.Title: “Charming and unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Dick09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a magical 3 night stay in Venice for our 25th wedding anniversary, with stunning winter sunlight and ice cold temperatures. We stayed in a beautiful room in the hotel, overlooking the Grand Canal with a view on the Rialto bridge (the room that's shown on the hotel's website with wonderful patterned fabric walls and upholstery). Al Ponte Antico is a lovingly-restored small palazzo in a great location - actually seeing it portrayed in the background on a 16th century painting in the Accademia (and looking exactly the same from the outside) is quite something. Much has been said by other reviewers about the service in the hotel. We really loved the personal care and attention from Matteo and the staff - quite unique. They are very attentive but (for us) not at all in an obtrusive or exagerrated way. And the restaurant recommendations they gave us were spot on (and I'm very picky and like to think I know my stuff...). The bottom line is: Al Ponte Antico is small, just a handful of rooms, and it's quite personal. If you want to be anonyous, it's not for you. But if you are OK with a smaller place that has real charm and style, if you don't want to pay â‚¬500+ per night, and if you have a romantic streak, then I could hardly imagine a better place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Al Ponte Anitco Hotel is a hotel of supreme charme with an owner and staff that take great pride in thier hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ajaxio
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we began our 5 night stay at the Al Ponte Anitico Hotel the hotel owner Matteo and his wonderful staff (including Oliviero) made it clear that they were there to make our stay the best they could and that we had only to ask and they would do thier best to accomadate us in any way they could. Matteo himself cooked a wonderful breakfast with fresh farm eggs any style whose yolks were almost orange and the tastyest we have ever had. We were able to eat our breakfast every morning on a lovely patio overlooking the Grande Canale and the Rialto Bridge. Our beautiful, well appointed room was decorated in traditional Venitian style and also over looked the Canal. The hotel is in a wonderful central location to all things fun in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The only way I'll ever do Venice - a masterpiece”
Reviews.Author: Camesawleft
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing, outstanding location - right next to the Rialto Bridge, which make it easy to find your way back (there are signs to Rialto all over Venice, plus the water transport all goes there). There are loads of good places to eat nearby, sights, shops etc. The view of the bridge and grand canal is an absolute highlight, whether you're having breakfast, an afternoon coffee, an evening drink etc. Breakfast is quality, well served. The parlour, with it's period furnishings is gorgeous, charming. Service from everyone was exceptional, faultless, talking us through Venice and helping with restaurants, transport etc (Thanks Matteo and Barbara especially!). The only issue we could fault was that the airconditioning was stuck on a level that we found much too hot, and this could not be adjusted. It was so hot that I found myself waking at night etc, not really able to relax in the room, and really hard to get air through our room (tiny windows etc). The fridge could also use upgrading. Other than that, the room was great, with a spacious, nice bathroom (roof pretty low, but hey, it's OLD). Overall, it's an outstanding, classy hotel that really made our time in Venice a pleasure - go for it if you can. When we return (no plans, but we will, maybe with friends/family) we'll organise our dates around this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Matteo and staff make you feel like part of the family...”
Reviews.Author: MIHGirl07
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the reviews found here on Tripadvisor, and believe me, all the accolades were spot on. I've never have experienced such superior service and hospitality than from Matteo and family. From the moment we arrived, the enitre staff was extremely accommodating, offering us anything from dining recommendations to unlimited cappuccinos. The entire staff made it a point to know us by name and when my fiance' and I checked into our room, there was a bottle of Prosecco on ice on a platter of rose petals waiting for us. The attention to all the details, the location of the hotel on the Grand Canal, and the amazing staff has made this my hotel of choice the next time I visit Venice. Look no further, as you will experience the best service of your life while staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, imperfect beds”
Reviews.Author: jAlfano
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here in 2010 and found the staff truly amazing. Breakfast and the parlor are exceptional. Balcony overlooking the grand canal is lovely. The primary imperfection was the beds, much too hard for a comfortable sleep. This place could be perfect if that were fixed. Also, the rooms are a bit dark and cramped. Ours did not have a view. The bathrooms are quite nice. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad attitude towards online booking cancellations and rebookings”
Reviews.Author: DragonDen747
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel, but I want to share my experiences with the online booking system of this hotel. One of the advantages of online booking is that one can make repeated cancellations and rebookings without any trouble. I had to cancel and rebook my reservation at this hotel several times (>8) because of scheduling changes and uncertainties imposed by my business schedule in Europe during a planned visit to Germany and Italy in May 2011. Venice would have been a second stop after a Germany business trip. As such, I needed to reserve a room early on, but had to cancel repeatedly because of date changes imposed by hosts in Germany. Matteo, the owner of Antico, e-mailed me , and told me that he thought I was not serious. And that he would not accept my reservation. I found this highly unprofessional and explained to him my circumstances. He did not accept my dilemma. In any event, I decided to book elsewhere. In retrospect, having experienced Italian "hospitality" in the past elsewhere, that bordered on racism, I cannot help but wonder whether this establishment is simply being xenophobic. Overall, not a positive experience with an establishment that is supposedly rated so highly for "service".

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff + location= excellent vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Frankie13
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel after reading all the reviews on TA. Even though I have discount travel priveleges at other properties this was just to interesting to pass up. What a great decision this turned out to be and worth the $$. Booked room 101 about 9 months out. Arrived Oct. 4th and decided to pony up for the private water taxi from airport to hotel. Friends, this is money well spent! In my opinion you can skip the gondola if you like. After traveling all night to arrive into Venice the transfer was spectacular and brought tears to my eyes. 2 people, 5 pieces of luggage, believe me you don't want to struggle at this point. The hotel has a private pier right on the grand canal. BIG LESSON here- You will be able to access this if the water rises. We met others onboard our cruise that were not able to arrive at their pier due to the rising water, the water taxi could not fit under, and they ended up dragging luggage for several blocks and over bridges. Definetly not a good experience, especially if you paid for water taxi service. Never would have occured to me.... We had only to wait a few minutes for our room which looks exactly like the pictures on the site. Super Clean, only negative is the small shower situation. We recieved several excellent restaurant recommendations. Mateo and his entire staff are fantastic and it would be my first choice if I were heading to Venice agian. The location is perfect. We took the advice of Mateo and just enjoyed walking the city, and truthfully I didn't feel I missed anything without the gondola ride. FYI, our transfer company offered a tour of the grand canal on the way to the hotel which is a great way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Over-scripted service. That's about it.”
Reviews.Author: r777rms
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Antico is an unusual hotel. It so nearly gets it right in so many ways, but it is still far from the perfection so many reviews seem to show. The welcome is overwhelming. God, they're SO friendly. First names, a brief rundown of the family Perruchi.... all very nice, very courteous, but possibly not to everyone's liking (especially if you're tired, as we were, on your arrival and just want to get to the room and have the long chats later)! Nevertheless, can't fault the effort on that front. The room we had was a large, ground floor room right by the canal. This could have been a great room with some basic idea of interior design (not something the Italians are normally lacking), but it was utterly charmless. Dark, dingy, smelly, no pictures or decorations on the walls whatsoever, slightly weird furniture, a down-at-heel feeling and a very basic bed. But large without question. The bathroom was pretty poor considering the very high prices charged, and certainly in need of updating. Breakfast is very good. Drinking prosecco on the balconey overlooking the Rialto Bridge is matchless. The Perruchi family need to spend some of the money that they are clearly putting in to marketing into renovation and upgrading. If they can do that, they'll have a truly fine hotel. Biggest positive - location Biggest negative - utterly charmless room Biggest challenge - timing your dash past reception to coincide with the 'phone ringing to save a 20 minute "chat".

Reviews.Title: “Refined hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: LL69
Reviews.Content: The owner and the stuff made everything to make these stay truly enjoyable. I have stayed in various boutique/luxury hotels before but never met such warm hospitality there. The only thing I can regret is that our stay was so short. Bravo, Matteo!

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Foodie1947
Reviews.Content: At the risk of sounding repetitive, I want to totally agree with 'cmangum' 14 October 2010 below. I selected this hotel from all the good comments on this site but wasn't sure what to expect. We stayed in one of the large 5 star hotels in Venice on a previous visit as part of an organised tour. We thought at the time it was wonderful, although its bedroom was small, the breakfast room overlooked the Grand Canal and Lagoon. But Al Ponte Antico runs rings around it. This is only a tiny hotel but its character, location and especially all the wonderful staff make it just so special. Mateo, Rosalba and Oliver especially, make this an experience not to forget. Being right on the Grand Canal with their own dock means easy access by water taxi to/from the shipping terminal or airport. I'm just hoping that when I want to return, all these positive comments won't mean it's booked out!

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best in Venice”
Reviews.Author: cmangum
Reviews.Content: Normally you want to keep a hotel like this to yourself, especially with only 9 rooms. However, we feel obligated to write this review simply because the staff and ownership deserves it immensely. We travel extensively during the year and utilize Tripadvisor for all of our trips. I know what it is like to read review after review trying so desperately to locate the perfect establishment. If you are reading this review, all I can say is to stop your search and book this hotel if it is available. This is one of those hidden gems travelers so desperately seek. The hotel owner Mateo and his staff are exceptional. The service is impeccable, but more than anything they make you feel as if you are staying in their own home. It doesnâ€™t hurt that the location is perfect and their patio overlooking the Grand Canal and Rialto bridge is an ideal setting to begin your day with the freshest of breakfasts (including to die for eggs prepared by Mateo himself) or end it with a glass of wine each evening. This is truly an extremely special establishment. We love Venice. This was our 3rd time visiting, but we can honestly say that we would come back to Venice just to stay at this hotel and once again see the staff. Book it now and youâ€™ll never regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: Jen1130
Reviews.Content: Wow! This B&B is truly amazing! Matteo and all of his staff know each guest on a first name basis and their hospitality was outstanding! The view from the outdoor bar/terrace was one of a kind! The rooms are beautiful! This is the place to stay when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start off our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: pandg4310
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Antico sets the standard for service! Matteo and his staff (Oliviero, Rosalba, etc.) are on a first name basis with all their guests and are wonderful hosts. Sitting on the Grand Canal overlooking the Rialto Bridge the location could not be better. They have a patio area where we would sit daily and drink cafe latte's while eating breakfast or watching the sunset as the traffic floats by...such a relaxing setting! Being close to Rialto Bridge, the hotel is conveniently near everything...a 15-minute walk north and you can take the boat to Murano, head south and you can watch dualing orchestra's in Piazza San Marco, and of course a few minute walk to the Rialto Bridge where you can admire the hotel. The worst thing about the hotel is that it was the first stop on our honeymoon and any hotel thereafter would not be able to live up to it...We wished we could have stayed longer than our two nights (far too short!!) but are thankful that we had the opportunity to enjoy the hospitality at Al Ponte Antico!

Reviews.Title: “Further praise unnecessary”
Reviews.Author: DerekCarver
Reviews.Content: This hotel has received such well deserved praise from fellow Tripadvisors that additional praise is superfluous. The owner and staff could not be more attentive and the hotel's location is perfect. My wife and I are frequent visitors to Venice and I'm sure we shall be staying there again in the not too distant future. However, there is one comment I would make that travellers with a long stay or part of a large family might find useful. This is a small hotel and the owner plus his excellent staff make a point of knowing the names of every guest. And my point concerns the ordering (and ultimately paying for) the drinks. Nothing is much more pleasurable in life than sitting on the hotel terrace with a drink and watching the life on the Grand Canal. One orders one's drink, which is duly brought. And that is it. No bill is presented for signing. Nor is there any price list so you don't know how much your drinks have cost - apart from the fact that just about everything in Venice will be more expensive than you expect! My wife and I were there for five nights and had, as far as I remember, 13 drinks between us, four of which were beers. But when we came to pay our bill all we were given was a hand-written invoice totally lacking in any detail apart from the single amount of just over 100 euros. This I found slightly unsettling and it explained a comment I had overheard by a previous party who checked out before us. I am certainly not suggesting that we were intentionally overcharge - in fact, I'm not suggesting we were overcharged at all even though I have no idea how much the different drinks cost. But mistakes can happen. Coincidentally on this same trip we found ourselves mistakenly charged at a nearby restaurant for the wine and water ordered by the British couple on the adjacent table. This was easily spotted, of course, because the bill was fully detailed. As I say, mistakes can happen. So I would suggest to future guests to ask for a price list of the drinks, which I'm sure will be willingly provided. You will then know what you are letting yourself in for when it comes to the time to pay the bill and could even spot any error. Personally I would prefer the simple method of just signing a chit, which is standard procedure, and then these chits will be clipped to your bill. But please don't take the above comment out of context. It was intended to be helpful and not to overshadow in any way the excellence of Al Ponte Anticho.

Reviews.Title: “splash out and stay here - it is well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: chesterUKWoof
Reviews.Content: An excellent location, the terrace and suites overlooking the canal are sublime and the location near perfection. The staff are incredible, NOTHING is too much trouble. Waking to breakfast on the terrace overlooking the grand canal is like being in a canaletto painting. The furnishings are first rate and the location very central. Matteo is the perfect host and it was wonderful to be treated as friends as well as customers. They go the extra mile to make your stay a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon stop, and fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Hbbb1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (honeymooners) stayed here after reviewing comments on Tripadvisor. We found that the descriptions on Tripadvisor only scratched the surface. The location, service (all staff including the owner Matteo), hotel gracefulness all added to a wonderful stay. On our 2 nights we took hotel recommendations for restaurants and found a jem both nights (thanks Oliver for the booking on our last night, we didn't get to thank you). Breakfast is also a highlight of the stay, starting at the custom build coffee machine that produces some of the best cappuccinos I have ever had (had 3 during my last breakfast), and ending with one of the tastiest omlette's to exist.... We intend to return next year and bring my sister and brother in law as they would love it too. 2 nights probably isn't enough and next time i would look to stay 3-5 nights. Thanks to all the staff who truly make this hotel the best I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: xintec
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at this hotel was fantastic. The location can't be beat, the service was non-stop terriffic, the room was clean and spacious and the breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal was fresh and fabulous. Try to get room 101 or 102, they seem to offer the best views. Matteo is a great host, and good cook. This palce is a true value. If you book here, you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed.....”
Reviews.Author: zan500
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days in September just after the famous regatta on the Grand Canal and during the Venice Film Festival. We found the recommendation here on TripAdvisor at the top of the hotel list for Venice and we're very happy we booked it. The owner of the hotel, Matteo, is one of the best hosts of any hotel I have stayed in anywhere in the world. He is an extremely gracious host and rightfully proud of the wonderful hotel he has created. He is also a very knowledgable tour guide about what to see and where to go in Venice. From restaurant recommendations to advice on when to go to various tourist hotspots to beat the crowds, he was very useful in our time in Venice and his advice was incredibly handy. The hotel itself is ideally placed right near the famous Rialto bridge and we had a room on the ground floor that opened onto the Grand Canal with views of the Rialto Bridge from our room. The room itself was quite large and nicely decorated and finished. If we had one complaint, it would be that the mattress on the bed was quite hard. The breakfast at the hotel was also very good and it was so fantastic to sit out on the terrace each morning and watch the city wake up as all the different boats cruised up and down the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: MRPaulRossi
Reviews.Content: The Al Ponte Antico Hotel was amazing. Quite simply the very best service we have ever received anywhere on any trip! Matteo and his crew were aweson=me, made our visit very special. Would love to return soon. Hello from Paul and Sue!

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: Blaukunst
Reviews.Content: We expected a lot, due to the very positive Tripadvisor evaluations of the hotel and its top ranking. And it was exactly like that - and sometimes even better. Think of anything...decor, rooms, location (with a perfect view on the Rialto bridge from the hotel's terrace)...it was just perfect! But what was most impressive to us was the impeccable service. Matteo and his team don't only know your name. They are very helpful, polite, friendly at all times - simply great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Intimate Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDTraveler21
Reviews.Content: This is an intimate boutique hotel, located on the Grand Canal, right near the Rialto Bridge. Wonderful terrace overlooks the canal; it's the perfect spot for breakfast (great buffet and made-to-order egg dishes), cocktails, and relaxing. Great location for walking everywhere in Venice or catching the vaporetto; also has private dock for water taxi. Best feature is the owner, Matteo, and his staff. All are extremely warm, friendly and knowledgeable about Venice. They can recommend a restaurant in any part of town, and willingly spend a great deal of time talking to guests about their stay in Venice and other travels. We would definitely stay here again, and next time be sure to get a room on one of the upper floors for more light, space and a view.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Terrace in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Martine1109
Reviews.Content: We cannot recommend Al Ponte Antico enough. Matteo and his delightful staff made our first visit to Italy the most unforgettable experience. We left Venice with massive smiles and a warm feeling that we had made special Italian friends. Nothing was too much for any of the staff and the friendliness from every single person was impeccable. Without even mentioning my birthday all the staff wished me Happy Birthday and Rosalba brought me a bottle of Proscecco on ice to my room singing "Happy Birthday" - so wonderful! We sat on the terrace in the afternoon enjoying our bubbly and watching life on the grand canal. Priceless! The hotel itself is spotlessly clean - it felt home from home. The decor was stunning with a very tasteful regal touch. It has a grand feel without the stuffiness - its has a wonderful comfortable and relaxed atmosphere. The terrace was just so unique we enjoyed the best eggs (cooked by Matteo from his Grandmas farm!) for breakfast overlooking the grade canal. Having its own dock was the icing on the cake using the water taxis to and from the airport was expensive but so worth it. Matteo should be very proud of what he has achieved and we wish him all the best for his chain of boutique hotels - we are looking forward to visiting them all! Martine and Scot - London UK

Reviews.Title: “Truly commendable service”
Reviews.Author: KCKCJY
Reviews.Content: Our party of 3 families wit teenagers stayed for 2 days at the Al Ponte Antico on our last stop of a Mediterranean cruise. Matteo and his dedicated staffs reminded us Asian top hotels are not the only ones who understand how to make their guests feel welcome. They helped us with our 15 pieces of luggage, directions to restaurants and attractions, free internet access .... and more, always with a pleasant smile and patience. Breakfast in the lounge with Matteo cooking your egg dish in his bespoke chef's uniform was particularly memorable. Location was also perfect, at the end of a quiet alley no more than 3 minutes from Rialto Bridge. We had the junior suite in the lower floor which was very spacious even after adding a rollaway for our teenage daughter. The only slight problem was that Wifi access was spotty but the computer on the 1st floor is just as good for checking your email/facebook. It is an aged building and it shows. Our canal level room has obviously suffered some form of flooding or moisture invasion. If you are the type who prefers modern fixtures to character then this may not be your cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location”
Reviews.Author: tldagr8Lakeland
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff at this location. The owner Matteo makes breakfast for his guests in the morning. Comfortable well appointed rooms. Bathrooms need upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “All that is the best about Venice is encapsulated in this one hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathryn040
Reviews.Content: We have visted Venice on three previous occasions and loved it, but this hotel, Matteo and his staff made it this visit truly amazing.From the moment we arrived to the moment we left it felt like we were personal guests invited to Matteo's home.The rooms were beautiful, the breakfasts amazing especialy Matteo's grandmothers golden fresh eggs. At any time of the day the balcony gave you a stunning view of Venice, for breakfast or drinks in the evening.Matteo advised us on hidden parts of Venice to visit and lovely authentic resturants have supper.This hotel was wonderful and we learnt a great deal about how attention to detail makes all the difference for your guests. Many many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hospitality, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SHChicago
Reviews.Content: Just arriving at this hotel's private dock I knew we were in for a special stay in Venice. The hotel is intimate and charming, with an amazing staff that could not be more welcoming. Our room was lovely, as are the breakfast room and terrace. Matteo gave us wonderful recommendations for restaurants and things to do, including a visit to the daily fish market which is just across the Grand Canal. Really, we can't say enough about how wonderful Matteo and his staff are. This is a special place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in Venice. Thanks to it I have fallen in love with this city. Very friendly staff. In all help. A site in the center Venice. And to have breakfast with a kind on the grandee the channel - it is valid a miracle. All I recommend to visit in Venice this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellant hotel”
Reviews.Author: bandbh
Reviews.Content: Extremely comfortable and laid back hotel close to the Rialto Brige.

Reviews.Title: “Took my breath away!”
Reviews.Author: Savannahx
Reviews.Content: As if Venice hadn't already knocked me sideways with it's sheer loveliness in the summer sun, Al Ponte Antico didn't disappoint. Truly sublime down to the last detail. Tiny but exquisite and added to by the characterful owner Matteu Peruch and his charming team. Also, one of the most amazing hotel breakfasts I've ever experienced abroad with eggs from Matteu's grandmothers farm and taken on their terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge. Just amazing!! Our room, the most basic, was a little on the tiny side but beautiful and with a great bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than my high expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: goglobe
Reviews.Content: This was one of the very best travel experiences we have ever had. The entire team was extremely welcoming and passionate about their beautiful hotel and city. The personal attention made it truly seem like we were visiting good friends. I look froward to a future visit and there is not a chance we would consider staying anywhere else! Thank you for the hospitality Matteo,Oliver, Armondo and Rosalba!!! Ciao for now!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect, amazing!”
Reviews.Author: PaulRickard
Reviews.Content: Incredible stay in the heart of Venice. The location could not be beaten - in the heart of Venice with a guest balcony looking directly on the Rialto bridge. With only 9 rooms the service was the friendliest we have ever experienced with every single member of staff knowing us by first name and the owner Matteo the absolute pinnacle of a good host. Can't recommend this hotel enough and I will be back without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have picked a better hotel to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: Monica73_travel
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel is right on the Grand Canal near the Rialto bridge, perfect location for exploring all of Venice. Everyone seems to know you as soon as you walk in the door! The staff is friendly and helpful and make you feel right at home. And Matteo, the owner, is full of helpful information on seeing Venice and is a great person to chat with. The breakfast, complete with eggs cooked by Matteo fresh from his grandmothers farm, is delicious and made even more enjoyable when sitting on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. I'm sure I will be back in Venice sometime, and will not stay anywhere else but here!

Reviews.Title: “A very special place”
Reviews.Author: SiandDom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very special; and it's thanks to Matteo and the team he has put in place around him. Nine bedrooms only means that the service delivered is very personal; everyone knew our names before having been introduced and couldn't do enough to help. We had a fabulous stay which was well worth the 2000 mile round trip - we came during the ash cloud problems and chose to drive rather than miss this trip to celebrate my partners 40th birthday. Right from the start the small team couldn't do enough to help us with recommendations for things to do and places to eat. Every recommendation an absolute gem. Our room over looked the canal and eating breakfast (cooked by Matteo himself) on the balcony watching the Venecian world go by was fabulous. The rooms are decorated in wall silks with great Venetian fixtures and fittings. If there was one area still to improve it would be the bathrooms but they are perfectly serviceable; just not as fab as the rest of the hotel. Thanks to the team and we very much look forward to Matteo's next project

Reviews.Title: “Like being a guest in a friend's palazzo...”
Reviews.Author: gopicturesny
Reviews.Content: Staying at this gem of a hotel is an incredible experience from the moment the boat lets you off at its private dock. We had a beautiful (and large room) with views right on the Grand Canal. The friendly and excellent staff greets you by name and Matteo is a charming and gracious host. Sitting out on their terrace enjoying a spritz in the early evening with the Rialto Bridge practically close enough to touch is magical. I can't imagine a better place to stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LondonEmmaLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Al Ponte Antico in June and from the minute we stepped through the door we felt like royalty. The owner Matteo has beauifuly restored the hotel and his has carefully chosen the best staff in Venice as I have never received such amazing customer service especially Oliver! The hotel has one of the best locations with a terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and Rialto bridge. We spent many hours watching the world go by with one of Olivers famous Spritzers. This is not the cheapest option but if you can afford it this hotel must be your Number 1 choice, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: chattykatty
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in two rooms here while staying in Venice. It was perfect. The staff went out of there way to be helpful. Every staff member made sure to introduce themselves to us and to know our names, and greet us every time they saw us. Wonderful, small hotel with a beautiful view. They excel in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE--especially Oliver!”
Reviews.Author: LeahCP
Reviews.Content: I'm hard pressed to add anything that hasn't already been said! The building is gorgeous, beautifully restored, Matteo is a gracious host, with great recommendations, and the staff, especially Oliver, are wonderful. I honestly cannot wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: londoneagle
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a most enjoyable 3 nights at the Al Ponte Antico. It is in the most perfect location right next to Rialto bridge. Breakfast or Cocktails on the terrace overlooking the Canal and Rialto must be one of the best viewing positions in Venice. Expect to be photographed by the many boats passing the terrace. The staff at the hotel, led by Matteo are as good as I have experienced. They cannot do enough for you and are always available and helpfull. Advice on trips and restaurants proved very successfull. Some of the rooms can be a bit dark and the beds are a bit hard - but I guess that is what you get in Venice. The rooms facing the canal are awesome although they are 100 euros more expensive than a standard room. We chose the hotel because of previous reviews and we had a fantastic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The most magical place.....was it a dream?”
Reviews.Author: glassartist
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at Al Ponte Antico . It never ceases to amaze me how perfect every stay has been. The primary reason for the perfection, has to do with the people that run this magical place . The people that work at any business are really what make or break it (a hotel, a restaurant a shop) this is no exception. The fact that it is beautiful, the food and drinks are delicious, the location is ...........PERFECT and the beds are comfortable only add to the reasons why I will always return. Do not hesitate on this one.......only, leave room for me when I want to book next time. Thanks Matteo and everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wozza62
Reviews.Content: Mattheo and all the staff made us feel like friends more than customers. This wonderful old charm hotel is right next to the Rialto bridge and an easy walk to any attraction. It also has easy access for a water taxi straight to the hotel. The buffet breakfast is superb with a large selection. The rooms are big with high ceilings and comfortable beds, ours had a fantastic view of the grand canal. Enjoying a evening cocktail on the hotel verandah is a pleasure. I cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: coffey409
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the only place to stay in Venice. We stayed one night before our cruise and then again after returning to port. The staff make you feel like you are the only one staying in their hotel. Every place they recommended for lunch and dinner were excellent and they even called the restuarant before we went. The breakfast each morning had everything one could desire. Each evening we had drinks on the terrance, which is right on the main canal!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: monacg
Reviews.Content: Our stay with Matteo and his team was just perfect! We arrived in Venice in late March on our honeymoon and we couldn't be more thrilled with our choice of hotel! We arrived at Al Ponte Antico at around 9am and were greeted by smiling faces who knew us immediately by our names. As we entered the breakfast room, on our way to our room, we met Matteo. He is the most charming, polite, gracious and welcoming person we have ever met. He really has and does make this hotel what it is - an incredibly special place! Our room was clean, and the bathroom was big and spacious. But the rooms are not what makes this hotel a must-stay destination. It is the service, the location and the amazing terrace that overlooks the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge. Each morning we would sit out on the terrace and have breakfast. Matteo personally makes you eggs every morning! And every evening we would sit there as the sun went down and sip on a Venetian Spritz made by Oliver - it was bliss! The location is so perfect. Very close to St Marks Square, and just over the Rialto Bridge is the Fish market (great fun to visit). We loved this place and have such special memories! Thank you Matteo and friends - we hope to see you again very soon! You made our honeymoon so special!

Reviews.Title: “Venetian gem”
Reviews.Author: gorah123
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is for the discerning traveller that welcomes personal service. The other reviews say it all. We stayed in a suite with a window right on the Grand Canal with fantastic views of the Rialto and all the water traffic on the Canal. It was my wife's 60 th birthday and Matteo and his excellent staff made it an occasion to remember. Nothing is too much trouble at this hotel-and it deserves every commendation it gets

Reviews.Title: “First class service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: zandogran
Reviews.Content: It's not often that the reality exceeds expectations, but with Al Ponte Antico it certainly did. From the moment we arrived Matteo and his team made us feel completely at home and welcome. This is a beautiful hotel, elegantly furnished in traditional Venetian style, right on the Grand Canal. A highlight was the excellent breakfast eaten on the terrace, watching life pass under the Rialto Bridge. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. A tip: Take a water taxi from the airport directly to the front door, a perfect start to your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: billemm
Reviews.Content: Very Special Place with excellent sevice, fantastic location with incredible Venetian decor....great

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome and great location”
Reviews.Author: Coccyx
Reviews.Content: Arrived by river taxi to the Hotel's private mooring and immediately welcomed by our first names. The hotel is an attractive recently-restored 16th Century palace. Our room was fairly compact without much natural light but it was otherwise of a good standard. Mattress firm but comfortable. Walls a bit thin so television easy to hear from next door. Breakfast is a good buffet with fresh omelettes or pancakes made to order. Delicious hot chocolate as well. The bar leads to a small balcony with excellent views of the Rialto Bridge and Grand Canal. Warm hospitality although perhaps a little over-rehearsed. Location on the canal is superb. Very good boutique-style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard bed, dark gloomy room and certainly not four star”
Reviews.Author: ChristchurchFusspot
Reviews.Content: Due to Easyjet cancelling our flight from Poland (not enough people on the plane to fill it) and leaving us stranded for nine hours at the airport we did not reach Venice until midnight...shattered. We were shown to our room and for $NZ600 per night I was expecting much more. Very tired looking room, understandably it was old, but drab and not welcoming. The bed was the hardest bed we had ever tried to sleep on and we had no sleep at all. My husband went down to the desk at 6am to ask that something be done and they were very obliging and changed the mattress and put blankets on top of that. Better, but not great. The bath had the shower over it with a curtain that was so long that it kept blocking up the plug hole and when you tried to wash yourself the curtain kept sticking to your body. My husband is 5'11' and had to stoop when showering as his head was touching the ceiling. The bedroom itself was dark and lights had to be on during the day just to find things. Our room also went directly off the dining room and we were woken early in the morning. Breakfast average. The mini bar drink prices were expensive. The redeeming feature about this hotel is it's location and the balcony overlooking the canal but if I was to visit Venice again I would try to find a hotel with better facilities and if I wanted to sit and watch the activity on the canal I would dine in a restaurant beside the canal.. The staff of this hotel were great, however everything taken into account I do not consider this hotel package value for money. Beware of hotels that have this policy....EARLY DEPARTURE AND YOU WILL BE CHARGED FOR THE FULL TIME YOU HAVE BOOKED!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: EuropeHoneymoon2010
Reviews.Content: Perfect in every way!

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Come True”
Reviews.Author: krimar
Reviews.Content: You have probably read all of the wonderful reviews about Matteo and his staff and let me say they are absolutely spot-on. Oliver, a true Venetian, greeted us by name the moment our water taxi came to the private dock. He spent 45 minutes with us, talking to our girls (who both had school assignments on Venice before arriving) and us about the history of Venice, the best time to ride a gondola, the best time to see St. Mark's, our accommodations, you name it. He is so proud of his city and the hotel, and his pride and enthusiasm for all things Venetian just made us love Venice even more. Matteo's recommendations for dining were absolutely excellent; he kept us close to the hotel on our first day which was wise since we were not quite as familiar with the city and then recommended a great restaurant for us that was a little further away one our second night there. It is true that the staff knows you by name from the moment you dock and never talk to you without using it, which is a wonderful personal touch. Their English is excellent --at the conversational levels. Even Thomas the night guard kept my 13 and 15 year old laughing during our entire stay. The service combined with the location truly makes this hotel a dream come true. Location, location, location--I cannot tell you how truly marvelous the location of this hotel is. While it is on the grand canal, there is no noise at all to interrupt your stay as the shutters are quite thick. It's easy to walk to St. Mark's from this hotel; there is no schlepping bags through Venice trying to find your hotel and getting hopelessly lost as they have their own docking station; there are great shops with everything you can possibly imagine right on the main "street" by the hotel; and you can always find your way back without any problems because you simply follow the signs that say "Per Rialto." The little terrace patio overlooking the canal is simply divine and we spent as much time there as possible. The rooms are nicely appointed and the beds are quite comfortable. Breakfast is delicious-- besides the typical Italian fare, you can also choose a fresh omelette with eggs handpicked from Matteo's grandmother, or delicious crepes. This hotel seems expensive compared to other hotels in Venice and in Italy, but it is worth every single penny. You will have no regrets if you stay at Al Ponte Antico.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MsPogelmann
Reviews.Content: Nothing ever is quite as good as the brochure/photo/reviews/website - except Al Ponte Antico. I have learnt that what TripAdvisor reviewers seem to like is highly personalised service; a sense of being a family member. I don't like that at all (being somewhat anti-social) but the reviews of Al Ponte Antico were so good and the photos so incredible that I booked it to celebrate my 40th birthday. It was an excellent decision. I booked the cheapest room and it was still the largest hotel room I've ever stayed in (for a European city, not counting US) and stunningly beautiful. The staff, as advertised, were clever, slick, well-practised in their speeches and actually genuinely endearing. Matteo is hilarious! If you are stuck for amusement (you won't be), try betting on how many times he and his staff will use your first name during your stay. I guarantee you'll under-estimate it, but it's all part of the incredible show and it would be really churlish of me to resent it. Everyone says it but the little bar and terrace are absolutely the icing on the cake. We sat there as much as we could, raising our glasses of spritz to the tourists on the vaporettos' as they pointed and took photos. It really was heaven and so troublingly perfect that I was actually relieved when I noticed that the toilet seat was slightly broken! I cannot recommend this hotel too highly.

Reviews.Title: “best in venice”
Reviews.Author: deborah_lord
Reviews.Content: I've never been bothered to writre a reveiw before as once home i never made the time but this is by far the best hotel i have ever stayed in. The owner and his staff were the nicest people and nothing was to much trouble. The location could not be any better and to sit on the terrace with a glass of wine looking on to the grand cannal was heven .this is the place to stay. debbie uk

Reviews.Title: “Everything we dreamed, more than we could have imagined!”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel for our 25th wedding anniversary. Everything was beyond wonderful. From Matteo greeting us at the door by our first names, to the champagne waiting in our room, and breakfast on the terrace, it was sheer perfection. Our room overlooked the entrance on one side and a small street on the other. In the morning the smells from the bakery filled our room. *sigh* Wish we were there now. Venice is absolutely enchanting and staying at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel made it even more so.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Oldfriends
Reviews.Content: This will be our 3rd or 4th stay at this marvellous establishment. Everything about this hotel is outstanding - the Venetian decor, the cleanliness, the impeccable service,the friendly staff and Matteo the boss who treats his guests in such a hospitable manner. When we think back at holidays spent in Venice we think of "Il ponte Antico" and its gracious staff. We will be staying at Il Ponte Antico at the end of May for several days and are looking forward to seeing Matteo, Rosalba, Oliviero and last but not least, Armando once more.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely perfect stay - cannot wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: AnnyO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the wonderful Al Ponte Antico hotel just after Easter to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, and how glad we are that we did. From the moment we walked in we felt like the most important people on the planet - the care and attention that Matteo and his outstanding staff lavish upon their guests has to be experienced to be believed. Nothing is too much trouble, and they are all so proud (rightly so) of their beautiful city and ready to help guests get the most from their stay. Their suggestions for places to visit, and recommendations for fantastic places to eat made this the best holiday we have ever had. The hotel is really very conveniently situated. Our room was gorgeous, and extremely clean and comfortable, looking right out onto the Grand Canal. I think the highlight of our stay at this lovely hotel was aperitifs on the terrace, watching the vaporetti and gondolas go by. We really cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiGirl69
Reviews.Content: A magical night that we will never forget. We can only support & agree with every positive comment made about this hotel. It's magical - everything from the rooms, the staff the balcony and the location. Like others this was slightly out of our price range but we thought why not treat ourselves . . . and we were certainly treated! If you are contemplating staying at Al Ponte Antico, just do it! Thanks so much to the beautiful Matteo and Oliver for making Al Ponte Antico the highlight of our Eurpeon trip.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel - dont rate it if you haven't been!”
Reviews.Author: Snowball1967
Reviews.Content: Although myself and my partner did not get around to writing a review on the Al Ponte Antico Hotel last year, we felt compelled to leapt to its defence on reading the last review! It is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed at and people who haven't even been there should not really be permitted to leave reviews (how can you actually comment on accommodation, sleep quality, location etc!!) I can sympathise with people being upset over events of the last few weeks, but that is nothing to do with the hotel, they are still a business and that is why you have travel insurance! We are booked to return at the beginning of September and we can not wait - our advice is believe the hype and rebook if you can.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cattail1248
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to our stay in Venice at this hotel but were caught up in the Icelandic volcanic ash disaster...we simply could not get on a flight to get to Venice to honour our reservation and yet we have been charged for the full stay. We certainly understand a small hotel and a strict cancellation policy but this way way out of our control

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience in this glorious city”
Reviews.Author: Lamontr
Reviews.Content: We travel alot and to say this hotel is wonderful is no exageration! We booked the trip late last year to celebrate my retirement. We arrived, were greeted warmly and shown to our room ( 102). The room looks over the Grande Canale and is lovely, comfortable furniture, wonderful bed. We had the windows open day and night, we slept well , only needing to close them around 7am when the markets started. The bathroom was good but a stronger shower would be the icing on the cake. The staff were wonderful and friendy. The breakfasts were superb, even the eggs looked golden! Sitting on the terrace overlooking the Canale for a drink in the early evening was a real experience. This was our first trip to Venice sinse 1984 and it will not be our last. Thanks to Matteo, this was an experience to remember

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to every expectation and more!”
Reviews.Author: Jo N
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Tripadvisor I was worried that our expectations would be too high but I needn't have worried at all. This was our fifth trip to Venice, our favourite place in the world, but the first time we stayed at Al Ponte Antico. We shall never stay anywhere else and I can't wait to go back. Matteo and his team were wonderful, the room was fabulous - we were upgraded, the location superb - very very central but down an alleyway that meant it was very peaceful, the breakfasts were the best we have ever had - the omelettes made from Matteo's grandmothers' eggs were out of this world and the bottle of prosecco waiting for us on my husband's birthday and which we drank on the terrace was perfect. I'm very sorry that we didn't say goodbye properly to Matteo but will see him again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to saty in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LeKaDoha
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best in town. Excellet views from the balcony available to all guests. Ask for a Bellini or a house red wine and sit on the balcony and watch the world go by. Owner is a wine buff, so anything he recommends will be good. The location is great for shopping and make sure you get some recommendations from the satff for eating out. A real treat to stay here, and rumor has it he is opening a new place in Tuscanny later in the year. If the level of service and attention to detail is replicated in Tuscano, it will be a great place to visit as well. Were certainly looking forward to his latest offering and would certainly stay at Al Ponte Antico if we are lucky enough to return to Venice. The City is great and thsi really tops off a great experience. If you want to impress your partner, definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic romantic getaway with an incredible host.”
Reviews.Author: LET89
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the waterside entrance to the hotel to the moment we left the same way with the owner Matteo waving us off we were made to feel as if we were the only guests that mattered. The hotel is decorated opulently in a traditional Venetian style which is streets ahead of the chain hotels you can also find in Venice. Situated directly next to the Rialto bridge you find yourself in the heart of the city yet in a secluded Venetian bubble of tranquility with the best scrambled eggs for breakfast I have ever tasted. . Apart from a very slightly dodgy shower in our room (no number next to the breakfast room and directly overlooking the Grand Canal) there was not a hiccup on our brief twenty four trip. Matteo is definitely the 'icing' on the cake, an impeccable dresser his suave and elegant style brings the sophistication of Venice to the forefront of your visit. So , Matteo's father, if as I understand it to be the case and you read this review, your son is a tribute to you. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “It's the personal touch and details that count”
Reviews.Author: Elisa_Chiu
Reviews.Content: I couldn't thank Matteo and his staff more for their hospitality and friendliness during my stay in Venice. Upon my arrival, Matteo surprised me by calling me by my first name without looking at any record. Perhaps I am relatively easier to identify because I am Asian - but the fact the he made the effort to remember the name of the guest really greatly impressed me. The hotel itself is beyond my description (I uploaded a couple of pics)... it's really a gem by the Grand Canal with a really short distance to the Rialto Bridge, which made my stay in Venice very easy transportation-wise (either by foot or by the water bus). Breakfast is fantastic with some items cook-to-order (I had a great freshly-made omelet), not to mention that you can have the breakfast or drinks by the canal at the terrace. I stayed at another hotel in Venice which has a pretty high ranking on TripAdvisor as well - but my experience at Al Ponte Antico is really so extraordinary that I wouldn't choose anywhere else if I visit Venice again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: RoryCro
Reviews.Content: Wow, we had the pleasure of staying at Al Ponte Antico hotel for 3 nights and we weren't disappointed. Its a beautiful small hotel, in a great location but what did it for us was the exceptional service we received from the owner Matteo and his staff. Situated on the grand canal, beside the Rialto bridge the location is superb, you are within walking distance of everything Venice has to offer. Matteo and his staff were the friendliest we'd ever encountered. They recommended great restaurants too helping us to avoid some of the more touristy places. Our room was very comfortable and the breakfast was really delicious. We can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a brilliant location & friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: jorichards
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel , in a briliant location with the most friendlist staff, What more do you need!! .I spent hours looking through tripadvisor at different hotels but decided as the Al Ponte Antico had been 1st for 6 months it must be good . It was probably a little more than i wanted to pay but was well worth it and if i am being honest it even exceeded my expectations. Matteo the owner and Oliver afternoon staff were both brilliant in making our stay so enjoyable , they advised excellent itinerary and restaurants. This is a small family run hotel that you feel totally comfortable from the minute you walk in. My advice would be to "Just book it" as this is one of best and most friendliest city hotels i have stayed in.a1++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service in a fantasic location”
Reviews.Author: rosie_bware
Reviews.Content: The customer service from the moment I sent a booking enquiry to the moment we sadly stepped off the jetty into the taxi back to the airport made the difference between us having a good weekend and a great weekend. Armando looked after our retaurant reservations in advance of our arrival and my goodness they were both fantastic, the Osteria Santa Maria on the Friday and the Caravella on the Saturday. Matteo, the owner who I can only describe as handsome and charming, made sure that we were well looked after at breakfast, and gave us some good advice on places to visit and where to do lunch ... yes we did spend most of the weekend eating and drinking (when we weren't in shops that is) The room (109) was amazing and on the canal (Ive attached a couple of photos) and although more expensive than I would normally pay for a weekend, it was perfect. Ladies one word of warning if you come here the shopping is great, and my friend had to buy a full size suitcase for the murano glass and handbags we both bought... pretty good for a two day trip. Would definately return, thank you so much. Rosie .

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting place”
Reviews.Author: HeleneDigbeth
Reviews.Content: The hotel has only 9 rooms, but believe me, you can feel here the most wonderful romantc atmosphere ever. Great accomodation and great location everybody was so friendly and helpfull. We will stay again here next time we visit venice.

Reviews.Title: “It's as good as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: johnston255
Reviews.Content: I took the advice of your contributors and certainly were not disappointed. This hotel has just 9 rooms - yes 9. From the moment we arrived by Water Taxi we were enchanted by this unique Palace in Venice. Congratulations to Bruno, Gigi and Alex for looking after us so well. We will return to enjoy more of your friendship next time we are in Italy.
