Reviews.Title: “Look no further....”
Reviews.Author: Dilo-Jake
Reviews.Content: I read the Trip Advisors Top Hotels in Italy and Al Ponte Antico was rated #1. I can't tell you what a great place this is but more importantly how comfortable everyone makes you feel. From the first day you will feel as if you have known everyone for years. Ive been to Venice enough times to appreciate the different areas. This hotel has a great location just in Cannaregio where you can avoid the big hustle and bustle that occurs when youre near Piazza San Marco.Upon my return to Venice ......I wouldnt think of using another hotel or B&B...unless its their other guesthouse named Locanda Orseolo. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Naughton2WorryAbout
Reviews.Content: My family is a world traveling family, having visited major cities in America, Italy, Germany, Denmark, Ireland----you get the picture. The stay with my son at the Hotel Al Ponte Antico was the very best ever. The staff truly enjoy what they do and they exude hospitality, respect, and love for their guests. The rooms are opulent but not at all ostentatious. There is a sense of elegance about the rooms. The breakfast, included with the price of the room, is fabulous. We visited in an off season before Carnivale and the owner upgraded us to the best room in the hotel. Again, this is an example of the kind, loving service that is so rare and also extraordinary. We plan to be in Venice again and the Hotel Al Ponte Antico will be our destination. My wife will love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: PatJenDallas
Reviews.Content: Of our 17 days in Italy, this truly was our favorite hotel we stayed in. Everything about it is just perfect! Location is right on the Grand Canal with the most amazing view of the Rialto. The rooms were large and decorated beautifully. There is an amazing breakfast every morning. Matteo (the owner) and the rest of the staff were fantastic. They made us feel like royalty from the moment we arrived! It was very hard saying goodbye to them 3 days later! I can't recommend this hotel enough! We will definitely be staying here on our next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true”
Reviews.Author: SydneyCatgirl
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights with Matteo and his fabulous staff in mid-December 2009 and from the moment we stepped through the door it was a dream come true. From the amazing, personalised welcome each and every time you enter the reception area, to the fantastically appointed rooms, not to mention the beautiful dining/bar area with original finishes, this hotel has everything one could wish for. Friendly and welcoming seem very poor choices as words to describe the staff as they honestly make you feel like you are their only guest in the hotel and like you are a member of royalty. Their local knowledge is astounding and they have fantastic advice for good food, wine, and activities in and around Venice. We have stayed at many far more expensive hotels that have about 1/100th of the charm and grace of the Al Ponte Antico. Our only disappointment was that we only spent 3nights there....wish it could have been a lifetime. We would go back to stay there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting”
Reviews.Author: MissQuackers
Reviews.Content: We were utterly charmed by Matteo and Al Ponte Antico. Truly a place out of time, the lush, dark and opulent interiors of this centuries old palazzo evoke the ancient Venice of history books and imaginations. We were enchanted from the moment we pulled up to the private dock by water taxi and Matteo waved down from the terrace; we felt like film stars from the golden age of Hollywood and we acted like it too, sipping prosecco in our room and waving from the window that opened directly on to the Grand Canal. Handsome, charismatic and exquisitely tailored, Matteo made me secretly regret my inexpensive holiday wardrobe and flimsy sundresses, longing instead for pearls and designer heels. I know what to pack when we returnâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “You can't buy good service - here it is included”
Reviews.Author: Andreas.Rosent
Reviews.Content: You might think, the more expensive a hotel is, the better the service is. In this hotel the truth is quite obvious to be recognized: it's not the price, good service is a mixture of good people, much experience and empathy for customers, a passion for being hosts, being extremly professional and disciplined - while staying super-friendly, nearly to friendly. Before visiting this hotel I thought I've seen all significan kind of hotels (which I can afford). This is a class of it's own. When visiting Venice, it's a must. The rest is well described by the previous posts which turned out for us to be totally true, which still amazes me. It was a fantastic stay, we were treated like very special guests.

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: VinoKatt
Reviews.Content: Matteo, Rosalba, everyone was so very personable and kind. Unparalleled service and warmth. We felt as though we were staying with dear friends and were quite sad to leave. By far our favorite place to stay in Italy and in my top three in the world. Kathryn & Mark

Reviews.Title: “Superb Spot”
Reviews.Author: jamsamottawa
Reviews.Content: The location and the staff service provided by Al Ponte Antico place it with the very best in Venice, but at substantially lesser cost. The second floor terrace overlooking the Grand Canal has a superb, probably unique, view of the Ponte Rialto, and the jousting between gondolas, vaporettos, water taxis and working boats, provides continuous ever-changing entertainment. Matteo and his staff provide superb service, with Matteo himself doing breakfast preparations, offering a wide selection, finely done and served on the terrace. He has had sommelier training and is most willing to share his knowledge (and excellent cellar) of wines. He is also most willing to recommend the best sights, excursions and restaurants and follow-up with appropriate reservations. The building itself is an architectural delight, with its painstaking and meticulous restorations superbly well done. Our very spacious room was on the ground floor with windows that opened directly onto the Grand Canal. It doesn't get any better. The sights of Venice and the lagoon (I recommend a vaporetto trip to Torcello by way of Murano and Burano to see a 1200 year old cathedral) are, of course, unique in the world, making decisions on what to do next challenging (do some advance reading because there isn't time to do it there). Whatever is selected turns into a marvellous new experience. Hotel Al Ponte Antico has provided us with vivid memories that will last a life-time.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel keepers ever”
Reviews.Author: thyssens
Reviews.Content: This family of hotel keepers (they also own Locanda Orseolo near San Marco) are passionate about service. This family and their staff are incredible...We were blocked in Venice with the snow storms and we just had a great time because we felt at home with Matteo,Barbara, Rosalba etc...I forgot a couple of names but they were all extremely friendly. Both hotels are very nice (we stayed at both) and breakfast is marvellous. They will make you feel like you were part of their family...and yes, you will meet the whole family :) There is only one comment appropriate for these hotels...WE WILL BE BACK

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Hotel Ponte Antico Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ocncapt
Reviews.Content: It's hard to describe the Hotel Pontico. It's not really a hotel, it's not really a Bed and Breakfast. What it is, is fabulous. From the minute we arrived by water taxi, I knew I had made a great decision booking this Hotel. We were greeted at the dock by Matteo, the owner who seems to put 200% effort into making each guests stay memorable. The staff goes out of their way to accomodate any need. They went out of their way to help track my missing luggage. We splurged and booked the Junior Suite..it was costly but worth every cent. The rooms sitting area opened out onto the Grand Canal with a canal level view of all the traffic! My husband and I enjoyed pulling up our chairs and sipping our wine while watching all the boats and gondolas pass by. The only drawback to the Junior Suite was the size of the bathroom. Otherwise it was wonderful. As mentioned in other reviews the breakfast were great as was the service staff. The location is perfect next to the Rialto Bridge and close to everything. I was a little afraid to go to Venice in November because of rain and cold. But after visiting I would only visit in the off season, crowds are sparce and rates are down. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Al Ponte Antico.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - The best hotel service yet!”
Reviews.Author: LaDolceVita71
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Venice for a short weekend break and after reading the preceding reviews decided to settle on the Al Ponte Antico. I can honestly say that this was the best decision as the the hotel lived up to all the previous reviews. I can't really add much more to what has been said before other than Matteo and his team have mastered the art of personal service. The moment we stepped of the water taxi, we were greated by Armando who collected the luggage and checked us in, we were greeted by our first names from the moment we arrived until we left and from my perspective it made us feel extremely welcome. A few hours later we met Matteo (the owner), who spoke at length to us about everything in Venetian. This man is an absolute gentleman, he has dedicated himself to perfecting the art of service and his recommendations for eating, walks or anything else in Venice were impecable. His passion for good food, fine wine and the culture of the city were evident in every conversation we had. The hotel itself is small yet perfectly positioned, it was set back from the main street outside and noise was never an issue. Just to sit on the terrace drinking Oliver's spritzs' whilst watching the boats go by on the Grand Canal was bliss in itself. You are within easy striking distance of just about every major attraction in Venice, San Marco Square was no more than ten minutes walk away and the nearest Vaparreto was next to the Rialto Bridge and this was five minutes away. The hotel itself was small yet opulently decorated in the traditional Venetian style. Breakfast (included in the price) is superb with a mix of fresh pastries, cold meats and cakes all followed by eggs (any style) cooked by Matteo himself. The staff ultimately make this the place you want to stay. Matteo, Oliver, Anando, Thomas and David were all superb. How often do you come back from a holiday and know the names of everyone who looked after you? If you like the personal touch and enjoy a home from home enviroment then I thoroughly recommend this hotel. Matteo and his team deserve all their success both now and in the future and I can't wait until his new hotel opens in Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel, service and staff”
Reviews.Author: JAHDublin
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband just returned from a 3 night break at this wonderful hotel. We were treated like royalty from the moment we entered the hotel. Mateo and his staff are wonderfully welcoming and they did everything to make our stay warm and welcoming, We both travel extensively and stay in hundreds of hotels every year. This hotel is the best we have ever stayed in. Thank you for the wonderful memories, Julie anne and Stephen

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful time, well worth the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: yadayadaUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the begining of November for 3 nights as a celebration for our's and our friends anniversaries and had a marvelous time. It well deserves all the lovely things that are said about the hotel, the staff and the location. We arrived by water taxi at the hotels own entrance from the Grand Canal, at the recommendation of Matteo, who I had spoken to before we arrived. He also made a reservation for us at a fantastic restaurant for the night of our arrival, as it was a Saturday and we had heard that it might be difficult to get into restaurants if you hadn't booked on the weekends. His courteous and friendly manner set the tone for the whole trip. The staff were always happy to help you, whether advising on where to go around Venice, or serving a wonderful glass of wine in the evening, enjoying the view of the rialto from the sitting area. Breakfast was enjoyable, always plentiful and Matteo's famous egg dishes were cooked to perfection. The loction of the hotel is great, every important site easily accessible by a few minutes walk, and arriving down the Grand Canal makes you feel like a VIP. There are even umbrellas to borrow, as it rained for 2 of the 4 days we were there, at least we got to walk on the raised platforms! The rooms are decorated to a very high standard and always clean, we stayed in a classic room. The only niggle could be that they are slightly on the small side, but please do not be put off. I've heard most of Venices hotel rooms are like this and you don't spend that much time there as you've got the wonderful city to explore. Overall, this is a FANTASTIC place to stay, I would recommend it to all my friends and the praise for Matteo is deserved. He was helpful when needed, talked to us to keep us company if that was required and left us to ourselves when we wanted it. BRILLIANT.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Venice!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPlanningFool
Reviews.Content: Magic, magic,magic! Best service, most central, most delicious breakfast we had in Italy, and the room was out-of -this-world one-of-a-kind. We immediately felt like Family. Treat yourself to this wonderful boutique hotel. You will not be sorry. It will be the only place we will ever stay in Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FABULOUS service, INCREDIBLE location, and BEAUTIFUL city!”
Reviews.Author: IQTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Ponte Antico was our first stop on a 9-day whirlwind trip to Italy and it was truly a wonderful way to start off the trip. We flew in from Chicago and were very jet lagged when we arrived but just being in the water taxi on the way to the hotel woke us up and revived us. If you're trying to decide on transportation, I would definitely pay the extra money for the water taxi. (We chose to forgo the gondola ride because we felt the water taxi was just as good an experience.) Pulling up to the hotel, I could not believe that it truly was right on the Grand Canal. No matter how many times I read the reviews, I still didn't believe it was right on the Grand Canal AND right by the Rialto Bridge. Truly a fabulous location. And the service?! Oliver was like our own personal bartender, tour guide, history teacher, and host. He was so sweet and made us feel so comfortable. And we loved Matteo, as well. He made some of the best eggs we had ever had for breakfast one morning. He had gotten them from his mother's farm. And the room you sit in for breakfast is just gorgeous. By far the best breakfasts we had in Italy. We were only there for two nights and we so did not want to leave. We spent a lot of time on the balcony sipping on spritzs, bellinis and wine watching the boats go by. The balcony was the perfect escape because Venice is so busy; it was nice to have an "oasis" to come back to after a day of walking. Don't get me wrong, though. We loved the "busy-ness" of Venice. Walking out of the hotel and into the hustle & bustle of the streets of Venice was so fun. And the fact that there are no cars makes it so enjoyable. Like some of the other reviews, we did not get a room on the canal but we were totally fine with that because we spent so much time on the balcony. Our room was so quiet and relaxing. We loved it. And we had a great little view of a rooftop garden next store. I want to go back and spend at least 5 days there. And I will come with no itinerary because Oliver and Matteo have the best recommendations. I highly, highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fabulous place to stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: majik48
Reviews.Content: The level of personal service I experienced during my stay has completely changed my perception of how a hotel should take care of its guests. The combination of service both at the hotel and ability to recommend activities and dining that enhanced my experience of Venetian culture was outstanding. Remembering my birthday was a great touch as well. Unfortunately any other hotel I stay with in the future will be a disappointment compared to my stay with Hotel Al Ponte Antico. While it is not cheap to stay here the staff's ability to save time and recommend economical activities and dining makes a stay here a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisConnie
Reviews.Content: We were only able to stay for one night but wished we could have stayed much longer. The staff was extremely helpful, called us by our first names and treated us like royality. The rooms were very nice and clean, the breakfast buffet was fantastic and the view was so amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: burchard
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with previous reviewers - there is something very special about this beautiful little hotel. Matteo lived up to his reputation as I walked in the door with six of my friends. He had memorized our pictures from the passports we left at check in and knew each of us by name, as did his staff as we met them during our stay. The hotel is lovely. Two of the three rooms we had booked had beautiful views of the canal - unfortunately ours only had a view of an inside alcove of some sort. This is the only critique I would make is to ask ahead of time what the view is if this is important to you. We felt completely at home here, spending a great deal of time in the beautiful room where they served breakfast. And the breakfast and coffee service was 5 star. Matteo can cook but word to the wise - don't walk around with your coffee cup - as I was informed of my "American" nature - coffee is to be enjoyed sitting in Italy and not "to go" as we do in the US - good advice! Matteo made many arrangements for us including a private tour of one of the Murano glass factories and water taxi back to airport). On check out day we were not due to leave until nearly six. We were welcome to spend as long as we wanted sipping wine in beautiful wine glasses watching the boats go by in the Grand Canal. Thank you all for your impeccable service!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Adramski
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel. The staff were lovely and very helpful. At night the views were beautiful from the terrace, and the breakfast was lovely. The bread was very good and so was the cakes. I would stay here again and recomend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ScheckTrek
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location It wasnâ€™t fun driving to the Municipal Garage at Piazzale Roma, but once we were on the water taxi, life was good. And once we were sipping afternoon spritzes on the hotelâ€™s balcony â€“ watching the sunset skies and traffic on the Grand Canal, returning waves from children in gondolas with their parents, smiling as tourists in the vaporettos took our picture â€“ life was very good, and I couldnâ€™t imagine having stayed anywhere else! This was our pre-dinner ritual for both evenings we were there, and both mornings we ate breakfast in the same spot, though the breakfast room is so gorgeous â€“ one of the things I fell in love with in the photos â€“ that it was almost a shame not to eat there one morning. However, we couldnâ€™t pass up a breakfast on the balcony for it! My husband and I so enjoyed seeing so much of Venice life passing by us boat: the ambulance (which made a wake that overflowed the opposite bank), the mailman, the express mail, the laundry service, a boat with a wheelbarrow in it â€“ you name it! The breakfast was the best of any of our six hotels in three countries. In addition to a selection of items that were already beautifully laid out on the table, Matteo cooked eggs or omelets to order (and he told us, as he has others, that the eggs came from his grandmotherâ€™s farm) and/or Italian crepes. We were there two mornings, and on neither one could I resist the banana and chocolate â€œcrepe.â€� They were also very generous with as many delicious cappuccinos as we cared to drink. I stopped at three. (As elsewhere in Italy, the cups are tea-cup size. I never could find a venti!) We were in Room #103, right across from the breakfast bar. I was afraid the noise of breakfast prep would wake us up, but we never heard a sound. Pros for Room #103. First of all, it is beautifully appointed. The very high walls (maybe 15 feet?) are upholstered in damask, per the photos. The draperies, cornice board and bedspread are in a coordinating striped damask. The woods in the room â€“ both in the furniture and in the door, mouldings, etc. â€“ are gorgeous. Even the mini-bar is in an antique (or antique looking) cabinet. Thereâ€™s a stunning chandelier (I assume itâ€™s Murano) and matching sconces. If you check the view from Room #103, youâ€™ll see that it overlooks an alley, but if you like architectural details, you owe it to yourself to push back the sheers and check out the leaded-glass windows. The bathroom is probably the largest weâ€™ve ever had in Europe. Iâ€™m sure you could dance in it! And it has old, old ceiling beams and a bidet and spa tub. Cons for Room #103: The room is cramped for the person who sleeps on the far side of the bed. My husband twice stubbed his toe on the mini-bar cabinet, which is at the foot of the bed. Perhaps the biggest short-coming though (no pun intended), is the low ceiling height over the tub. Thatâ€™s primarily because the tub is raised (maybe because of out-dated spa-jet equipment under it?). So between the raised tub and a bathroom ceiling thatâ€™s less than 8â€™ to begin with, it was difficult for my husband to shower there. I doubt the bathroom has been remodeled since the 60s. Given the high standards Matteo has brought to the hotel, it wouldnâ€™t surprise me if thatâ€™s on a to-do list as time and funds are available. This hotel has the best-trained staff weâ€™ve ever experienced anywhere. Every time we encountered a different staff member, they would introduce themselves. And everyone was constantly calling us by name. Matteo has done an impressive job of management, and no doubt thatâ€™s one of the major reasons why the hotel is ranked #1 for Venice on Trip Advisor. Matteo is all the things people have said about him. However, a problem about continual raves is that it can tend to elevate people in our minds to something beyond the human realm, then we are taken aback if they donâ€™t live up to that every moment. That happened to me with a comment Matteo made. Iâ€™m not a professional photographer, though a very few of my photos have been published, but photography is a serious hobby. So naturally, I took a number of photos as we were sitting on the balcony, and also a few in the beautiful breakfast/bar area (not when other guests were eating). Matteo made the comment that I would go back and â€œtortureâ€� my friends by â€œmaking them look at all those picturesâ€� I was taking. Iâ€™m not sure if he meant to insult my photography or my manners. ;) I explained that I greatly weed through them first and then, feeling somewhat defensive I guess, added, â€œPeople tell me they want to see my pictures.â€� He said, â€œPeople are kind.â€� I felt the comments were not worthy of him. (When I related this to my husband, he teased me: â€œHeâ€™s blown it now!â€� ;)) But perhaps it only goes to prove that even Matteo is human. Some Tips Parking: Based on the research my husband did, the Piazzale Roma is considered the safest place to park, and since we were leaving some of our luggage in the trunk, that was important to us. Youâ€™ll need to reserve a spot online ahead of time. Vaporetto vs. water taxi: We didnâ€™t know if it would be worth the extra money to take the water taxi, as we thought the Rialto Bridge would be close enough for us to pull our luggage, and we were there in mid-October (i.e., not in the thick of the tourist season). But since so many people said theyâ€™d had a hard time finding the hotel, we thought weâ€™d at least do the water taxi for the arrival. What a great way to get your first views of Venice! Then we saw the vaporettos go by. People were packed inside them! We couldnâ€™t imagine what it would be like to try to get on one of them with our luggage. So needless to say, we took a water taxi on the return as well. (We were told it should cost EUR 55 to/from the parking lot, but be sure to agree on the price ahead of time.) Conclusion When we booked this hotel, it was $400/night. Because we were in Europe for almost three weeks, it took some persuading to get my husband to agree to that. I let the TA reviews do the talking for me, and because of the incredible raves for this hotel, he was won over. By the time we took the trip (we were there in mid-October), the dollar had declined to the point that it was about $450/night, making it the most weâ€™ve ever paid for a hotel. Are we glad we chose Al Ponte Antico Hotel? Absolutely!! Having fallen in love with the place through Trip Advisor, it would have been a huge disappointment for me not to stay there. I would have always felt weâ€™d missed something that we would never be able to recapture. But maybe even more importantly, when I look back in retrospect on our trip to Venice, the first thing I think of is sitting on that balcony for afternoon spritzes (by the way, theyâ€™re EUR 7 each for a generous size) and for our leisurely breakfasts each morning; watching dusk fall on the canal at the end of each day, and all the boat traffic (with deliveries of every kind!) in the mornings. The price is high, but it wouldnâ€™t be cheap to stay anywhere in Venice, and the difference in price was (I thought) worth it for the enhanced experience. If you agree, you may want to consider booking as many months ahead as possible. When you only have nine rooms, and youâ€™re ranked #1 in Trip Advisor, it doesnâ€™t take long to fill up.

Reviews.Title: “Magical place”
Reviews.Author: MrsZutterbug
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations and made my stay in Venice truly magical. Matteo and his staff are incredible and so friendly. From the moment we walked through the door we were treated like royalty. The location is perfect and close to everything. Morning breakfast is excellent, with a huge buffet spread of hot/cold items, and Matteo cooks up eggs to order perfectly. The hotel also has a terrace looking over the grand canal, which is available to hotel patrons 24/7. We'd sit on the terrace at night with some grappa and soak in the beauty. An incredible hotel in an incredible place. When I return to Venice one day, this is where I'm staying.

Reviews.Title: “Just Unbelievable!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Inssclep
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italy ending with a 3 night stay at Al Ponte Antico and what an end to a glorious holiday. So much has been said by others about this gem of a hotel (or Palace as Matteo appropriately referred to it) and until you experience it yourself it's hard to believe. What I want everyone to know is that my wife and I have never seen and felt such true passion and joy from individuals in the hospitality industry. Yes, maybe an owner and "dream creator" like Matteo would exude this feeling but it's not just him. It is every single person who works at this extraordinary place. They literally are at your complete disposal 24/7 to share their joy of the Venetian experience. From the front desk crew to the breakfast servers (and what a breakfast it is!!!) these are the nicest and most sincere individuals you could ever hope to meet. Yes the hotel is stunning from floor to CEILING (you can't believe how beautiful) to the chandeliers and artwork, and the views of the canal and Rialto Bridge are magnificent but what I will never forget is the people that make it all work. Matteo, Armando, Oliver, Rosalba, Ines and Tommaso have left an indelable imprint on our lifes. You need look no further for the experience of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Casual elegance at the epicenter of Venice . . .”
Reviews.Author: TheHanleys
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Antico was all that was promised in these TripAdvisor reviews. We booked our itinerary around availability at this lovely hotel and were not disappointed. Small, personal and friendly, our proprietor, Matteo and his staff, particularly Oliver and Thomas, made our stay in Venice memorable. What a delight to be greeted by name at the door after wandering Venice for hours. Be sure to sample the breakfast rolls that Sra. Matteo located on the mainland, and enjoy a Spritz or cup of tea on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Very memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: goodkiwi
Reviews.Content: Matteo and his staff made our first visit to Venice most enjoyable. They made excellent choices for us for meals and gave us precise directions. We would never have found the small wine bar around the corner from the hotel on our own. I wish we can find more Matteo's in our future travel destinations!

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Jewelbox...but keep it a secret!”
Reviews.Author: vrb
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place...our group of two couples from the US planned to stay here strictly on the basis of TA advice. Spot on! Fabulous vacation. Immaculate property. Friendly, personalized service...I cannot think of ANY downsides...except that Matteo won't find room for us when the crowds finally realize that this gem exists within his beautiful city. If your budget allows, spring for the rooms on the Grand Canal...perfectly soundproofed while all of Venice floats past your window! The breakfasts on the terrace became a meeting point for all the guests...there are only a handful of rooms, so we got to know everyone quite well. It was a PERFECT experience! (For a treat, go out to the terrace late at night before turning in...I would sneak out in my pjs after my husband fell asleep. It was magical.)

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugalug
Reviews.Content: This is it... no need to look further. The perfect hotel in Venice. Perfect location, stunning views, beautiful rooms, amazing service, best breakfasts that we had on our holiday. We were only able to get their most basic room with a courtyad view and the room was still lovely. The view from the hotel balcony was worth the trip to Venice. Thank you Al Ponte Antico Hotel - our stay in Venice was perfect - you really do deserve top placement on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: TonyFLondon
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic find! We decided to stay in a hotel in Venice following a 1 week cruise. As always, I was concerned that the service we recieved on the ship could never be replicated by a hotel. How wrong I was. We arrived very early on Saturday morning with the intention of leaving our bags in the hotel and start our sightseeing. After a brief check in we were shown upstairs into the restaurant area whwere we were duly offered breakfast (for free). We settled for a cup of coffee and by the time we had finished our bags were in our room and the keys were given to me. The service in this place in awe inspiring. I have been to America several times and there standards of service are great but this was just another level. The good experiences are just too many to mention but as in other reviews, we had Matteo cook us breakfast and we sat on the terrace on a Sunday morning watching Venice come to life. You may be put off by the price but if you possibly can push your budget you must. It will be an stay to remember - I assure you.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful ending to a fabulous honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Grange80
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I had a split destination honeymoon and had stayed in another hotel in Venice for the first few nights and then headed to Lake Garda (Eurocamp) - for our last night we wanted luxury and splendour to finish off our honeymoon so after reading the reviews on this site booked this hotel. It was wonderful - the reception we received was so welcoming and helpful and the hotel is just gorgeous, what a treat! We had a spritz before heading out for our last night in Venice and returned to our delightful room, we had chance to enjoy the terrace the next morning and a fabulous breakfast cooked by Matteo himself and then had to head off to the airport - would have loved to have had a longer stay at this hotel and we plan to return for our ten year anniversary all being well. All in all we would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel as something special.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Pamalama
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for our anniversary & my husbands birthday. The room was spacious, clean with a dressing area & lovely bathroom. We have travelled alot & it's probably the most ornate hotel we've every stayed in. The view is to die for & Venice is amazing! Matteo is the perfect host & left a chilled bottle of Proseco in our room for my Husbands birthday. I don't normally eat breakfast but the choice & eggs personally cooked by Matteo the way you like them is just not to be missed. I can't recommend the hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “if you want to see the best of venice - stay here”
Reviews.Author: MorganKent
Reviews.Content: A delightful first stay in Venice. The Al Ponte is situated in a perfect place for visiting every part of Venice. The hotel is small and intimate. The decor is beautiful, and the service from the staff was truly outstanding. Nothing was too much trouble - booking restaurants, suggesting times to visit busy attractions, down to where to get the best ice cream!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnD32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights at the start of our honeymoon in June and we could not have wished for a better hotel. If we had been offered a free transfer to six star opulence elsewhere in Venice then we would have swiftly declined! Here's why... As you will probably have already gathered by now, the hotel is located on the Grand Canal and is a stone's throw from the Rialto Bridge. Our arrival by water taxi from the airport late on our first night was magical...a dash across the lagoon before entering small quiet canals and arriving at a scene from a film. If you're undecided about how to transfer to your hotel from the airport, and you can afford your own water taxi, just do it. We were greeted at the hotel's landing stage by a very welcoming Tommaso who, like all the other staff, welcomed us by name before we'd had a chance to introduce ourselves...how do they all manage to do that?! Our room, which was large and comfortable, overlooked the hotel terrace which itself fronts onto the Grand Canal. It took us a little time to get used to the fact that our room overlooked the terrace, which other guests used, but we found that we loved having it on our doorstep and it often felt like our own. The view up and down the canal from the terrace is amazing, especially in the evening and at night. As others have said, you do feel a little special when day trippers are gazing up at you from the canal boats, waving or taking photos, as you're sipping one of Oliver's delicious spritzers after a tough day of sight-seeing... In the mornings we would take our time to savour the ample buffet breakfast and I always seemed to find a little bit more room for some of Matteo's delicious scrambled eggs or an omelette. Then off we would go to explore Venice for the day - the hotel is very central and St Mark's is less than 10 minutes away - before heading back to the hotel to relax, ask Matteo to recommend another restaurant, or get ready to see a concert. The hotel itself is lovely and well situated - there are not many rooms and this makes for an intimate and personal stay - but it is the staff that are the heart and soul of the place and they alone make it easily the best hotel we've ever stayed in. Matteo, the owner, is the most charming man you'll ever meet and, dare I say it, a complete perfectionist, who spends a lot of time at the hotel and who is totally dedicated to the guests and staff within it. Oliver and Tommaso are wonderful characters who we really enjoyed spending time with and who would provide us with whatever we needed. We had a real soft spot for Rosa who treated us like royalty at breakfast. I do not mention others only because our paths crossed very infrequently. Thank you all for a wonderful start to our honeymoon. So...if you're planning a trip to Venice and haven't yet booked a hotel then do not look any further!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: SeaFish
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights at this absoultely fantastic grand canal property. Our unexpected Jr Suite upgrade was the climax to a wonderful 3 week trip - the accomodations were excellent but Matteo and his outstanding staff made our stay special. The location on the Grand Canal near the Rialto was great - and surprisingly there was litte evening noise. We would stay at no other Venice location. Venice is a magical city and Hotel Al Ponte Antico made for a most memorable visit. Thank you Matteo and staff - we felt like family. FJ Graff - Butler, PA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: Szumilewicz
Reviews.Content: This really does live up to the great reviews ... we spent only one night here but it was a perfect start to our honeymoon. It is full of character, warmth and top notch hotel. Would not stay anywhere else in Venice. The staff are so friendly and make you feel so special ... we hope to come back soon. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid location by one of Venice most famous landmarks”
Reviews.Author: ValeryTokyo
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Al Ponte Antico was our first of two nights in Venice as part of our honeymoon trip. We came in from the island of Burano by water taxi, which allowed us to have a spectacular view of the gorgeous Grand Canal all the way from the Laguna to the Rialto Bridge. And there was our hotel, right after the Rialto, very charming. As honeymooners, we had reserved the junior suite with a large window on the Canal. Tourists passing by on vaporetti must have thought we were locals as many of them were just waving at us... The room was of course spacious and artistically decorated in the Venician style (this room can be seen in the hotel's website). The personnel was very friendly (Walter would cook his special omlet for us the next morning) and gave us valuable information and tips about the main sightseeing points in the city of Venice. We could enjoy more of the view on the Grand Canale at breakfast (which was taking place on the terrace overlooking the waters and the Rialto). Enchanting city, enchanting stay...

Reviews.Title: “Just come back and all the reviews are exactly right !!”
Reviews.Author: kim16
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for my birthday present, and he does like to do plenty of research, we read the trip advisor comments and to be honest they sounded a bit too good to be true but we have just arrived back, and the comments are exactly right !! The location itself is worth the price !! You have to get up early for breakfast just to make the most of sitting on the terrace there is so much to look at. Matteo and his staff treat you more like friends than guests and nothing is too much trouble, we can't wait to go back !!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Hotel to Consider”
Reviews.Author: clayontheroad
Reviews.Content: The amount of praise this hotel receives seems rediculous until you actually stay there and realize Matteo and his staff have earned it. My wife and I spent two nights here as part of our 20th wedding anniversary vacation, and had a great time. We had a "smaller" room (#105) on the breakfast/patio level which was very large by most European bedroom standards. You know you picked a good location when tourists on the Rialto Bridge are taking pictures of you eating breakfast on the patio! The staff's recommendations were excellent. Every member of the staff knew our names before we even met them (I'm completely serious). The style of the hotel, location, and staff can not be beat at any price.

Reviews.Title: “A glorious place to visit..”
Reviews.Author: vickieelaine
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Antico offersr the greatest hotel experience. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like the most important guests ever received. The hotel is in a perfect location and is beautiful. Mateo and his staff know each guest by name and make every endeavor to make one feel truely welcome. The view of the canal from the balcony is most splendid. The Rossinis are pretty grand, too. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Venice”
Reviews.Author: mjthill
Reviews.Content: We travel about 150 days per year all over the world, and you could rank this hotel as one of the best experiences in our life. The view of the Grand Canal at your door step, the Rialto bridge only a few 100 feet from the terrace where you eat breakfast , and the staff lead by a very full time owner, Mauteo, made Venice even more special than it already was. The furnishings are stunning and meticulously clean, and the attention from all the people working at this amazing boutique hotel was a model of perfection. The first thing that you noticed is that entire staff was in love with their city and were always willing to share their knowledge with you. Mauteo was a perfect host for a perfect hotel experience. If you're going to Venice, do yourself a favor and spend your nights at the Al Ponte Antico.

Reviews.Title: “the best european hotel we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: tomgiginick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our three young children in July on a long trip through Europe. Our family have stayed in lots of hotels and guest houses all through the world, and this has to be the most friendly and home like ever! We had the two rooms on the ground floor. The junior suite was fabulous, the views out to the grand canal and the Rialto bridge were unbelievable. We just sat there with our kids and felt like the luckiest people on earth. The wonderful staff at this hotel make you feel like you are one of the family. I could not recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever???”
Reviews.Author: Swindoneric
Reviews.Content: I spend around 150 nights a year in hotels - mainly on business and I can honestly say that I found this hotel to be one of the very nicest I have ever stayed in. We arrived by water taxi to their private jetty on the Grand Canal - and someone came out and said "you must be Eric and Trish ! Welcome!". This set the tone for our whole stay. We were in one of the more modest rooms facing the courtyard - but there was complete silence so we slept really well. The buffet breakfast, suggestions for dinner (not to mention a willingness to ensure we had a reservation), suggestions about where and where not to go all made this a memorable stay. A truly lovely hotel in an unbelievable location, with excellent people. Thanks to all - we will definitely be back. Eric and Trish Bateman

Reviews.Title: “All the reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: EvilParrot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights based off the reviews on Tripadvisor and I can say they are all true. Its an amazingly nice hotel with unbelievable service. Honestly if you visit Venice and don't stay here you are barking mad. Only downside is that if you don't water taxi direct to it, it is a little bit hard to find as it is hidden at the end of a small alley (we walked past it twice before finding it) though because it is near the Rialto it is very easy to find again from almost anywhere in Venice because the Rialto is so well signed.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: memphismom0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated #1 for a reason. Our room was stunningly beautiful, with an incredible view of the Rialto bridge. Our hosts, Oliver, Thomas, and Matteau, were the most charming and genuinely helpful hosts we have ever encountered while travelling. The location is perfect for a lovely visit to Venice. And, compared to the Bauer and Luna Baglioni, the price is a true value. We loved it. We will be back. I would add my great photos from our room, but I cannot get them into the right format. The photos taken from our room are the best in the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Deniro2020
Reviews.Content: This is without question the best hotel we have ever had the pleasure to stay in. The hotel has a first class location just down from Rialto Bridge and has magnificent views across the Grand Canal; the balcony available to all guests is excellent for drinks and breakfast (which is freshly prepared to your liking and delicious) where as you relax can watch the activity pass you by. The rooms are very spacious and beautifully decorated and no attention to detail has been spared. To cap this off and make our stay truly unforgettable was the hospitality and dedication of the staff; all staff members from owner (Matteo) to maids went to the trouble of learning our names, ensured everything was always to our liking, offered first class advice on resturants, attractions and travel when we asked. They also showed a genuine desire and care that enjoying your stay is the most important thing to them. I'm a person that usually likes to be left to get on with things as i please but the sincerity of all those at the hotel was a very rare pleasure to experience. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Our stay will never be forgotten. Gary & Lindsey.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danspur
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice as the first leg of our Italian honeymoon. It is a beautiful city and this is the perfect hotel to stay in while there. The main selling points are the service and the location. Matteo and his staff are extremely welcoming and friendly and are always available to offer advice. The hotel is located in the heart of the city, a couple of minutes from the Rialto Bridge and a short walk for St Mark's Square. The balcony offers fantastic views of the bridge and along the Grand Canal. As the hotel is small, we were usually able to have a romantic drink with no-one else on the balcony. Breakfast is also excellent, especially Matteo's omelettes. The rooms are not huge (we had a standard room) but are beautifully decorated and comfortable. As others have said, I would recommend taking a water taxi from the train station. This is not cheap (50 Euros), but is a great way to see the city for the first time and saves the trouble of trying to find the hotel, as it drops you off at the hotel's own jetty. If we are ever lucky enough to be back in Venice, we will certainly be staying at Al Ponte Antico.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Room In Venice”
Reviews.Author: spl642
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Al Ponte Antico for two nights including our 5th Aniversary based on the reviews from this site. The reviews painted a perfect picture of what we were to expect. We booked the Junior Suite and were on the ground floor with a window 2 feet above the Grand Canal. I can't imagine another hotel in Venice can match the feeling of looking out that window. I was prepared to spend much more to stay and one of the well know 5 star hotels in Venice, but thankfully found this gem. As far as value goes this hotel was exceptional. As for the service, I knew what to expect from the reviews, and while i typically would probably chose anonymity over excessive personal attention, I felt incredibly at home with Mateo and his staff. Everyone greeting us by name seemed to suit this establishment perfectly, and I felt genuinely welcome. Breakfast was one of the best i've ever had. The selection would have been over the top for even a much larger hotel. The terrace just made the meal surpass most. The hotel also provided us with great meal suggestions for the two nights were were there. The central location made seeing all sides of Venice effortless. We were an equal distance from tourist packed area and almost whisper quiet streets where you can hear your footsteps. As an additional note, the map the hotel provided was much better than anything i found in our guide books. I thought we would go to Venice once in our lifetime (so many other places in the world to check off the list) but I am seriously considering a return for a future aniversary, just to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay- Unforgetable!”
Reviews.Author: Youngfamilyman2
Reviews.Content: I have to say that having visited many hotels with my wife this has to be the best. You couldnt ask for more. The owners attention to detail, passion for his work and eye for what a hotel should offer are beyond expectations. There are many exceptional features of the Antico and I will try to summarise the most important. But still this review will not be enough to do it justice. You simply must visit as the experinece is ineffable. The second we arrived we were overwhelmed by the hotels beauty, charm and the way in which the owner (Matteo)has lovingly restored this old venetian palace. He has spared no expense for its extravagance. The terrace is a real beauty and offers a perfect way to start the morning with breakfast. I cannot say enough how beautiful the view is and how much it added to the enjoyment of our experinece. The view is perfectly complemented by the fact that MATTEO lovingly makes breakfast for all his guests with his own personal and unique, impeccable manner. He made us omlette with eggs from his grandma's farm. They were great. The standout feature of this hotel is the SERVICE. I dont belive I have received service like it. Matteo has trained all staff to greet you with your first name from the moment you arrive. It seems like the staff cant do enough without it being too intrusive. Their only concern is your enjoyment! As you can tell from the review we loved the hotel and anytime we visit Venive we will not stay anywhere else. Matteo has created an unforgetable Venetian experience. He clearly has a gift and he and his staff have ensured that me and my wife we return time and time again. The hotel was flawless. You must stay here. Finally Thannkyou to Matteo and all his staff. See you soon Phil and Jo

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: sbkiwi
Reviews.Content: Just like every review before this has described, the terrace and the view of the Rialto bridge (only a stone's throw away) is fantastic. We had the room adjacent to the terrace and most evenings we were the only couple out there which was very romantic. Matteo's passion about his hotel and Venice itself is very obvious and charming. I probably wouldn't stay here again purely because of the cost, but it was a very memorable boutique hotel which enhanced our Venice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Denholm
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research on hotels in Venice, both on this forum and independent resources my Husband and I decided on the Al Ponte Antico for our 5 night stay in Venice as part of our 25th Wedding Anniversary celebrations, and we were not disappointed, as previous posters have already said the welcome afforded by Matteo, Oliver, Thomas, Rosalba, and all the staff was exceptional. I made the booking directly with the hotel and they responded immediately the whole process of booking was made so easy, plus our subsequent emails with requests for them to recommend restaurants and booking dinner reservations were all answered with great efficiency. We arrived by water taxi early evening which in itself was a fantastic experience to be greeted at the door by Matteo and Oliver, who greeted us like long lost friends, Matteo escorted us around the hotel, and showed us to our room, we had booked the deluxe canal facing room, which was decorated in traditional Venitian fabrics and had very large windows overlooking the canal, our room was practically next to the balcony, which became our favourite place to sit in the early evening sunshine sipping one of Matteos Spritz and G&T's just fantastic, if I had one minor criticism it would be about the bathroom, for the standard of room the bathroom was poor with only a shower no bath which I did miss and the bathroom was so small somedays I felt quite claustrophobic, but this is only a minor gripe as the service and cleanliness of the room was all excellent, also very well air conditioned, which it needed to be as the weather was very hot when we were there although it could get a little noisy, but again not a major problem, As has been said before Matteo's breakfasts were very good, my Husband one morning ask for fried bread to go with his eggs which Matteo found very strange but made it for him and it was delicious I also enjoyed the cappuccino coffees at breakfast, I also drink a lot of water, and after asking for a bottle of Frizante on the first morning they remembered and every morning without being asked they brought me a bottle it was those little touches that made our stay extra special. The hotel is in a very conveniant area close enough to the Rialto bridge, and only a ten minute walk to St. Marks Square but away from all the hustle and bustle that is Venice, also very near the Vap stops, which made getting out and about very easy. I must also mention that on our return to the hotel each evening after dinner Thomas would make me a delicious cappuccino with a Zambucca he was wonderful a big thank you Thomas for making the end of our days in Venice so memorable sitting on that wonderful balcony watching all the activities on the Grand Canal just perfect. Matteo told us that he has bought another hotel in Tuscany, which I can't wait to visit once the renovations are completed if it is half as good as the Al Ponte Antico it will be fantastic One final thing on the day of our departure which was our 25th Wedding Anniversary my Husband had organized with Matteo to deliver a bottle of Processco to our room which he did and then we enjoyed the rest of it with our leisurely breakfast before departing by water taxi to the train station for the 2nd leg of our Italian tour to Lake Garda. A huge thank you to Matteo and all the team for making our Silver Wedding celebrations so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Venice? You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: HLees
Reviews.Content: Always use trip advisor to book but have never been inspired to write a review before! Stayed Fr and Sat in August. Amazing place, mainly due to fabulous 1)location, 2)rooms 3)staff. Location on Grand Canal nr Rialto Bridge is perfect. In busy time about 10 mins walk to St Mark's Square and easliy accessible by water taxi or by Vaperetto to Rialto and then 2 mins walk. View from upper terrace where you have breakfast/drinks is amazing and totally unique. Our room was perfect, booked Deluxe with Grand Canal view - was to die for and views amazing, even more the lower shared tearrace was right outside our room meaning you could climb out window to access....and even though is a shared terrace we were only guests to use it for entire weekend and sat outside room reading/drinking on the Grand Canal with many people on passing boats enviously poiting and even taking pics! Staff were super. Matteo went out of his way to make excellent recommendations and delicious breakfasts - cold and hot buffet and eggs and pancakes to order. Oliver also delightful and very flattering/charming ...the perfect gent for any lady to see before a night out as would always comment charmingly about looking elegant or other similarly charming things! ...all staff super helpful and keen to address on first name terms. I came back and went straight on there web page to book again in October - only to be disappointed that they are already fully booked! So if you're visiting Venice book here and don't miss out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Al Ponte Antico - would absolutely stay there if ever in Venice again!”
Reviews.Author: Pandora427
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at Al Ponte Antico for 2 nights this May and absolutely loved it. The hotel is beautiful with a wonderful bar and a terrace area overlooking the Grand Canal, but what we enjoyed most were the people. Matteo, the owner, and the rest of the staff were amazing. Everyone was so warm and helpful. We received very good restaurant recommendations for dinner, and in the mornings a lovely breakfast was provided courtesy of Matteo. Although I was there with my mom, and therefore not looking for romance, it would also be a great choice for a couple. Our stay at Al Ponte Antico was one of the most memorable parts of our visit to Venice. I highly recommend it if you're looking for a beautiful, small hotel with a staff that will do their best to welcome you to Venice and provide you with helpful tips and recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “The most incredible service you'll ever experience”
Reviews.Author: PureVodka
Reviews.Content: You can't really describe how wonderful this beautiful boutique hotel is. It was our honeymoon and from the moment my wife and I arrived we were greeted with genuine sincerity and warmth by Oliver, one of the hotel's many brilliant staff. Matteo, the manager, has trained all his staff to greet their guests by first names and they really went out of their way to ensure our stay was excellent. Matteo himself cooks the amazing breakfasts in a beautifully elegant dining room that leads out to a terrace, which are quite rare in Venice. The view is outstanding - on the centre of the Grande Canal, you overlook the Realto Bridge and can savour some gorgeous sunsets. The rooms are decorated in classical Venetian style and are kept immaculately. The hotel location is less than 5 minutes from San Marco square and in what feels like one of the most prestigious parts of the city. In addition, the staff at Al Ponte Antico all know some really great gastronomic finds that are neatly away from the bustling crowds. Having stayed in hotels across the world I can honestly say I've never in my life experienced hospitality like this. It really was the finest example of a hotelier taking the utmost pride in what he does. I would thoroughly recommend staying at this hotel, but book ahead - it's no suprise this place is booked up well in advance! We wish Matteo and his staff the very best success and look forward to his new ventures!

Reviews.Title: “weird place”
Reviews.Author: LeanneWhitt
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Antico is unlike other hotels we've stayed in. Its not a hotel in the traditional sense, more like a bed and breakfast establishment. Its small, dark and a bit of a rabbit warren with a dungeon like feel. We had 2 rooms, junior suite and standard. The bathrooms were disappointingly cramped with low ceilings, small showers, no bath in the junior suite. Towels were thin and could be a bit grubby. There were plastic cups. Some of the lights weren't functioning. They had the feeling of cabin bathrooms in a caravan park. Most disappointing. The junior suite was large with some nice antiques. The beds were hard and pillows lumpy. I had to ask for another pillow which I received. The suite room opened onto the grand canal which is their main thoroughfare, therefore noisy, busy and smelly. Result couldn't open window. Same for the standard room which was almost internal. This room was so dark the lights had to be on all day and window couldn't be opened due to hideous smell like sewer/drains in the lane. Not the hotels fault of course. Both rooms were dark and depressing, despite ours being large there was still a claustrophobic feel. It was impossible to use the rooms for reading, relaxation or respite as too dark and depressing. The common areas consist of a bar/breakfast room which is not airconditioned and a terrace over the canal. Both of these areas were so hot (we went in July) that it was uncomfortable. We were immediately sweating. I understand however that this is Venice in July. I would have thought a 4 star hotel would have aircon in common areas though. Please note this room is nicely furnished and has a desk with computer access. In summary there was nowhere to relax and get out of the heat and the crowds of venice as common areas too hot and bedrooms too depressing. Note also that at this time of year Venice is very hot and overcrowded that it can be an unpleasant experience. Not the hotels fault also. The hotel just happens to be located in the busiest area. Despite this we still managed to have late afternoon drinks in the bar or on the terrace. The wine was good, there were no nibbles served except for soggy chips. Their restaurant recommendations were quite good, although we all got sick in the stomach. Staff. Other trip advisors are more positive. We felt invaded. Yes they are super friendly and know your names which they use all the time and yes you get the spiel about grandmothers eggs and lectures on lots of other subjects. Its all rehearsed, like they've memorised a script. You hear them saying the same things to everyone. You couldn't leave your room without someone talking at you. It was quite creepy and invasive. Perhaps this type of intimacy suits some travellers but we prefer restrained contact and a little more anonimity. We needed to leave a day early and despite giving 2 days notice we were charged for the 2 rooms in full. Staff said instead of deducting from the bill this time that we could have a credit when we came again. If we were getting a nights credit why not just deduct it when we were there? Very odd!! Note there is no room service to speak of. To put this report in perspective please note we are well travelled and hotels we stayed in for this year's trip were San Regis Paris, Egerton House in London, Rome Cavillieri, Sacher Wien in Vienna and Villa Carlotta in Taormina. These are all 4 or 5 star hotels and live up to it. Al Ponte Antico's 4 star rating is in our opinion questionable. It is certaintly too expensive for what it offers. All in all it is a wierd place and certainly not for us again, even though we do have a supposed credit.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: PalmDesertTravelers
Reviews.Content: We wound up a 4 week trip with our best friends to Italy, Spain, the Balearics, and France by staying at Al Ponte Antico Hotel in Venice. Molly and I had met Matteo and Barbara, the owners, when we stayed for the first time about 6 years ago at their Locanda Orseolo Hotel (also very highly recommended) near St. Marks square, and had visited the Al Ponte Antico hotel just a few months after they had purchased it so no renovations had yet begun. Well, the renovations have been completed and are just stunning. The small, 9 room hotel has been completely refurbished in traditional Venetian style and it's just beautiful. The location is breathtaking, being on the Grand Canal about 200 meters from the Rialto Bridge. We never got tired of sitting on the second floor hotel patio in the morning watching all the delivery boats making their rounds, or in the afternoon watching the day trippers stream out of the city, and the gondolas making their evening rounds. The rooms are large and spacious and several have views of the Grand Canal. Matteo's breakfast omlettes and food selections are marvelous, and the full bar makes for a great cocktail hour watching the busy traffic on the Grand Canal. The staff reflects Matteo's philosophy of superb, friendly and efficient service and is just a delight. And being a native Venetian, Matteo is an encyclopedia of little visited sights in the city and wonderful, intimate restaurants easily within walking distance of the hotel. He is also passionate about his city, and it's impossible not to get caught up in his enthusiasm for this unique and fascinating city. This not the least expensive hotel in Venice, but the facility, the staff, and location are well worth the cost - one of those incredible experiences everyone should treat themselves to now and then. Curt & Molly Maloy Palm Desert, California

Reviews.Title: “Really wonderful start to Italian holiday”
Reviews.Author: Get_Me_0utta_Here
Reviews.Content: Venice was the first stop on our 2-week Italian holiday and was the ideal way to kick it off. The feel is much more intimate than any of the other hotels where we stayed - the pride the whole staff takes in the hotel is clear. Matteo, Armando, Oliviero, Rosalba, and the rest of the team are the most gracious of hosts. The location is fantastic - right near the Rialto Bridge and within minutes of St. Mark's. Given the maze-like nature of Venice, the ubiquitous signs around the city pointing back to the Riatlo and St. Marks make getting back to the hotel a breeze. The rooms are very comfortable. We actually stayed in two different rooms since we extended our stay for one night but our room was not available...the switch was seamless. More impressively, we were put in the Junior Suite for the last night - the highest category of room they have. Of all the breakfasts we had in Italy the one at Al Ponte Antico was the best. Freshly prepared eggs, fruit, perfect cappuccino, and pastries...all of high quality. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking to experience Venice in a very comfortable setting where the staff truly treats you as a guest in their home rather than a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: csuosu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Antico for 3 nights in July as part of a three week trip through Europe. The Al Ponte Antico has a fantastic location on the Grand Canal and our room had a view of the Rialto Bridge. The room itself was very large by European standards and was exceptional in every respect. I should mention that last year we were in Venice and stayed at the Ca Dei Dogi which we thought was a fantastic hotel. The fact that the Al Ponte Antico exceeded that experience is a tribute to the owner and staff. What sets this hotel apart from others we have stayed in is the service. The owner, Matteo is tireless. He gets to the hotel around 5 am and doesn't leave until around 10. Not only does he see to it that each guest is comfortable, but he does everything from personally cooking breakfast including omeletes and crepes, to serving evening cocktails on the shared balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. I have to share an experience which shows what a great host Matteo is. We were traveling with my parents who decided to stay at a different hotel. We all arrived at the Al Ponte Antico and after checking us in, I asked Matteo if he could give us directions to my parents hotel. Instead of simply giving us the directions, he actually walked us to the other hotel over a series of bridges, down a street and a couple of alleys. In fact, he carried my parents luggage and refused my request that I carry the luggage. I cannot use words strong enough to recommend this hotel. It was fabulous in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Magic”
Reviews.Author: Jolize
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in Venice (I know WAY too short) and decided to make that one night extra special. Well, we could not have picked a better place to spend that one night. We had a room with the ultimate view - right on the canal and a couple of meters away from the Rialto bridge. The room was beautifully decorated in true plush Venentian splendour. The bathroom was a bit dissappointingly small & cramped compared to the lovely spacious 5 star room. Matteo and his staff were phenominal, from our welcome to the magnificent breakfast (best we had in al of Italy). IWhen we go back to Venice we will head straight back to the Al Ponte Antico.

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: bundeera
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are used to staying in larger 4 and 5 star hotels in Australia & Asia (which have quite a different rating system to Europe). We were a little reticent to stay in a small hotel with a 4 star rating (by European standards!). But heartened by previous reviewers we took the plunge. And what a refreshing plunge it was! Hotel Al Ponte Antico is a small hotel - only 9 rooms. The room (Room #105) was furnished in typical Venetian style without being kitsch. The bedroom was about 20-23sq metres not including the bathroom which was a little small but modern & bright and had good facilities. There was a couch, coffee table, davenport with large drawers, cabinet with w fridge/minibar, and wardrobe with drawers. It had more than adequate storage. There was adequate lighting but not a lot of light from the windows which faced onto other buildings - everything is closely situated in Venice. The room was very quiet. However on 2 days there was a dull intermittent thumping which appeared to be coming from somewhere outside the hotel (not the fault of the hotel) but did not create a substantial problem. There is a computer connected to the internet . WiFi is available within the hotel at no charge. The staff really make the place. The owner Matteo (over whom the females of all ages go a little gah gah), his team of helpers Armando, Oliver, Tomasso & David together with the ancillary staff, Rosalba & Ines make you extremely welcome. Nothing is too much. They are really concerned that your stay is A1+++. I discovered one of the 2 aircon units in the room was not working; it was repaired the following day. Addressing is by first names. The atmosphere is informal and very friendly and being such a small hotel the guests all talk to each other (people used to do that 40-50 years ago....)adding to the experience. Wait till you breakfast on the terrace outside the bar/breakfast room overlooking the Grande Canal and the Rialto Bridge which I estimate is less than 150m away! And the breakfasts were great with Matteo doubling as breakfast chef to do the eggs the way you want them. The location is great. It is on the southern edge of Canaregio, a 10-15 minute walk (ideally) to St Marks Square. Why Ideally? Because you will get waylaid in a shop or two or perhaps 150! If that doesn't happen then you get lost; but that is what you do in Venice - walk, get lost and discover new things! Wheeling luggage through Venetian streets, up and down bridges is for the young & fit without much luggage. Do yourself a favour: from the station take a water taxi (eu50 per taxi) or the airport (eu95 per taxi). If you can get up to six passengers, the price per head drops dramatically and for 6 people is less expensive than the public system which leaves you lugging your baggage. Expensive for 2 people? Yes! But youâ€™re worth! The hotel has its own private water stop out the 'back' door which makes baggage handling a snap. (let the taxi 'driver' lift the bags out; it may save you from an unexpected swim in the Grande Canal!). Wonderful stay, highly recommended and thanks to the team at Hotel Al Ponte Antico!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Staff We Ever Met”
Reviews.Author: TravelMore1954
Reviews.Content: Al Ponte Antico Hotel is a small boutique type hotel with a great location on the Grand Canal. Traveling to the hotel is very convenient by water taxi as the hotel has its own dock. It is located only steps away from the Rialto Bridge and a ten minute walk from San Marco Piazza. The view from the hotel's balcony off the main room was spectacular. Our air-conditioned room was large and comfortable. The bathroom was adequate, but getting in and out of the shower/tub was somewhat awkward. An excellent breakfast was served every morning in the main room, featuring croissants, fresh fruit, meats, cheeses, omelets, and crepes. The coffee was excellent. But, the best part of the Al Ponte Antico Hotel was the staff. The owner, Matteo, set the standard for warmest possible hospitality. He was incredibly friendly and very focused on making our stay a wonderful experience. He personally cooked breakfast for the guests, but did not let that get in the way of making sure that our day trip itinerary full. Besides Matteo, the rest of the staff - Oliver, Rosalba, Armando, and Thomas - were all very special and their concern for our comfort and well being was very genuine. Touring around Venice was a lot of fun, but we looked forward to returning to the Hotel each evening because we knew we would be warmly greeted and made to feel like family. The Al Ponte Antico Hotel is a beautiful place, and it is run by the best hotel staff we have ever met. We look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “charmingly charming ... and what a view!”
Reviews.Author: grdl72
Reviews.Content: The view, the view, the view! The VIEW!!!!!!! I cannot imagine anything much better than sitting on a terrace 50 yards or so away from the Rialto, sipping a cocktail and watching Venetian life drift by on the Grand Canal a mere platform-dive away. Heaven. If this isn't enough, then the rest of the hotel should be - it is a charmingly restored Venetian palace which speaks directly to the decadent past-present of Venice. Matteo and his team are comparably charming - they are impeccable hosts. The rooms themselves are fairly standard, if perfectly comfortable, affairs - this is a choice made primarily on position and ambience. And the view of course ...

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: smithdj2416
Reviews.Content: Echoing everything said before. I have never been anywhere before where staff were so attentive and genuinely interested in making the stay as perfect as possible. From restaurant choices to what to do (and not do!) all of the advice was to help us get the most out of our stay. Matteo is such a gracious and witty host. The view is just stunning. We spent 3 hours on the terrace just watching the canal. It is amazing to see it in the different lights as night falls. Breakfast is fantastic. The eggs from Matteo's grandmother's farm are best I've tasted and the coffee machine has to be seen to be believed. All in all it was a perfect stay and I don't hesitate in recommending it to others. We will be back to Venice and there is only one place we will stay

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT, EASILY THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: thepanamahat
Reviews.Content: The title says it all, I am sure there are plenty of wonderful hotels,but this one just blew us away. My wife has put this hotel down for our weekend trips. From the moment we arrived to our departure, we were made to feel special. Thank you to Mateo, Olivero, Rosabela and the rest of the staff. I would recomend this hotel for that special occasion, a honeymoon, anniversary or weekend trips. We stayed for 2 nights before joining the Ruby Princess for a 12 day cruise, I could write forever but less is more, go and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Matteo is the best!”
Reviews.Author: kohler5
Reviews.Content: I know this is the common theme of reviews of this hotel, but after a stay here you can't help but rave about the staff. The owner, Matteo, is an incredibly charismatic host and he seems to genuinely care if his guests are enjoying their stay. The location of the hotel is superb. It was easy to navigate with the proximity to the Rialto Bridge and even though the hotel sits on the Grand Canal there is no foot traffic nearby so the hotel is quiet. Our group of 5 was split into 2 rooms...3 members were in room 102 which has a view of the Grand Canal and sits right off of the dining room. Very big room and relatively quiet. My husband and I were in room 107 which is on the ground floor...no view, but very very quiet. I loved this! This is the first hotel I've ever been in that I didn't need to wear ear plugs to sleep. Very comfortable bed, bathroom was spacious and the shower was great. Both rooms were very clean and comfortable. Thank you Matteo, Oliver, Tomas, Rosealba, Essie, Armando and David!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: a5ecretagenda
Reviews.Content: Was looking forward to staying here and it really didn't dissapoint. We arrived, and without speaking a word we were greeted by our first names by the owner of the hotel, which left us both fairly stunned. We were shown around the hotel by him, whilst our bags were whisked away to our room. After a quick chat to give us some advice on what to see and when to see it, we were led to our room. The room was absolutely stunning, much larger and plusher than what I was expecting, and the photos on the website don't really do it justice. The bathroom (with seperate dressing room) was also lovely, with a whirlpool bath. The only slight gripe I had was the low ceiling in the bathroom, which means if you are tall (I'm 6'3"), you can't stand fully upright when in the shower. But given the age of the building, it's to be expected! Breakfast was a delight, sitting out on the terrace over looking the Grand Canal and the Rialto bridge, as was the service at all times of the day. Every member of staff remembers your first name, and will happily chat to you about nearly anything! The views really are fabulous, and it's quite tempting to just spend the entire day sat on the terrace with a Spritz or two! The location is fantastic too, only a minute away from the Rialto bridge, 10 minutes from St Marks, and right in the middle of all the good value 'non-touristy' restaurants. Even the (very fast) wireless internet is free as well. We got excellent advice on where to eat and what to do, really did help enjoy our Venice experience to the full. The price may seem a little pricey at first, but this has to be the best value hotel I've ever stayed in, it really does make your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Personal touch does not describe it -best service I ever had”
Reviews.Author: newspike
Reviews.Content: I read dozens of reviews before I booked this hotel and, like other reviewers, I had very high expectations. Our train from Florence was 3 hrs late. We took a water taxi to the hotel (highly recommended - costs 50 euro but worth it based on talking to others who did not take it) - the hotel has a dock right on the grand canal and views the Rialto bridge. Cannot beat that. You feel like a king arriving on that water way in your own boat. The owner Matteo met us at the dock. He already knew our names and personally carried our luggage in. Like others, he gave us a tour of the hotel, told us to get settled in, and then gave us excellent dinner recommendations. We had a ground floor room. Very nice with a large bathroom (room at the back of the hotel, not on the grand canal). Hotel only has 9 rooms so you get personal service. Every staff member will know your name and address you personally. Matteo himself seems, honestly, like you would expect a Venetian prince to be 400 years ago. Sounds funny, I know, but just trying to describe him. Incredibly personable and filled with stories of Venice and its culture, night life, etc. Recommend going to the Piazza San Marco late at night to listen to the Orchestras - much nicer at night then during the day.
