We have traveled to Europe for 3 straight years - stayed at some dumps and some gems, including five star hotels in the St Regis chain, Starwood brands, Romantik hotel chain, and many others. This is not a 5 star resort - but I will tell you, I have never had better service at a hotel. I was not big on even going to Venice (my wife wanted to) but I plan on going back simply to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the best hotel I have ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: freddy208
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Venice from Florence were i had started to feel sick, i really needed to be able to enjoy the last leg of my Italian Vacation. We pulled up to the Al Ponte via water taxi and were promptly greeted by the owner of the hotel, Matteo and one of the other amazing staff members. Matteo greeted us earnestly and gave us a wonderful tour of his hotel before leading us personally to our rooms. The hotel itself is a small boutique hotel, but is full of character. The lobby is beautifully decorated with padded red cloth and a subtle entryway. The second floor, which housed our rooms, had a full bar with an espresso/ cappuccino machine that looked like a piece of art. The lounge room was painted red and then brushed over with gold paint, and it had matching booths were you could sip wine or a "spritz" and listen to the relaxing music. The second floor also had a balcony with a wonderful view of the grand canal and the Rialto bridge. The rooms were perfectly decorated with a Louis XIV style and antique furniture. Every morning we would rise and eat the great breakfast prepared by Matteo, and at night we would ask for a restaurant recommendation that never failed to please. The hotel staff was the most attentive and friendly staff that i have ever met, and i have stayed at many five star hotels. At night, the security guard was more of a friend to talk to about cars and Italian culture. One night at around 1am, we felt like a glass of wine and he came upstairs to the bar and poured us all wine!! All in all, i have to say staying at this hotel was the best choice i have ever made as far as accommodations goes. I look forward to going back and staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly gracious hosts!”
Reviews.Author: Sondra W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights recently as part of our 25th anniversary trip. The only reason I didn't give a perfect score is that I don't believe one goes to Venice for it's value and our room had no view. Our room was categorized as a "classic room". Having said that, I agree with all the good things that have been said about this hotel. It's a cozy boutique hotel. The owner and his team treat you as if you are special guests in their home. We have never been treated so well in a hotel. We had an absolutely wonderful and relaxing time and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: paris27
Reviews.Content: The Al Ponte Antico hotel is amazing....just as all the previous reveiws have mentioned! We (myself, 45 and 2 nieces 18 & 21) stayed 2 nights prior to a cruise and amazing does not even begin to describe our experience. I think they make copies of your passport (they have to) and then have all the staff memorize who we are, 'cause they always knew us by name and got all 3 straight! We'd walk into the room and hear "Ciao Laura, Emily and Sarah"! We booked the front room that had a huge window that opened onto the Grand Canal (see photos)...unfortunately I can't remember the room number though. It was huge and had 3 separate beds for us. The bathroom wasn't that large and only had a shower, but it served it's purpose! We thought it would be loud being on the canal, but when you closed the window it was very quiet! Matteo was wonderful and recommended a restaurant for dinner that first night. We were pretty tired from flying so didn't want to go out too late (as they usually do in Venice!) so he recommend a place that opened at 7 that was right near the hotel. The hotel was the perfect spot for walking around Venice....a 10 minute stroll to the Piazza San Marco and very easy to all other things we wanted to see. Matteo, David, Armando,Oliver and Rosalda were all wonderful. They would remember what we had for breakfast and for drinks the day before and asked if we wanted the same thing or something different. Matteo made us omelets (as has been mentioned before...with eggs fresh from his grandmother's farm!) and also chocolate crepes. There was cereal, juices, crossants, meats etc...as well. Quite a nice spread to start the day! David made us spritzes one night and Oliver made us something different the next night. We met a few other guests who had stayed there before and said they wouldn't have stayed anywhere else in Venice! Feel free to e-mail me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Six star service”
Reviews.Author: gazza6
Reviews.Content: Sadly we only stayed one night at this wonderful hotel. Believe me it is the most fantastic place to stay in Venice and that is due to the warm welcome & amazing staff at the hotel. The wonderful Matteo is extremely proud of his hotel and the staff fall over themselves to make you feel at home offering all kinds of useful advice and greeting you by name. I would say this is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed at in terms of personal service and the sincerity of the staff, Matteo serves the best coffee I have ever tasted from his unusually bizarre and unique coffee machine.The hotel is ideally situated right near the Rialto Bridge on the Grand Canal with fantastic views of it from the terrace. It is easy to see why it has been voted as one of the best hotels in Europe for service. Many other hotels could do well to watch real professionals in action and this is how it should be done. I would love to return here one day and hopefully for a much longer stay,

Reviews.Title: “NBV in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LiznAlf
Reviews.Content: Don't normally do reviews but like evreryone else I feel Matteo and his team deserve yet another over the top, gushing review. The curious thing after three days celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary I really have no idea how or why this hotel does what it does. It has to be THE world-wide model for hotel service. (Other hotel managers please visit and sit at Matteos alter and beg him to tell you how he does it. That way the world will be a better place.). One little story says it all. My wife has never been to Venice (re-chrustned NBV for the past 2 years) and saved the exeperience for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Unbeknown to her our childern were due to viist us on the day for a surprise dinner. Matteo fixed up the stunning location (by the way his recommendations are the best - he never slags off the inferior guest choices, he just suggests something better - go with it!). In his amazingly uncomplicated, efficient way on arrival he confirmed our booking for 4 in front of my wife . Disaster. Surprise no longer. Matteo genuiinely mortified - he is fallible after all. Instant appologies and next day pink champagen on the house. Which other hotel in the world would do this. So,well done to you all. You richly deserve to continue as Venice's top-rated hotel and to receive all the accolades, just don't put the prices up and keep your feet on the ground. We will be back. Liz and Simon

Reviews.Title: “Most memorable stay in Italy”
Reviews.Author: dc_traveler_007
Reviews.Content: If you want an experience that you will never forget, stay at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel. Although the prices can be hefty, you will experience Venice in a way that everyone should experience Venice for the first time. First, the hotel sits at one of the elbows of the backwards-S-shaped Grand Canal where you can have breakfast or grab an afternoon drink and sit at the hotel balcony and have a spectacular view of the boats and gondolas drifting in and then leaving out toward the near-by Rialto Bridge. I could easily have sat there for hours. Second, the hotel's location is premium--nestled in a small and safe alley where noise is not a problem. St. Mark's Square is only a 5-10 minute walk away; Rialto Bridge and the fisherman market are 3-minutes away. Third, the rooms are spacious and extravagantly decorated. We stayed in Room 101 (I think) where the approximately 20-foot tall room is ornamented by plush floor-to-ceiling fabric-covered walls, antique furniture and a glamorous over-hanging chandelier--it felt like royalty. We even went to Doge's Palace and noted how similar one of the palace bedrooms looked like our hotel bedroom. Rooms with canal views cost a premium but are worth it in my opinion. Lastly and most importantly, the hotel owner Matteo and his staff are phenomenal. I have never stayed at a place where people treated you so kindly and so generously and went so out-of-their-way to make your accommodations the best-ever. You can tell that everyone at the hotel loved their job and genuinely wanted to make your stay pleasurable and so memorable. Some people go to Venice and just view the sites, ride the gondolas and eat great meals. But what they miss is the wonderful interaction and hospitality Italians are well-renown for that separates "seeing" Venice and "experiencing" Venice. It has been almost a year since our stay, but we still talk about it regularly and reminisce of our sensational and unforgettable experience we had in Venice and at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: DANDLArundel
Reviews.Content: Despite having read reviews prior to booking, the experience far exceeded our expectations. We wholeheartedly agree with all that has been written before. This is a really special place and we both feel very lucky to have stayed here. The service provided by Matteo and his team was perfect, nothing was too much trouble. His restaurant recommendations were excellent and, of course, his breakfasts on the balcony - with his grandmothers eggs - looking out over the canal will be an enduring memory. The attention to detail, particularly always being greeted by all of the staff by name, really was wonderful. We were made to feel very special. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best.....”
Reviews.Author: wanderingbear
Reviews.Content: I could write a long, gushing review for this wonderful hotel, but there is nothing I can say that hasn't already been said before - a hundred times over. Every word is absolutely true. You have to experience it for yourself to understand how wonderful and unique a stay at the Al Ponte Antico really is. All there is really left to say, is a heartfelt thank you - To Matteo and Oliver and Tomas and Rosalba and all of the wonderful staff there - for making our stay in Venice exceptional. ( I think my eleven-year old daughter still has a crush on Matteo : )) I can't recall ever feeling sad to leave a hotel before, but this time it was, with Matteo and his staff waving goodbye as our water taxi sped away down the Grand Canal. We will definitely be back and look forward to trying the new Peruch Family hotel in Tuscany when it is completed. Bellissima!

Reviews.Title: “Nobody does it better!”
Reviews.Author: wendyboston
Reviews.Content: There isn't much I can add to previous reviews except to say that they are all true. The service was the best we have ever experienced, location perfect, restaurant recommendations great and sitting on the Terrace with a Spritz whilst watching the activity on the canal was one of the highlights of the trip! Thanks Matteo and team.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recommend ths hotel enough”
Reviews.Author: LandDEssex
Reviews.Content: Well, what can i say?? This hotel was fabulous. I have never written a review before, but this hotel deserves it. We had a deluxe room overlooking the river, which was large, clean and beautiful. The wonderful terrace was the highlight of our whole trip. The location is superb. Matteo and his staff are a delight. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: EAS111
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on Trip Advisor. No wonder this hotel is rated number 1 in Venice. It is a beautifully renovated 14th Century Palace , converted into a 9 room hotel. It is right on the grand Canal and there are amazing views from its lovely terrace. It is centrally located, you can see the Rialto Bridge from the hotel terrace and its a 10 minute walk to San Marks Square. It has its own mooring for arrival by water taxi from the airport, a great and convenient way to arrive and depart. But what makes this hotel special is its customer service. Its staff led by Matteo treat you like long lost friends. There is none of this false friendliness you see in other hotels. This is sincere and is some of the best customer service I have experienced in any hotel around the World. It all starts with Matteo. A charming and affable and multi lingual owner and host. Great company as you have a glass of Prosecco on the terrace. And by the way his Omelets are the best i have tasted. Only minor quibble is that room 2 was slightly noisy with noise coming from outside of the hotel early and latish, but I am a light sleeper. But this is minor when is considered with the total experience of 2 night stay. Finally if you fancy a special meal book a table at Osteria San marino nearby. Great food and the Tiramisu is excellent

Reviews.Title: “An experience that worth a lot!”
Reviews.Author: Val_tina
Reviews.Content: It is my first review on Tripadvisor, Iâ€™m not used to record my opinions on internet but we (me and my partner) were so well impressed about this hotel so I felt the need to write a positive appraisal about it. We visit quite often Italy especially the Veneto region for business reasons; when we have few time we go in Venice which is the place of our heart. At the beginning of May â€™09 we booked a room at this hotel which was recommended by one of our friends for the last night of our 4 days stay ; this was because other hotels where we used to stay were not available for that night and it proved to be our luck. There are a lot of good reviews on this site about Al Ponte Antico so itâ€™s useless to write again the same things. As people who know what does it means the accommodation and various experience in Venice we can only confirm all the positive opinions here and guarantee that the real experience in this hotel could be more than is written. We thanks to Matteo and his staff for our beautiful experience at Ponte Antico and wish them good luck and success to continue the action they started few years ago. Matteo, you have to know that we managed to feel in love again on your terrace, in the evening lights, the boats on Grand Canale, the shadow of Ponte Rialto, that gentle music, two elegant glasses of wine... thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Matteo and his Team”
Reviews.Author: JohnandBeccaCumbria
Reviews.Content: Becca and I have to agree with the rest. Matteo Peruch and his amazing staff deliver the finest service we have experienced, and do so as friends. They are helpful, witty and amusing, and multi-lingual â€“ with even some Cumbrian spoken now. Rooms, breakfast, dÃ©cor, etc. all of the highest order, but the highlight is sipping Prosecco or Matteoâ€™s wonderful Spritzers on the first floor terrace. Look one way to see all the fascinating water traffic of the Grand Canal, the other to the Rialto Bridge â€“ within a few metres. The scene is constantly changing, and from breakfast, to afternoon coffee, to pre and aprÃ¨s dinner drinks the entertainment of Veniceâ€™s main waterway is laid out before you. Not for bargain hunters or the financially faint hearted, but if you can do it then you must. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Same as the rest!”
Reviews.Author: RM3110
Reviews.Content: Virtually every previous review more or less says it all, but wouldnt want to miss the opportunity to add a few words. Great location, fantastic view of the Canal from our junior suite, delightful and varied breakfasts..... but the staff!!! The most welcoming, pleasant, charming hotel staff I have ever come across, anywhere in the world. From the moment we arrived we were treated like long lost friends. Within about 10 minutes the staff all new our names and introduced them-selves to us in a most engaging way. Matteo, as owner and very visible manager, effused charm and knowledge of his adopted city. It could have been sickly and over-done, yet it never was. A minor issue on the room was that there was a fairly thin wall at the rear to an adjoining room, but some noise from children who were occupying it was quickly dealt with by Oliver on reception. This isnt a cheap hotel, but worth it if you want to be treated like Royalty. And three tips......firstly take Matteo's advice on restaurants, secondly, if you see one church, go to the Frari , not St. Marks, and third: take a private water taxi from the airport to the hotel...its 95 euros but absolutely the best way to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience in a fab location with incredible service”
Reviews.Author: stish
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as part of our honeymoon trip to Itlay, which also included the Lakes and Sardinia. The location looked like it was fantastic, I liked the idea that there were only a small number of rooms and the trip advisor reviews had been very positive. So I already had very high hopes. These were far, far exceeded. The hotel itself was beautiful with an incredible dining area that is used as a bar for residents in the evening and breakfast in the morning, served by the owner himself. Our room (we took the ground floor suite) looked onto the grand canel within a stones throw of the Rialto Bridge and was spacious and very nicely decorated. We were able to sit out on our terrace and watch the boats float buy in the sunshine. The main differentiator however were the staff. Oli met us on arrival and took great pleasure showing us round and organsing a restaurant for a late lunch. Mattieu had also arranged flowers and prosecco and a beautfiul note for my wife. Above all, they could not do more to help and their pride in the hotel and the city was obivous. Mattieu also made a mean omlete in the morning. Even the night doorman was funny and friendly. We were just made to feel so welcome and we will certainly be coming back. Any minor negatives? While the bathroom was very clean and nice the shower could have more modern. That was probably all we could think of. While this is not a cheap hotel, i would still recommend it to anyone that can afford it in an instant. We just had a superb time

Reviews.Title: “Al Ponte Antico = A Magical Venice Experience”
Reviews.Author: aussieitchyfeet
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed between Xmas and New Year and this was the highlight of a 7 week european holiday! We booked because of the comments on tripadviser and even these can"t match reality.So many hightlights - Our room looked out over the grand canal with a little patio and wow even with the cold weather you could have sat there for hours. Matteo and Oliver and all the staff wher amazing! Yes as soon as you arrive they greet you by name,they made our 9 yr and 18 yr old girls feel very special during our stay.Matteos breakfasts are wonderful (esp as his 90 yr old grandmother supplies the eggs from her farm for breakfast) My husband is still talkng about his scrambled eggs The dinner recommendations where wonderful which made for some memorable evenings with my cousin and husband who were also staying. If you stay dont forget to start your evening with one or two of Matteos Spritzers -AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS. The hotel is central to most things a truly beautiful place on the planet to stay. . We departed by water taxi which added to the magic. We will be back for a longer stay next time maybe for a week or two as you feel you would be returning to stay with old friends.Thanks to Matteo , Oliver and all the staff the memories made are very special .

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should stay here once in their lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: mozwoman
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay at the Al Ponte Antico hotel was the perfect start to our honeymoon and it got better as the days went by. Greeted by name by Tomasso & then Matteo we were made to feel most welcome and the bottle of Prosecco in our room with personal note from Matteo wishing us a happy honeymoon was the icing on the cake. As others have said, the location is perfect, breakfast or early evening drinks on the balcony were always a highlight of the day as you sat and watched the bustle of Venice glide by in a gondola, a vaporetta or private boat. All staff at the hotel were most friendly, always remembering us by name. Matteo was most helpful giving us tips each day to help us make the most of our few days in Venice. His recommendation to go to a Vivaldi concert was a treat as was the dinner reservation he made for us at a nearby restaurant, just mentioning Matteo's name when we arrived led to instant recognition from the owner and a great table. We were sad to leave but will never forget our time in Venice and we will recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Arrive as strangers, leave as friends.”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkMobo
Reviews.Content: The magic of Venice was made more special by Mattoe, his staff and this wonderful small hotel. We celebrated my 60th birthday in a most memorable way by staying at the Al Ponte Antico and it lived up to all of its reviews. We had a wonderful room, lovely breakfast and supurb wine in the most beautiful glasses on the terrace where we shared laughter and good conversation with others. Greetings to everyone we met. We feel we made friends in Matteo and his staff and cannot wait to go back. This kind of hotel is very hard to find and we would love to keep it a secret but that would be selfish. Go if you can, its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: charliebb1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were welcomed off the water taxi at the hotel's own private landing station, we were made to feel very special by Mateos, the owner and the staff at the hotel. They took time to get to know us as friends and throughout the weekend gave us really helpful, unbiased advice about everything we asked. Had a great weekend and would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to other travellers. We have never been to Venice before and, often, places do not meet your expectations. This could not be further from the truth for Venice and Hotel Al Ponte Antico. Venice surpassed expectations and I can't think of anywhere better to stay that at Hotel Al Ponte Antico. The only one slight negative I can mention was that we stayed in a Classic room which was smaller than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service”
Reviews.Author: BLFamily
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults, 2 teenage children) stayed at Al Ponte Antico for 2 nights in March. The location is perfect - easy walking to Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square. The view on the canal was wonderful. Best of all was the service by Matteo and Oliviero and the rest, who were wanting to be sure our stay was perfect. The breakfasts by Matteo were the best in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Very little to add to the other reviews....”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Richard
Reviews.Content: It has all been said before but it bears repeating. Matteo and his team have created (to my mind) the finest hotel experience in Venice. The Al Ponte Antico sets a new standard for service and every aspect of our stay (for our wedding anniversary) was perfect. We particularly enjoyed pre-dinner drinks on the wonderful terrace overlooking the Rialto Bridge. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bravissimo!”
Reviews.Author: Malvernman
Reviews.Content: Such friendly and attentive service from Matteo and his team. He welcomed us by our first names as we stepped off the water taxi. Nothing was too much trouble, for him or his staff. He just loves to help and chat but is unfailingly polite and courteous. Breakfasts were a treat. We wanted a room with a view of the Grand Canal and were prepared for a little noise - but it was very quiet. Our only slight disappointment was that our junior suite on the ground floor had no bath, just a shower. The hotel is very central so you can walk easily to most places: one of the main joys of Venice is avoiding the one real hotspot at St Marks Square and getting lost down little calles, but if you have a good map this is no problem. As good as everyone says it is

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service and location”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything has been said, but I will say it again. Amazing place. Based on TripAdvisor we booked 5 nights here for a quick break from LA. Arrived at the airport and took a water taxi straight to the hotel. Everything was perfect from check-in onward. Matteo makes the place. He'll cook you anything you want for breakfast and then give you hours of his time. We literally talked to him over an hour a day. We saw areas of the city that we otherwise would not have found, based on his suggestions. Every night he recommended restaurants based on what we wanted, and I never heard him give the same recommendations to other guests - truly an individualized experience. And unlike other hotels, they do not take kickbacks for recommending particular places. Other staff were just as great. My wife wanted to take Oliver home with us. Hmmm. Don't stay anywhere else. Except maybe their sister hotel, run by Matteo's lovely wife. You can't go wrong. We're already lining up for when his new hotel in Tuscany opens.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Ever”
Reviews.Author: jimmyfloyd01
Reviews.Content: not sure there is too much more to say than all the other reviews. what a stunning hotel. but the staff are the ones who make this place stand out. the upgrade to canal view room was a nice bonus. the breakfast is so good u dont want to leave the hotel! hot chocolates, crepes, omlettes with your choice of ingredients and the tiramisu are the highlights. loved the terrace, even though it was cold the views are so good we sat out there every night for a few hours to watch sunset with some drinks. in summer i would prob sit out there all day. if u are going to venice make sure u stay here and u certainly wont be disappointed. as per the heading this is the best hotel experience i have had, thanks to gigi and the others. we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “It really is as everyone says.....”
Reviews.Author: Italiophile99
Reviews.Content: I've never really been one to worry about service at hotels too much, and been more concerned with rooms/location etc as always found it much of a muchness. Quite frankly Al Ponte Antico has changed my opinion on this for ever now as it is only after service this good, that you appreciate how much of a difference it can make. From our welcome late at night from night porter Tomasso, through Rosa's magnificent breakfasts and Olivers dangerous late night "Spritz" the staff were so friendly and so helpful that they made every moment an absolute pleasure. Couple this with great rooms, reasonable prices (even with terrible pound to Euro!) a perfect central location and fantastic views across the Grand Canal, and it adds up to the fact that I can't reccomend this Hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Simply incredbile - Hotel Ponte Anico is a once-in-a-lifetime experience”
Reviews.Author: JBond214
Reviews.Content: Summary: Words cannot describe the charm of this hotel (see photos of the gondola and Rialto Bridge taken from our room). Matteo (the owner) and his staff (especially Oliver) run a tight ship, with no detail spared. They go out of their way to learn your names and to do whatever they need to make your stay wonderful. Our room (we had a junior suite â€“ room 108) was fabulous. Highly, highly recommended. Pros: Good location, incredible views, wonderful breakfasts (with eggs from Matteoâ€™s 98-year-old grandmotherâ€™s farm), certainly a once-in-a-lifetime experience (though we hope to go back â€“ and soon). Cons: Small hotel (9 rooms) so no big hotel services (i.e. room service â€“ though they will bring drinks, tea and snacks to your room). This really isnâ€™t a con as there are, by definition, no large hotels in Venice. Some rooms have an interior view. Review: My wife and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon, it was simply unforgettable. We arrived in Venice by train from Rome, and took the Vaparetto (water bus) from the train station to the Rialto stop, and walked a short distance to the hotel. Venice, at first, seems like an impenetrable maze, so we had a small difficulty figuring out exactly how to locate the hotel from the Rialto stop. Luckily, we spotted the hotel from the water bus and knew which direction to head (see our photo so youâ€™ll recognize it too). If you have bags, you may want to consider taking a water taxi from either the airport or the train station, because the streets of Venice are not friendly for bag dragging (they are narrow, sometimes crowded with tourists and youâ€™ll encounter a couple of small sets of stairs between the Rialto stop and the hotel). The hotel has its own dock for the water taxis. Once we arrived at the hotel, Oliver (Matteo-the-ownerâ€™s right-hand man) greeted us. We went into our room and a bottle of champagne was waiting (see picture). We stayed in the junior suite, room 108, with a canal front room. And, as my wife says, we definitely had the best view in all of Venice (I agree). The room, the view and the experience was simply incredible, and unforgettable. Our pictures from and of the room (attached), do not do it full justice. The junior suite was very large, with a separate canal-front sitting area, with a huge, opening picture window. As our photos show, from the room you can watch the main street of Venice (i.e. the grand canal) and see the boats, Vaparetto, and gondolas all passing under the Rialto Bridge. The room was very clean and well appointed. You feel as if you are staying in a Venetian palace of yesteryear. The only negative was that the bathroom and shower were a bit small (see photo), but by no means did this detract from the overall wonderfulness of the room, the hotel or Venice. The hotel is centrally located, only a couple of blocks to the Rialto bridge. It is easy to walk from the hotel to St. Marks square as well. We recommend walking around on the back streets of Venice (i.e. away from the tourist areas) with the locals. Youâ€™ll see an entirely different, and much quieter Venice. We also recommend taking a gondola ride (you are in Venice) and spending a couple of hours riding the Vaperetto through all of its stops (itâ€™s the best, and cheapest, way to see all of Venice from the water). For the gondola, we recommend interviewing a couple of different ones to find one thatâ€™s to your liking, and picking one that is in a quiet area. The hotel is close to many wonderful dining options. Matteo, Oliver and the others are also willing to recommend non-touristy restaurants and make reservations for you. One night, we ate at a wonderful seafood place (as youâ€™d expect since Venice is on the water), only to find out that the owner was a fisherman with two of his very own boats, and is the president of the Venice Fish Market to boot. If you want wonderfully fresh and local seafood, make sure to ask Matteo or Oliver for a reservation. Matteo and his staff made us breakfast each morning, including wonderful coffee, cappuccino, pastries and eggs from Matteoâ€™s 98-year-old grandmotherâ€™s farm. See the attached photos of the breakfast area and Matteo in action making omelets. Off the breakfast area is a great terrace area overlooking the grand canal and the Rialto Bridge. If the junior suite is booked, or is too pricey for your budget, sitting on the terrace for breakfast, afternoon tea, or a pre/after-dinner drink is also a good way to appreciate the incredible location of this hotel. In conclusion â€“ we highly recommend the Hotel Al Ponte Anico in Venice. We especially recommend requesting the canal-front, junior suite, room 108, for view and an experience you will never forget. Though we get first dibs. If Rome is in your travel plans, check out our review of the Hotel Artorius In Rome, which we also highly recommend. If you stay at the Hotel Al Ponte Anico, make sure to say â€œhiâ€� to Matteo and Oliver for us. Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “perfecto”
Reviews.Author: CornwallBubbles
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a romantic break in Venice for our 10th wedding anniversary. Using Trip Advisor, he decided on Al Ponte Antico. This hotel has got to be one of the best we have ever stayed in. Set on the Grand Canal overlooking the Rialto Bridge, the location was perfect. We found it central to most things and could easily go further afield using the nearby Vaperetto. The thing, for us, that set this hotel apart from others were the staff. The owner, Mateo, his wife, Barbara and every single member were excellent. Hospitable, knowledgeable, and so friendly, nothing was too much trouble. They used the first names of all the guests and became indispensable for their inside knowledge. I would not hesitate to return here or recommend it to anyone. Yes, you can get luxury at many hotels but this kind of service is a rarity. It was simply 'perfecto'.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, beautiful and relaxed!”
Reviews.Author: jayneff
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend for a weekend away in January (both in our 20s) and thought I'd book this hotel on the back of the reviews I read on this website. The most likeable thing about the hotel is definitely the service, the people were lovely and eager to socialise, made us feel comfortable (without being over-intrusive) and their knowledge of the city was actually useful, and not the general tourist routes that one usually hears about. How they manage to remember everyone by name is beyond me! Also some points are given as I heard 2 members of staff switching between perfect English, French and German between guests. They also arranged a free water taxi ride to Murano, telling us it was to be the sort of thing where someone meets you and gives you a quick tour of their shop/factory in the hope you'll spend some money. So we thought why not... Someone met us as the taxi docked, so friendly! He gave us a lengthy and informative tour just for the two of us and put no pressure on us, not even a hint. We almost felt embarassed he was so nice there and the tour was probably my favourite thing we did in Venice! Anyway back to the hotel, our room was very nice, Venetian-style and ornate and beautiful. The bathroom was even better. If I could make any criticism, it would be that given that our room being off the lounge/dining area, perhaps it was not as private as it could have been. On the Sunday we got to the airport and our flight was cancelled, giving us a 8-9 hr wait for the next one back to London - we headed back into Venice to make use of the time and the hotel looked after our bags and treated us very warmly, making us spritzes and coffees and allowing us to relax in the lounge and kill some time. Breakfast was as good as the other reviews say here, quality and substantial with a view to die for over the canal. The staff are professionals who do a great job and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: KNBDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Al Ponte Antico the second week of January with our college age daughter. Originally, we had booked at their sister hotel Locando Orseolo, but were given the choice to "upgrade" to the Al Ponte Antico, which we gladly accepted. We were given a junior suite overlooking the Grand Canal. Our room was beautifully decorated, and our daughter enjoyed the view from the windows in our room. Matteo and his entire staff were very gracious and made us feel very welcomed. As others have posted, breakfast was delightful, from the fresh eggs to the crepes. I would not hesitate recommending this charming hotel to anyone. Thank you to everyone at the Al Ponte Antico for a truly delightful stay!

Reviews.Title: “charming place - stay here for a true Venican experience”
Reviews.Author: JOS1898
Reviews.Content: The reviews are true - you will not be disappointed. The service from everyone was excellent. The staff knew all the guest by name, wanted to know what you were up to that day/night, and were willing to share their favorites of Venice. The location was ideal. Right on the Grand Canal. The only bad thing is that there is no clear signage of the hotel location from the street so you can easily walk down a street and miss it. If arriving for the first time, I suggest the water taxi as this hotel has their own dock. Breakfast - is fab! There is the regular cold items - cereal, cakes, fruit, crossiants, breads, cheese, cold cuts, crackers, yogurt, etc. And there are also warm items - ham and cheese stuffed crossiants, sausages, etc. And then there are made to order hot foods such as pancakes (crepes) and omlets. A perfect start to the day. While i loved this hotel, the staff, the breakfast, the location, there is only 1 issue I had with this hotel.....The bathroom ceiling was low and when in the shower (standing in the tub), I had to duck down a bit to wash my hair. There was 1 night when the hot towel rack was rattling. But I stopped this noise when i turned down the heat on the rack. This is after all a converted palace so these issues are really small compared to the other great things this hotel offers. Would I be back: you bet! .

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: mcp123
Reviews.Content: This was by far our favorite hotel in Italy. It is a gorgeous hotel right on the Grand Canal and a stone's throw from the Rialto Bridge. I cannot imagine staying anywhere else in Venice. For what you pay (very reasonable), I can't imagine getting a better hotel. Owner/operator Matteo was so gracious and friendly and sincerely interested in us having a good time. I swear I think he would cry if we weren't happy. The room was huge, ornate, and beautiful. The view out of our window was of the Rialto Bridge. The location was ideal. One of the best things about it is the breakfast. After 6 days of Italian breakfasts, we were so happy to be offered eggs and sausage. You can take the guy out of America... This was definitely our favorite hotel in Italy and we can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: micius
Reviews.Content: There are no words to describe the charme of the place and the peerless position of the hotel: the pictures made by other travellers speak by themselves. So, just few words that can resume the heart of this wonderful place: this is the way each Hotel in the world shuold have to be managed. The kindness of the owner Matteo and of all the staff is beyond any expectation. They put their heart, mind and soul in their work...and this is evidenced in every little particular, from the welcome to the breakfast, from the furnitures to the cleaniness, from the answer to any information request to the service... everything is pervaded by the love for the work and the place. And believe me, unfortunately in Venice this is not so common...

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: PaigePemberton
Reviews.Content: Having visited Venice several times in the past, I was amazed to find a hotel of this quality and level of guest service at this price. The owner, Matteo, greeted me upon arrival by name. Our room was not only clean, which is an imperative, but also gorgeous. No lodging in Venice proper is inexpensive, but even compared to the Bauer Il Palazzo (where I stayed on my honeymoon) and the Hotel Danieli, the Al Ponte Antico is just beautiful, in a perfect location, and the level of staff attention and graciousness is simply beyond compare (for a third of the price). Matteo and his staff, particularly Oliver, made us feel like royalty. I highly recommend the Al Ponte Antico.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Gracious Staff, Best Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MoMosMaMa
Reviews.Content: We just loved our stay at Hotel Al Ponte Antico. The Hotel owner, Matteo, and his staff could not have been friendlier or more accommodating. The hotel's balcony/terrace and some of the rooms overlook the Rialto Bridge. We would enjoy reasonably priced, delicious wine out on the balcony during the evening, despite the cold weather. Our room (103) was very clean and nicely furnished. Our only caution would be the smell from the canal that permeated our room to no fault of the Hotel. Our room was very close to the canal (1s floor, canal side) and was very reasonably priced. We were hardly in our room so we really did not care. If you do not wish to take in the smells of the canal, then ask for a room overlooking the street or located on a higher floor. For those who love breakfast, Al Ponte Antico's is to die for! I had plain, scrambled eggs that tasted beyond this world. I asked Matteo if he had placed cheese or something in them, but he said no and that they are delivered fresh from his grandmother who raises chickens. They were the best scrambled eggs ever! We also enjoyed a selection of pastries, crepes, coffee drinks and juices while we were there all masterfully made by Matteo. A wonderful and romantic stay!

Reviews.Title: “So friendly”
Reviews.Author: HFielding
Reviews.Content: We followed others' advice and would reinforce all the positive comments. Matteo is a superb host and very knowledgeable about the City and where to eat and where to find the best wines. The location is perfect, far enough away from St Mark's to avoid the worst of the tourists, but easy walking to all main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The most incredible hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: Castan18
Reviews.Content: If you experience one hotel stay in your lifetime it should be the Al Ponte Antico Hotel. The overall beauty and warmth of the hotel is only surpassed by the wonderful people who make your stay unforgettable. Upon arrival Oliviero welcomed us as if we were family. After showing us around this magnificent property we were made to feel as if we were truly royalty!!! My husband and I were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and upon entering our beautifully decorated hotel room we found a silver tray with champagne. But the best is yet to come. We were fortunate enough to meet Matteo, the owner, who we had heard so much about. He is one of the most charming people you could ever have the privlege of meeting. Matteo, the rest of the hospitality industry should come to Al Ponte Anico for a lesson from you. Breakfast, where do i start... Matteo makes your omelettes to order with fresh eggs from his family's farm. If you prefer crepes there are none better. Rosalba was always there to fulfill any need you may have. Croissants, cereals, juices, yogurts, fruit, coffee, hot chocolate, etc. I could go on and on but the only way to understand is to visit. We dined on a terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge, what could be better. Venice is beautiful but without Al Ponte Antico we would not have had the same experience. Thank you Matteo, Oliviero and Rosalba for the most unforgettable 30th anniversary one could wish for. Caren and Stan

Reviews.Title: “Can I say incredible?!?!?!?!”
Reviews.Author: Sassienough
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredible! They knew us by name at check-in, they offered recommendations for dinner and entertainment that were unbelievable. The breakfast each morning was to die for! Fresh homemade omelets, fresh fruit, sausage, bacon and crepes. We were so spoiled I cannot begin to tell you how soon I would like to return!

Reviews.Title: “wowed in venice”
Reviews.Author: baypo
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the ponte antico for 4 nites this october and couldn,t have had a more wonderful introduction to venice--breakfast on the balcony overlooking the grand canal-what could be better. mateo, the owner made us feel like family and all the staff, Oliver Rosealta,were wonderful. location was terrific and would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: francophile47
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in October having booked on the internet. It was just as we had been led to expect from other reviews that were very accurate. Our arrival was anticipated because the staff were monitoring arrivals at the airport and were therefore aware of delays. As it was our honeymoon we were welcomed with chiiled sparkling wine in our room with a card signed by all the staff. This certainly helped us settle in. We had the Junior Suite which must have one of the best views in Venice. We were tempted to spend so much time watching the world go by on the Grand Canalthat we had to make ourselves go out to see the rest of Venice. Staff were charming, helpful and attentive.Nothing was too much trouble. Every guest was made to feel very important to them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to propose!”
Reviews.Author: retired_backpacker
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. I was originally booked into another hotel in Venice but due to flood repairs they called to cancel us and I was very dissapointed. This was a suprise holiday for my then girlfriend, it was her birthday and she had always wanted to go to Italy. So right up to the day it was a suprise where we were going. The hotel was so magical, so much so that before we had even checked our bags in I took her out to the balcony and proposed to her (I had planned on doing it at some stage during our 3 days there but the view from the balcony was perfect!) she said yes and we were married 2 and a half weeks ago. We hope to come back for one of our anniversaries. The staff were lovely and the room - just at the top of the stairs to the right as you walk towards the balcony - was perfect! I can highly reccomend this place and it will always hold a special place in our hearts.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING. The only place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: franniekatz
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Rome via train for 4 days. Greeted by first name! Words cannot express how wonderful our stay in beautiful Venice was, but this hotel is unlike any other we have experienced. Matteo, the owner and his staff are all so special. They love their life and work. From the pretty, well appointed rooms, great breakfasts & evening cocktail hours to the lively chats on the balcony overlooking the Rialto Bridge! Always at the ready for Venice history, a great dinner recommendation or any other need. The eggs in the morning cooked personally by Matteo are not to be missed. He throws love in them, you can just taste it! We thank you Matteo, Oliver, David, Rossalba & Ines. We wish you all well and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tomas_nemec
Reviews.Content: While the hotel does have a fantastic location, beautiful interior, and wonderful style - its greatest assets are Matteo and his staff. They give you the hospitality one would expect was only received by royalty - and they are truly so helpful in everything. As the hotel only has 9 rooms, you will never get lost in the crowd and the small things like Matteo using your first name, and his great drinks and food served on the terrace truly make this place exceptional. This hotel desreves the number 1 spot here.

Reviews.Title: “Spritzers, Moonlight and Warmth”
Reviews.Author: DndG
Reviews.Content: Taking your wife to one of the most romantic destinations in the world may be the norm, taking your mother and your wife is probably not. But, off the three of us went to beautiful Venice. As a surprise we took the motor taxi to the hotel, very James Bond, but my mother both shaken and stirred by the somewhat bumpy trip was very happy to see the hotel, but not so happy about getting from boat to land. Never a fear, with a toot of the horn, we were met not by one but three attendants who all but carried the septuagenarian from the boat. And then there was Matteo, with movie star looks and a perfect smile, he took charge immediately, and the worries of trying to keep everyone happy just drifted away. Do yourself a favour, don't hesitate, stay here. There are so many good things I could say, but in short, it is a gem, it is beautiful, it is ornate and well posh without being stuffy, it is intimate and charming and the care and attention that Matteo, Oliver, Thomas, and all the others paid to us and particularly the attention that Matteo gave to my mother made the trip truly something special. We had memorable evenings spent drinking spritzers in the moonlight looking at the Rialto Bridge with good company provided by the other guests and our evening host Oliver, it was truly magic. Breakfasts were wonderful too, with the speciality eggs any way you want, and views of the comings and goings on the Grand Canal, Venice's main street. So as it must, the end of our trip arrived, back onto the motor taxi but this time the now very relaxed and very happy Grand Dame was quite looking forward to the experience, especially as she was to be waved off by Matteo, who without his knowing had come quite close to being adopted. Thanks to everyone at the hotel and especially Matteo and Oliver for their kindness, warmth and care. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pioneer_8
Reviews.Content: We were 4 couples staying at this hotel from 9/23-9/25. Our water taxi from our ship was greeted the owner Matteo at his dock in front of the hotel. Matteo introduced himself to our party, and from that point on, all of us were greeted by our first names. We booked 4 of the smaller rooms, and they were great. Good size, clean and comfortable. The service at the hotel was the best we have seen anywhere we have traveled. Much personal attention. The terrace was wonderful, where you can have home made breakfasts (cooked by Matteo), while watching the water traffic near the Rialto bridge. In the evenings, we would have a glass of wine or Matteo's special Spritzer and watch the evening water traffic. This was truly a magical place, and a beautiful ending to our 3 week tour of Italy, Greece and Turkey. Many thanks to Matteo and his wonderful staff (Olliver, Armando, Tommaso, Rossalba, and Ines

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doc3232
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic place to stay in Venice. The location can't be any better - an easy walk to almost everything. The facility itself has been completely updated. What separates this hotel is the service. Matteo is an active owner who feels no request is too much. His fine staff (Oliver, David, Thomas, et. al) follow his lead and provide a sense that you are friends, not guests. They all know your name from the moment you arrive. From a great breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge, to a network of fine restaurants, this hotel is like a second home. Sitting on the terrace late in the afternoon with a spritz makes you wonder why you would even consider any other hotel in Venice (except their sister property Locanda Orseolo). A great stay in Venice thanks to Matteo and his fine staff!

Reviews.Title: “Make you feel like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: AWitter
Reviews.Content: We cannot rave about this hotel enough, but as gorgeous as the palace, rooms, and views are...it is the staff that really makes it the best hotel in Venice and one of the best in the world! Everyone knows you and calls you by name, and they take genuine pleasure in catering to your every desire and more. We truly felt like royalty! Matteo and Oliver were absolutely fabulous, and they gave us wonderful recommendations for "native" restaurants and sites. We felt like old friends within minutes of meeting them, and we so enjoyed talking to them. The same family also owns the Locanda Orseolo in Venice, which has equally fabulous service...just slightly more moderate accomodations (and prices), and the location is near St. Mark's vs. on the Grand Canal. If the Al Ponte Antico is full, stay at the Locanda Orseolo! We will not stay anywhere else in Venice and can hardly wait to go back. Of all the cities in Europe we've visited, Venice was our favorite...and this was largely due to the experience of our wonderful hosts/hostesses at our hotel!

Reviews.Title: “spectacular view of Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Rockeee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a lovely weekend, just after the carnival so it was really quiet. This small hotel is in an excellent location, right by the Rialto Bridge. Our room had a spectacular view over the Grand Canal. You could spend hours just watching the world float by the window - I had to drag my husband away from it to go sight-seeing. The hotel owner, Matteo, could not do enough for us and was full of really helpful suggestions as to what to see. The breakfast was lovely. The bar/breakfast area was richly furnished wth beautiful fabrics and antiques. It felt like we were honoured guests in a private home. Very conveniently situated as the Rialto vaporetto stop is about 5 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “amazing in every way possible !!!”
Reviews.Author: barney43butreally26
Reviews.Content: what can i not say about this hotel, the staff were all amazing from the moment we booked until we left and even after that when we returned for a farewell drink on their beautiful terrace which overlooked the grand canal and the beautiful rialto bridge they still managed to be amazing. this hotel is only few mins walk to st marks sq and any help you need the hotel staff were always on hand to help in any way they could. the hotel was very clean and comfortable and the breakfasts were amazing with matteo the owner cooking fresh eggs every morning from his grandmothers farm! so tasty! definatly try the bellini here as it was beautiful so refreshing and great to enjoy while watching the sun set over the grand canal. this is the most romantic hotel that i have ever visited and we do tend to visit alot! matteo the owner was always on hand to help with restaurant reservations, birthday cakes and beautiful bottles of champagne! the service from all the staff was amazing and we would have no hesitation in reccomending this hotel to anyone looking for the most romantic experience, we also will return to this hotel hopefully for our anniversary! so we can look forward to another amazing experience from matteo and all his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Milteugene
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 2 week vacation in Italy. We spent 3 nights in Venice and stayed at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel. This hotel had received good reviews in the forums and I would like to provide another. We liked the location of this hotel and thought it optimal for staying in Venice. The hotel is on the Grand Canal near the Rialto Bridge. I had read some forums recommending staying off the Grand Canal due to noise. However, I think the positive aspects of staying on the Grand Canal outweigh any negative. Our room had windows opening onto the canal and there was some noise from the water traffic, but this is nothing like that of a motor highway. The room was insulated enough from noise at night and we were willing to put up with a little noise to be able to look out onto the Grand Canal whenever we wanted. Being on the Grand Canal also allows for direct transfers to and from the hotel by water taxi and eliminates lugging bags through the streets. The Hotel has a great view of the Rialto Bridge, but is a far enough walk away from the bridge, which is one of the more crowded areas in Venice. The central location allows easy access to all parts of the city either on foot or waterway. Our room was large and comfortable for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. The bathroom was small but nice. The room was air conditioned which was a blessing as it was hot and humid for much of the time we were in Venice. The best thing about this Hotel is the service. The owner Matteo is extremely helpful and friendly. He has trained all of the staff to be the same way. All of the staff speak English if that is a concern. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again if (or should I say when) we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Magical View”
Reviews.Author: lollipoplondon
Reviews.Content: Can't stop talking about our two night stay 19 Aug to 21 Aug in Venice. Matteo the hotel owner and all his staff were so welcoming and friendly, always available to give us directions and telling us where to eat. Our room was beautiful with a view to die for, and the terrace with the view of the Rialto Bridge, just watching the world go by whilst having breakfast was an experience not to be missed. After a day of sightseeing and walking it was perfect just to come back to the hotel and sit on the terrace. Would highly recommend this hotel as it has everything on a wish list.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!..............”
Reviews.Author: woods11
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say that hasn't already been said before about this beautifull little gem of a hotel. My husband and I stayed there for three nights 16 - 19th August 2008, having read all the reviews I was hoping they were all going to be right, they were, - I don't think there are words to describe how wonderfull this hotel and of course 'Matteo' is. He is so passionate about the hotel (No Wonder!) and the city of Venice it is unbelievable. He wants you to truly enjoy and get the most out of your stay, both he and Oliver guided us constantly on the little map they gave us, as to where to go, the best times of day to visit places, and places to eat, even booking us into a restaurant on our first night, which was lovely (San Marco). Our room was beautifull, overlooking the Grand Canal, and just a few steps from the wonderfull terrace, where we spent many hours enjoying our 'Spritz' (delicious) and enjoying the fabulous view, all the people going by on the water buses look up at you , looking like they wish they were sat up there with you! We ended all our evenings on the terrace, where candles are lit all around, making it so romantic and special, to be honest we used to get back there at night and wonder why we ever went out in the first place!! It has to be the best spot in Venice. Matteo's omlettes are delicious, again served out on the terrace in the morning, he is always there to greet you and get you whatever you want. We have never known hospitality like it. The hotel is also ideally located, right in the centre, only 5 mins to St Mark's Square but just nicely out of the main crowds, to be honest everywhere is walkable in Venice, it is a pleasure to just wander down little alleyways, which bring you out at another lovely square with bars/restaurants etc, but the biggest pleasure was always having this wonderfull hotel to return to. No matter what people say on Trip Advisor, no words can do Matteo and his hotel justice - you will have to go and see for yourself and I envy you if you are going!! We certainly hope to return in the not to distant future. Thank you Matteo and staff for giving my husband and I the most memorable weekend ever.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: ahmadm
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in Al Ponte Antico for two nights and just from the day we arrived we recieved a warm welcome from the staff and especially Matteo who was just wonderful in every sense. No matter how hard i tried to explain how friendly he was i will not do him justice. We just felt at home and he made sure we are being taking care of by all the staff. For breakfast one can not ask for more...Matteo who made delicious crepes and omelette in addition to the wide variety of food to choose from,which you can all enjoy having in the beautiful terrace. The hotel had an excellect view and the room was really spacious and clean. All of which made our stay in Venice really worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect start to a wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: BonnieGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Al Ponte Antico for 2 nights prior to a cruise. I booked this hotel a year in advance and the anticipation of staying there exceeded my expectations which were high to begin with. The deservingly proud owner, Matteo, greeted us warmly by name and showed us our room which was a suite on the first floor. Our room was a little above water level and I felt that I had a front seat view for all the wonders of Venice. Gondolas drifted by right in front of us and other boat traffic went about their everyday business. I liked the location very much. I felt it had more of a neighborhood feel then the area around St. Mark's. The newly renovated breakfast room was gorgeous with an enormous shiny brass espresso, cappuccino machine which made the best coffees. The buffet breakfast with the chocolate banana crepes was a great way to start the day. Drinking my new favorite drink, the spritz, on the terrace and watching the boat traffic was a relaxing way to end our days. Everyone who worked at the Al Ponte Antico went over and beyond trying to please us. They were a happy bunch of people who always had a smile on their faces. I hope the Al Ponte Antico gets kicked up to the #1 spot on tripadvisor. It deserves to be there and more.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back again -”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: What can I say that has not been said before, after meeting Matteo in 2007 and having drinks on the terrace (we were staying at their sister hotel) we knew we had to come back and stay with Matteo. Arriving in a water taxi we unloaded our bags and Matteo was there to great us like the old friends we felt we were. We had a wonderful suite (apparently the best in the house) with a very large bedroom, separate lounge/desk area and with two huge windows that opened out onto the water of the Grand Canal. Whilst the bathroom was small, it was very modern and sufficient and the additional space in the suite more than compensated for it. The rooms were clean and the staff were all wonderful, the breakfasts delicious, with the eggs coming from Matteo's grandmothers farm and sitting on the balcony having breakfast in the mornings looking out on the the Grand Canal or drinks in the evening before going for dinner and then back for a nightcap, this was one of the highlights of Venice for us. Our third trip to Venice and staying with Matteo was like staying with a very good friend, but with five star service. A smaller hotel where the guests mingled with each other in the evening on the terrace (if you wished to do so) and there is no other place that we would consider staying in Venice in fact any time we are in Europe it would be a must stop. Cannot recommend this hotel or their sister one enough. Its worth a trip to Venice to stay with these wonderful people in their wonderful "home".

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: katie5108
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night here on our honeymoon in July. We were absolutely impressed, the hotel lived up to all of the great reviews on trip advisor!! We arrived early the day of check-in (8 AMish)- although the room was not yet ready for us, the staff held on to our bags and Matteo, the owner, was gracious enough to offer us breakfast! We loved the terrace and the views of the canal were a great way to start off our stay in Venice. The staff was incredibly gracious and made us feel completely at home right away!!!! The room was spotless and beautifully decorated. We were surprised at the size of the room, definitly the largest one we encountered on our 12 day trip to Europe. My only complaint is we only spent one night at Al Ponte Antico! I cannot say enough good things about the hotel and the owner, Matteo.

Reviews.Title: “A privileged location with marvellous hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Worcestersource
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel having studied all of the trip advisor reviews and itâ€™s true, it is a fantastic hotel. Everything exceeded our expectations. We arrived by water taxi (95 Euros) from the airport late in the evening and were greeted by name. Our room, 103, an inside room facing the beautiful bar was lovely. I had worried that we didnâ€™t have a view, but needlessly so. It was perfect, air conditioning was very effective and the bathroom was lovely. We were warmly greeted the following morning as we stepped out into the luxurious bar/dining area by Matteo, the incredible owner, who speaks to everyone in their own language â€“ amazing. He guided us to a table on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal, with the Rialto Bridge as a beautiful back drop. We felt welcomed and very special. It was our 25th wedding anniversary and it was just wonderful to absorb the sights and sounds of the Grand Canal, so many varied boats. We were served excellent coffee, availed ourselves of the wonderful buffet. Then, Matteo took our order for omelettes â€“ or whatever you wished and they were perfect â€“ he personally cooked them to order. Matteo then took the time to find out our plans and to assist with suggestions, so friendly, so reassuring, so knowledgeable â€“ just great. He recommended and booked a table at Lâ€™Osteria di Santa Marina for our special anniversary meal (excellent with wonderful friendly service). The hotel is very well located, as itâ€™s easy to cross the Grand Canal. After sightseeing we happily returned to the peacefulness of the hotel in the afternoon. After a wonderful meal we sat on the terrace and drank a special bottle of champagne, gazing out at the Rialto Bridge and water â€“ special memories to keep forever. Matteo assisted with planning our trip to Burano â€“ nothing was too much trouble. Venice is hot and busy in July but this really is an oasis of calm which is wonderful to return to. The terrace is fantastic, watching all types of boats go by from tourists to delivery boats. Indeed, people crammed onto the waterbuses, gazed up longingly at the terrace as we sipped spritz, champagne, whatever. They knew theyâ€™d rather have been relaxing where we were! We checked out at 12 but the hotel was pleased to keep our bags and to arrange a water taxi for when we left in the evening. On our return we were warmly welcomed onto the terrace where we enjoyed a spritz before our journey home. It was no problem to them at all â€“ they made us feel very welcome, more like friends than paying guests In conclusion, wonderful service (such friendly helpful people), sumptuously decorated rooms, fantastic breakfasts, excellent atmosphere and location. Such a wonderful experience â€“ it would be very hard to stay anywhere else in Venice after receiving such treatment.

Reviews.Title: “The Al Ponte Antico is a very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: caza
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor I was confident the hotel would be what we were looking for. The many great reviews still do not do this hotel justice. The hotel is beautiful and charming, location is fantastic and the service is absolutely impeccable. Having stayed in many hotels in Europe I have never experienced service and hospitality as that at the Al Ponte Antico. I could not recommend this hotel enough, with only nine rooms you are looked upon as individuals, not room numbers. The staff are so friendly, I guarantee you will not get a hotel experience like this anywhere. Don't stay anywhere else, this hotel is simply The Best.

Reviews.Title: “no.1 for location and service”
Reviews.Author: andcil
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed at a hotel with better service. From the staff greeting you by name when you arrive, to the owner (Matteo) making you whatever you want for breakfast, or making a dinner reservation on your behalf... these people really know how to make your Venetian holiday enjoyable. Antique styled rooms are well appointed, with nice clean reasonably new bathrooms and cheap wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: brenbp
Reviews.Content: After disembarking a 12 night Mediteranean cruise, we had one extra night in Venice before returning home. We wanted it to be special. And it certainly was. The Al Ponte Antico is a beautiful hotel. The location is great. The views of the canal and Rialto bridge are wonderful. But the most outstanding feature to this hotel is the owner, Matteo. His love for the hotel and the city is contagious. We would epecially like to acknowledge Armando for assisting with booking and arrival. And Oliver that shared helpful history and information about the city making our short time well spent. If you are looking for a truly magical place to stay in Venice, this is it! BP Kansas City, MO

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever - look no further!”
Reviews.Author: Thrillrider
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Ponte Antico for two nights, and I did a ton of research prior to booking a hotel in Venice for our first trip to this amazing city. I read through all of the tripadvisor reviews, and read all of them for this particular establishment. As I browsed through each review, I thought to myself 'how can a hotel possibly have THIS many favorable reviews!". Well, as we checked into the Hotel Al Ponte Antico, this question was clearly answered. This was by far the most wonderful hotel experience we have ever had, and I actually felt a touch of sadness when we had to check out. Matteo and his staff are amazing people, and their hospitality are absolutely incredible. As far as the actual hotel, it is a palace - literally! We had a huge room without a view, but it was wonderful. The terrace of course is a delight, as were Matteo's omelets in the morning. It truely is a breathtaking hotel, and it puts a smile on my face thinking back to our (too) short stay there just one week ago. Believe the reviews - the hotel and staff are spectacular!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best experience”
Reviews.Author: taxiartist
Reviews.Content: We were treated like royalty. Being greeted by name as our water taxi pulled up to the private dock was just a taste of the wonderful hospitality of Matteo and his staff. The rooms are fabulous, the location can't be beat, the breakfast is marvelous, but what made our stay truly remarkable was the attention we received from everyone at the hotel. We can't wait to return to the hotel. We were in Europe for 17 days and only stayed here for 1 night, but it was a highlight of our vacation. We were 7 people from teenagers to a grandparent and each of us was made to feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: kidsalongtraveler
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable service and location! They were marvelous in all areas of their establishment! We were greeted by the owner and given a short tour with details of the restoration of the property. It was absolutely beautiful! Our very large suite had a king and a also a queen sleeper in a separated sitting area. Our three windows opened directly onto the canal at the Rialto Bridge - gondolas came gliding by regularly as did the vaporettis. The windows were new and bocked all sounds when closed! The location was premier fr walking everywhere, which is the way to see Venice. Breakfast was wonderful - omelets, meats, etc. - and was included! We can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Doro01
Reviews.Content: The BEST hotel we ever stayed. Best services we aver get.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine staying anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: lueckb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were staying in a non-tourist town outside of Venice for a week (I was there for work), and we were not having a good time. The people in the town and the hotel in which we were staying were not very friendly, and we felt very uncomfortable and uneasy. Once my work was done, we stayed at the Al Ponte Antico for 3 days, and it completely changed everything. Everyone is so helpful, and Matteo and Oliver gave us great advice as to where to eat and when to go to the sights we wanted to see. We will never forget sitting on the terrace in the afternoon, having a drink, and talking with Matteo about life in Venice. When we were looking for a hotel before we took our trip, I thought that this place was a little expensive. However, every review I read talked about how great it is, and after staying there I couldn't agree more. We will definitely return to Venice, and we could not imagine staying at any other hotel. Brian and Tina from Milwaukee

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: JKMorgan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Al Ponte Antico with our two children (13 and 9) for 4 nights. We can second all the positive comments made in earlier reviews regarding the excellent staff (esp. Rosalba, Oliviero, and, of course, Matteo), great location, plentiful breakfasts, and the stellar view from the terrace. Matteo's spritzes were so good that we tracked down a local source for one of the ingredients the day after we returned home! Now we can enjoy spritzes at home, but unfortunately without the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge in our sights. Our room (Al Ponte Sospiro) was great, although perhaps a little tight with the sofa bed opened up. The one negative was the aforementioned elevated tub which meant crouching under the shower head. In terms of noise, we found it very quiet at all times of day. While many honeymooners stay at Al Ponte Antico, we can say that our children felt very welcome there and the staff took excellent care of them. When we go back to Venice, we will definitely stay at Al Ponte Antico again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: traveller1968
Reviews.Content: It's hard to think of anything to add since all the other glowing reviews say it all. I can only say that yes, they are all true and yes, it really is that good! The location is fantastic and that terrace on the grand canal a real gem. People going by on the vaporetti were looking at us and pointing as it really is unique to have a terrace on the canal and right by the rialto bridge as well. It is the most fantasic spot in Venice to have breakfast, a coffee, an aperitif or nightcap. The bulding is renovated beautifully in traditional Venetian style with gorgeous fabrics, glass and frescoes. The staff are great. - more like staying with friends than hotel staff. It was fantastic to arrive by private water taxi as it drops you off right in the hotel - expensive but worth it for the experience (the alternative being to walk from the vaporetto stop with your luggage up and down bridges and through the crowds). I absolutely loved this hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A superb location !!!!”
Reviews.Author: MontyBucks
Reviews.Content: We were getting married in Venice and this was our honeymoon hotel for the first two nights .. what can I say ... Matteo and his staff were superb, very attentive yet not overly so ... with what must be one of the best views of the Grand Canal in Venice ..... I cannot think of a better way and a more beautiful City to start married life ! Sue and Neil Sanders

Reviews.Title: “Probably the most amazing weekend break of my life”
Reviews.Author: alimitchell
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for her 30th birthday to the Al Ponte Antico and have to say that our stay there made it possibly the best weekend's holiday either of us have ever had. I was initially a Venice sceptic but the magic of the place, and in particular this hotel, made it truly phenomenal. The location is perfect. Overlooking the canal and the Rialto bridge, just 15 minutes walk from St Marks, right on the main shopping streetsbut quiet and relaxed as well. The staff are the most attentive and friendly you could wish for. Nothing was too much trouble. Prosecco in the room (free) when we arrived for Kate's birthday (I didn't ask for this), help and tips, amazing breakfast and service, drinks until whatever time on the terrace and then a glass of wine (again free) whilst we waited for the water taxi to take us back to the airport. And that view. Simply amazing. You can spend hours with a book, a beer or coffee and that view, Nothiing else. If you want to be in the best location, in the frienliest hotel, with the best service - this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Start to Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JJBurkeChicago
Reviews.Content: My bride and I started off the Italian leg of our honeymoon at Matteo's hotel. Perfect location yards away from the Rialto Bridge. It's also probably the only hotel with a veranda on the Grand Canal. Sitting there watching the traffic go by with a glass of white wine was perfect. The room was fantastic: Matteo's attention to detail and design were evident in the textiles, chandeliers, glassware, etc. The staff was A+ as well. Matteo had excellent recommendations for dining as well as helpful advice on best times to visit Venice's busy tourist sites. Although our USD took a beating, this hotel was worth every penny. Our highest recommendation for this hotel. Thanks Matteo for an incredible start to our honeymoon! J and J Burke

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Isabelarcher23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent four wonderful nights (and mornings and afternoons) at Matteo's beautiful new small elegant hotel on the Grand Canal. His great hospitality creates a house party atmosphere where guests are treated, and treat each other, like old friends. The wonderful terrace, for breakfast and evening spritzers and whatever else you'd like, provides the remarkable setting. Although near the Rialto bridge, serenity reigns. Al Ponte Antico is a magical place and we will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb!”
Reviews.Author: daleza
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 night stay at The Al Ponte Antico based entirely on reading previous reviews and I have to say, the customer service and attention to detail at this hotel are second to none. As mentioned in other reviews, Matteo (the owner) greets you on arrival at the hotel by your first name, and along with all the other members of staff, he is always available to help with reccomendations for places to visit / restaurants etc. The terrace which overlooks the Grand Canal & Rialto bridge is wonderful, as are the breaksfasts which are served there every morning. The omlettes in particular are great. The bedroom was larger than I expected, and the large bathroom with jacuzzi bath was another bonus. Venice is a beautiful city and it would be difficult not to have great time there, but I definitely feel that choosing this particular hotel enhanced my trip considerably, so a big thanks to Matteo and all his staff. Franco.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Exciting”
Reviews.Author: chiapas
Reviews.Content: This hotel really gets you in the Venice mood with its friendliness and location in the heart of the action. We were two people in an inner room (no view). It was quite large, and included a king and a comfortable fold out sleeper couch, both comfortable. The bathroom is huge with the jacuzzi tub that is so relaxing. Two terrycloth robes were available for use. The common space is elegant and the adjacent terrace for eatting and drinks is spectacular. One can spend all morning, evening or all day soaking in the brillant view of the Rialto bridge and watercraft of every sort floating by. With drink in hand, you definitely feel privledged looking at the world floating by.
