The breakfast is outstanding with pasteries, fruit, fresh and hot veggies, and Matteo's fresh omlettes made to order. There is unlimited service of fresh cappacinos or lattes too. The staff is incredibly friendly and just puts a smile on your face, with everyone knowing who you are by name. It is an elegant and fun place to stay. Visitors interact on the terrace and learn about eachother and fun things to do and where to eat in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky so and so”
Reviews.Author: mmistress
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m looking for a room for the Heineken jammin festival Police concert, June 22 2008 I love the Police. The mix of Stingâ€™s grooves, Copelandâ€™s hi-hat spicy playing and Summersâ€™ harmonics mistress make me crazy. But the tour date in Venice is also the chance to come back to meet Matteo and all the staff of this little hotel with a strategic location. We stayed here in April 2007, during the start up of Peruch management. We're so lucky. In this context we discovered how deep a man can love his job. Matteo knows Venice inside out an is a gold mine of advices: you can ask him everything about corners to visit, typical shops, cafÃ©s, bakeries, markets, restaurants, etc. They all are so kind and can made your holydays deeply special. The balcony with its wonderful view on Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge is unforgettable. From this point of view you can spent hours feeling the pulsating daytime life of Venice (the market is on the opposite side of the Canal) and the peacefulness of a romantic moonlight evening. We agree itâ€™s the best choice for lovers on honeymoon. Giuseppe e Maria Antonietta Rome

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with Venice !”
Reviews.Author: singaporetemasek
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Venice to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary ! We selected Al Ponte Antico Hotel in Venice based on the ratings from trip Advisor. It was a wonderful boutique hotel ! The location is magnificent, the balcony looks into the Grand canal and has a wonderful view of the Rialto bridge. It used to be an old Venetian Palace and was painstakingly redone by the current owner Mattheo. Mattheo's family have been hoteliers for a long time and he is so passionate about making sure his guests have the best time. There are only 9 rooms and Mattheo and his crew will make you feel like you are the only guest at his wonderful palace. He makes the most delicious omelettes and crepes for you in the morning and don't miss the caffe from his handcrafted coffee machine ! Mattheo knows Venice inside out and gave us good tips - go early to St Mark's square before the day trippers arrive, don't miss the fish market, take the boat to the colourful village of Burano and have luch by the canal at Trattoria al Gatto Nero da Ruggero ( pasta with spider crab was delicious and grilled fresh sardines) . We had really some of the best meals in Venice, enjoy a nice lunch at Alla Maddonna, dinner at Dolo ( try the spicy squid on polenta), dinner at Osteria Boccadero near the Miracle Church ( go with the chef Luciano's recommendations, you won;t go wrong !) Al Ponte Antico has their own private dock, so best Venetian way to get to the hotel is to take a water taxi right up to the dock of the Hotel. Enjoy Venice !

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally run boutique hotel on Grand Canal near Rialto”
Reviews.Author: SmarcoPolo
Reviews.Content: As reported, Matteo does do a superb job running this wonderfully decored boutique hotel right near the Rialto Bridge. Pros: Matteo, housekeeping and the night staff addressed my wife and me by name EVERY time they saw us. Matteo, being a man of effusive mien, never lets an opportunity for lengthy discussions on the wonders of Venetian life pass him by, is happy to supply recommendations for any activity and seems to have the water bus timetable memorized. Our room (non-suite, non-canal view, 280 Euro/night in late March 2008) was spotless and large for Venice, with vaulted ceilings and full-sized king bed. Our bathroom was also large, with a shower over a jet-fitted tub. Arriving by water taxi directly to the hotel's private dock on the Grand Canal is a great convenience and sets the mood, as does the porter running out to grab our bags whilst introducing himself (and somehow already knowing our names). The hotel's common area, the "hall", where breakfast & drinks (full bar) are served (and which leads to the outdoor terrace useful outside of winter) is beautiful. Matteo's Venetian spritzers are in fact good. One evening we went to the Gritti Palace for cocktails and tried their spritzer. On top of the Gritti seeming run-down and frankly a bit depressing, the drink wasn't nearly as piquant, voluminous, or inexpensive. It really made us think that we were getting a much better experience (way beyond the spritzer) at Ponte Antico and for almost a third the room rate (and half the cocktail rate). Cons: Matteo NEVER lets an opportunity for lengthy discussions on the wonders of Venetian life pass him by. Its charming, but sometimes we just want our room key or the tiniest bit of anonymity in our movements and activities. One annoying quirk, because our tub was raised a foot or two off the floor and the bathroom had low ceilings, at just 6'0 I had to hunch considerably to stand in the shower and had to fully squat to get my hair wet. If I were any taller or had a bad back I would have needed to switch rooms. Just when you start thinking that you're staying in a five star hotel for a three star price, the motel-style shrink wrapped complimentary bathroom toiletries and small tube TV remind you that you aren't (but those are, in my opinion, trades I'm happy to make for the reasonable room rate). AC was entirely non-functional, but we didn't complain or investigate further as our window kept the room temperature manageable; maybe it's only activated in warmer months. The hotel is very quiet, and our room was just off the common hall, so we could hear conversations outside (and vice versa). It would have been nice to have had the option for audio privacy with some AC or fan created white noise. On balance, given the excellent location, enthusiastic management, room condition, decor & ambiance, and fair room rate, I would absolutely return and will recommend the Ponte Antico to friends and family without hesitation. Bravissimo, Matteo.

Reviews.Title: “The Highlight of Venice!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jbirdsal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on our honeymoon and spent 3 weeks touring Italy. Matteo and this hotel are still the subject of many of our stories. And we stayed in many 4-5 star hotels. This place has it all. Service, location, spacious rooms with a view and gourmet breakfast on the terrace every morning and wine in the evening on the Grand Canal!!! Unbelievable! And, Matteo is the keystone. He is so passionate about his work. It is "his life". Without a doubt when we return to Venice, this is the only place for us to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: purplenoodle
Reviews.Content: Staying here enhanced our trip to Venice ten fold - helpful and friendly staff, magnificent rooms, fabulous views and a central location. During our too brief visit, we were treated like royalty by all the friendly and helpful staff. They were more than willing to talk to us about the city and advise us where to go to eat, the best times to visit the sites and provide valuable info on getting around the city. Breakfast was served in the sumptous upstairs dining room, (with exceptional views of the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge from the terrace) as were pre and post dinner drinks, which were always welcome before and after we ventured out into the city to explore. Our bedroom was decorated with luxurious fabrics and was very spacious and comfortable. If brave enough, you can climb out the window and enjoy the view, shared only by the odd pigeon or seagull. I would quite happily stay here again - am even tempted to give a negative review simply to keep this gem of a hotel to myself! Thank you to all the staff for making my birthday trip so enchanting and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloWanderer
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped in the door, my wife and I both knew that this was truly a special place. Matteo - the hotel's owner - and his devoted staff were immediately helpful, and they continued to offer an unprecedented level of service throughout our stay. My wife and I have never experienced a hotel with this level of service before - any wish that we could ask for was immediately granted. We have stayed at hotels that offer superior service (such as the Four Seasons), but nothing has ever come close to the level of service that we received here. We stayed at the Al Ponte Antico for 3 nights at the beginning of our Italy trip in February 2008. The hotel itself is beautiful. Matteo just had the common (breakfast & bar) area renovated in time for Carnival, and the result is simply beautiful. We stayed in the "Classic Double" room 104, which was very nice. The ceiling was very high, with a beautiful chandelier. The room was large. The bathroom had a heated towel rack and a jet tub, perfect for relaxing. The location was perfect. There is a terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge. In the summer you can have your breakfast outside on the terrace, but in the winter it was just a little too cold to eat outside. As you walk out the front door of the hotel, you are on a very quaint Venetian street, just steps away from some of the main shopping areas of Venice. Breakfast was superb. Matteo personally cooked us eggs from his Grandmother's farm every morning, and the cappuccinos from his brand- new hand made espresso machine were outstanding. Matteo and his staff constantly gave us great suggestions: where to eat, what attractions to see, how much to pay for a Gondola ride, and so much more. My wife and I have stayed at many hotels. But we both agree that without a doubt, the Al Ponte Antico Hotel is the best hotel we have ever stayed in. As we left the hotel and said our good-byes, we both had a sudden sadness come over us. We were both going to really miss Matteo, his staff, and the Al Ponte Antico hotel. I guess we are just going to have to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the world !”
Reviews.Author: bert68ku
Reviews.Content: This was the end of a 8 day vacation going from Monaco, Paris and on the Venice. We had just spent 2 nights at the Ritz in Paris and Al Ponte Antico made the Ritz shameful for its level of service. Our service began when we pulled up in the water taxi and they knew our names, helped us with our MANY bags, checked us in all with a huge welcome smile. The staff made all of our dining recommendations and all of our reservations .... we simply didn't have to think. The hotel it self was great. Our room was a little bit small but was still very nice ( we also had a fair amount of luggage). Venice was incredible ! but we found ourselves occasionally retreating back to the hotel to have a beer and talk to Matteo and all of the wonderful staff. I have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world and I can tell you without exception they staff at this hotel CARES about your stay. They offer WORLD CLASS service. Matteo has a few books in the window as you exit the building about Venice. We borrowed a book on the way out the door for our last day and as a vow to come back we left a lonely planet Venice book that we had purchased in Paris on the shelf and signed it. We told Matteo we would be back one day to re-claim it...... maybe we will just bring another one. :) bottom line - this isn't a spa, they don't have a full kitchen, and no "bar" really... but if you want to stay at a world class place wit the best personal service in the world this is your place !

Reviews.Title: “Great service, room and location.”
Reviews.Author: Banjax
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Feb. The location, beside the Rialto bridge is superb - everything within easy walking distance. Our room (No. 102) was lovely - high-ceilinged and spacious with chandelier, comfortable couch and armchairs and two beautiful, tall windows that opened onto an unobstructed view of the Grand Canal. The bathroom was small but perfectly adequate. The hotel has free wireless internet access in all the rooms and the service is, as other reviewers have said, truly special . Matteo and his staff were unfailingly convivial, generous, courteous and thoughtful and made us feel as if nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was delicious - unlimited coffee, a buffet of all kinds of everything, eggs or crepes cooked to order if front of you. Overall, a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Break”
Reviews.Author: LisaM15
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay. Venice was beautiful at this time of year and we were especially lucky with the weather - brilliant sunshine every day! Matteo & his team were the usual excellent hosts and after our 4 night stay I felt we had completely unwound and relaxed. We stayed in one of the suites with an amazing view of the canal and it was definitely worth paying that little bit more. The only bad point - we had to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the highlight of our summer vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: DianePK
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to stay at this property both prior to and after a summer 2007 7-day cruise, and even now, several months later, our entire family counts our stay with Matteo and his staff as a highlight of our entire vacation. It is a small 9-room hotel located directly on the Grand Canal just a few meters from the Rialto Bridge. Although it was still in the process of renovation at the time of our stay (Matteo had just taken over the property a few months earlier...) we loved it. Getting around Venice is incredibly easy from this location. Our stay included not only a junior suite (directly on the Grand Canal), but also a triple room, as we were traveling with 3 adult children. The hotel easily accommodated us, and similar to the experience of many other writers on this forum, Matteo personally greeted us by name upon our arrival by private water taxi at the hotel's dock. He and his staff made numerous valuable dining, touring and shopping reccomendations during our stay. We were treated like favorite family members the entire time. Even when one of our children was taken ill, Matteo graciously moved him to a quiet third room. Perhaps my favorite memory was the look of total awe of each of my family members as they first entered the junior suite. We could easily have passed a glass of wine to a passing gondoleer; the room was that perfect! Ahhh, the wonderful terrace and those famous omelets need no further accolades! . Thanks, Matteo! We hope to see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff is really great, but very cold”
Reviews.Author: Milos_Kalerta
Reviews.Content: Location is the best in Venice and I mean it. It's 50 meters from Rialto and if you'll select Junior Suite number 1, you'll have the best room with great view to canal. Staff is very welcoming, everyone knows your first name and they are really helpful - you'll get answer to each of your questions, including e.g. history of the hotel. Room (Junior #1) is very spacious, bed is OK, but -- it's so cold! We setuped temperature to 30 degrees, but there was around 18 degrees or maybe less (January)! It's probably because of the water in the canal, but it could be improved for 550 Euros/night, including better bathroom is a must. The rooms are exactly the same as on their web pages, so you can check it there. There is also really great breakfast room. Free (fast) wifi internet is bonus and overall it's really nice and unique place.

Reviews.Title: “Family run, Prime Service - They really get it.”
Reviews.Author: Alphafighter
Reviews.Content: This family run business really makes you feel at home in the heart of Venice! They understand hospitality, and offer a special experience that can't be duplicated anywhere else. We had a beautiful room with canal view (although the breakfast lounge was outside our window, so privacy was not the best). Ask them anything, and they will help you get what you want! Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Al Ponte Antico Hotel a special place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Chill53
Reviews.Content: I visited Hotel Al Ponte Antico in July 2007 with my husband and family. We arrived to a warm welcome, comfortable well appointed roomsand a level of service seldomly seen in large hotels. They gave us great advice on where to eat, organising bookings on our behalf. This family run Hotel and their staff truly understand the needs of travellers and go the extra distance to give you a great experience. Highly recommended for families. Angela from Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Belongs on any "Best of the Best" List”
Reviews.Author: leseljones
Reviews.Content: Like most others who have stayed here, we cannot say enough positive things about this hotel. Matteo, the owner, and the rest of the staff make sure that every detail of your stay is taken care of, from airport-hotel transfers to restaurant recommendations and sight-seeing and shopping tips. The hotel itself is lovely; we were in one of the supposedly smaller ("classic") rooms, which was still quite large and beautifully decorated with king-size bed and an immaculate, fully appointed bathroom (hair-dryer, towel warmer, toiletries, etc.). Breakfast is wonderful, with custom-made omelets or crespelle as well as a buffet including fresh fruit, vegetables, breads, yogurt and cereals. Although the hotel does not at this point have a public bar or full kitchen, the staff is always happy to pour a glass of wine or to brew a latte for you to enjoy on the patio [shared by all guests] in the afternoon or evening, and the view of the Grand Canal is incredible. All of the staff speak impeccable English and know the city intimately, and their enthusiasm for Venice is contagious. A note to anyone who is not familiar with the hotel rating system for Venice: I was somewhat hesitant to stay in a supposedly "three star" hotel when I first booked at Al Ponte Antico. However, this is "merely" a three-star hotel ONLY because it does not have the kitchen and other public facilities that are a prerequisite for higher ratings in Venice. It easily equals (and in the important ways far surpasses) four and five star hotels I have stayed in in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Best. Hotel. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: SuperObe
Reviews.Content: This hotel shouldn't only be top rated in Venice, it should be top rated in the world. Many of the reviews have already covered the personal service you receive from Matteo and his staff at the Al Ponte Antico. It is all true and then some. The hotel has a great ambience, and with a fabulous view across the Grand Canal, of the Rialto Bridge, where you can enjoy fabulous cocktails and drinks on the terrace. Breakfasts were the best I have ever had from a hotel, with Matteo himself preparing fresh eggs, exactly to your taste to order, cooked in front of you. I personally would recommend his omelette. Also, Matteo took care of all our restaurant reservations, after discussing what type of cuisine we were looking for. We enjoyed Venetian cuisine, which was centered around the local seafood. When we revisit Venice, we won't even bother looking for anything else, as this is the place to stay. Matteo is undergoing major renovations, which will make the hotel feel even more grand, in January 2008.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: Aerosmithfan
Reviews.Content: And the winner of the most charming, conscientious, hard-working, dedicated hotel owner is ...... Matteo. He made our trip one of the most wonderful ever. To be greeted by him and his staff at the private taxi dock at sunset is to feel as if you are in a James Bond movie. The breakfast, all coooked personally and individually to one's requirements by Matteo, are outstanding. He and his staff make one feel like the most honoured guests ever, and remembered all our names. The hotel itself is like a dream, and the views are outstanding. You can see the photos posted by other reviewers, and they're all that and better. This is one of best stays in Europe I've ever had, and I cannot recommend it too highly.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful first visit”
Reviews.Author: didi58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wondeful little hotel last week for our first visit to Venice . The help and advice we received from Matteo, Oliviero and all the staff was second to none. All the restaurant recommendations were excellent ; the advice on where to walk etc was brilliant. We were very grateful to be right in the centre but in such a calm oasis. They made us feel so welcome instantly - we can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and charming hotel in enviable location”
Reviews.Author: jigglypuff
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the staff at this intimate, unique and charming hotel on the Grand Canal offer a service that is second to none. Personally, as a shy and self-conscious English woman, I found Matteo's personal attention over effusive and uncomfortable but I realise that the issue is entirely mine and that Matteo's enthusiasm for attending to the needs of his guests and his passion for his city is both sincere and inspirational. His staff are equally helpful and friendly and welcomed us with genuine attentiveness. The location of the Al Ponte Antico is perfect and the views of the Rialto Bridge from the terrace are unforgettable. Do not miss the opportunity to linger over a glass of wine and watch the sun set over the Grand Canal. Our room with views of the Grand Canal was beautiful, spacious and clean. Within seconds of stepping out of the hotel you are absorbed into the maze of enchanting alleys and streets and within very easy reach of St Marks Square. I thoroughly recommend this exquisite hotel and wish you a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: berty2007
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful experience at the Al Ponte Antico, our first trip to Venice. It was a special trip so we studied numerous hotels and chose this for location and great reviews. Still you never can tell until you arrive but this was everything and more we had hoped for. We felt very lucky to be stopping in a beautiful suite with french windows opening on to the Grand Canal , watching Venetian life pass by. The staff were unbelievable led by Matteo and his personal touch, nothing was too much trouble. He spent lots of time making all feel welcome and he is rightfully proud of the breakfasts he cooks each day , particularly his family's eggs. There are undoubtedly larger and more famous hotels to stay in but we would definitely have this as our first choice again. I do fear now that vacancies will be hard to come by but it is only fair people get to know about this special place.

Reviews.Title: “What A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Molly769
Reviews.Content: Matteo, the owner and his staff have prefected the art of hotel management. They knew and remembered our names and were available every moment to help in our visit to their great city of Venice. They made dinner reservations for us and recommended several places. They provided maps to help us navigate the streets and get from place to place. The breakfasts were to die for, (Italian breakfasts are not like the USA) but Matteo made them individually for us from scratch. The hotel was beautiful with the best location in Venice. I will go back here every time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Way Venice Should Be Experienced.....”
Reviews.Author: kabdenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel for 2 nights in July 2007. The location of the hotel cannot be beat - they have a lovely patio that sits directly above the Grand Canal. It is the perfect place to enjoy breakfast or a drink. The rooms were comfortable, clean and modern. The true draw to this hotel, however, is the owner and his staff. Matteo loves the city of Venice and wants all of his guests to enjoy the city as much as he does. The staff were always ready to assist with a dinner reservation, directions or even an umbrella. Matteo personally cooked our breakfast and made sure he was present for our arrival and departure. This hotel is all about the people and experiencing Venice the way it should be with the help of locals who love the city!!!! Dave & Kim (Denver, Colorado)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We Ever Stayed At!!!!”
Reviews.Author: David099
Reviews.Content: We took a water taxi directly from the airport to the hotel dock (90-100E), well worth the price for convenience if you are not travelling lightly. We were warmly greeted by Mateo, the hotel, who propmtly took our bags inside for us. Our stay at Al Ponte Antico was simply fantastic! Mateo and all his staff knew us by first name. In the morning we would wander out onto an amazing balcony overlooking the Grand Canal, and the Rialto bridge. We were served a lovely breakfast, with outstanding coffee (doppio espresso my recommendation), and eggs done anyway fresh from Mateo Aunt's farm. In the afternoon, we would enjoy a glass of wine on the same balcony before heading out to explore options for supper. Mateo was always ready to help with suggestions, or arrange tours on our behalf, etc.. The only problem with staying at this hotel is that everywhere else we stayed in Parma and Bologna for the rest of our trip seemed a bit dull!!! This hotel is amazing, mainly due it's owner Mateo, who has a true passion for what he does.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at a Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 3 nights at this great bed and breakfast. We were thrilled with this hidden gem. The terrace was fabulous, breakfast was amazing, the location is fantastic, however, the BEST thing about this hotel is the wonderful cast of characters that you will meet. Mateo and Oliver were terrific! They truly made our stay in Venice MAGICAL ~ Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel... but don't love the refund lag”
Reviews.Author: yfiscarelli
Reviews.Content: Had I written this review immediately after our stay the hotel would have received my highest review. We stayed at Al Ponte Antico as part of our honeymoon in Italy. We had a large room on the first floor that looked out onto the Grand Canal. The room was very spacious, nicely decorated, and well kept. It wasn't the furnishings or the stunning location right across from the Rialto bridge that really sold the hotel, it was the staff. The staff were very accomodating and recommended only wonderful restaurants for us to visit off the beaten tourist track. Matteo, the owner makes delightful crapes and omlettes in the morning that you can eat overlooking the beautiful canal. We loved our stay, however we have had a terrible time resolving a billing issue with this hotel. When we checked out, the hotel mistakenly charged us 240 euros over our internet booked rate. We caught the error on the train ride out of Venice and immediately called and spoke with Matteo who assured us that they would refund the difference. After multiple phone calls, e-mails, and now 1 1/2 months into a charge dispute with American Express, I still haven't received my 240 euros back. This I find unacceptable which is why I warn you to be very careful when paying your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Ponte Antico”
Reviews.Author: 36bear
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Al Ponte Antico. We could not have chosen a better hotel...location and service. Matteo, Oliver and the rest of the staff are gratious, warm and accommodating. You never once felt rushed or bothered by asking questions about the area - restaurants, museums, travel etc. Everyone is willing to please you and help make your stay not just at Ponte Antico memorable but in Venice as well. Thanks Matteo, Oliver and everyone else for adding another alluring reason to return to Italy! Bene grazie! Nick and Blythe..

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeKim
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days staying at this wonderful hotel. The personal service provided by Matteo (the Owner) and his team was second to none. They made dinner reservations for us and ensured we were able to obtain tickets to the Ennio Morricone concert in St Marks Square. The hotel itself is small and exquisite we stayed in Room number 8 which had the most fantastic view over the Grand Canal, the furnishings and decor totally fitting for the room, the bathroom was compact however the hydro massage shower was great. Matteo the owner personally cooks breakfast to order each morning and the eggs are from his grandmother's farm, his pancakes were incredible. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff and we will certainly return and occupy the same room if possible

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful welcome awaits you at this marvellous hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterDaisy
Reviews.Content: You can be assured of a very warm welcome at this lovely hotel and the best service from Matteo and his staff. The hotel is very centrally located and only a stones throw from the Rialto bridge. You can watch the world go by on the Grand Canal from the hotel terrace. From the hotel you can easily walk around the city and enjoy the sights of Venice. The service is fantastic and Matteo is on hand with lots of local knowledge if you need any advice. He will tell you about the best place to pick up a gondolas or recommend or book a restaurant for you if you wish. The hotel is exceptionally clean and smart and the home cooked breakfasts are very special. You can arrive at this hotel in style as the water taxi lands at the hotels own landing station. It is a great experience to pick up a water taxi at the airport and travel up the grand canal to the hotel. I think we paid 80 euros for that.

Reviews.Title: “loved Mateo”
Reviews.Author: GCTravellers
Reviews.Content: As with anyone booking a Hotel from overseas it is done with great trepidation. Will it be as good as the photos indicate, will the location be convenient to restaurants and sites of interest and shopping etc etc etc ??? My wife and I have traveled a fair bit and I guess you would call us fussy We had concerns about Venice hotels in so far as noise whilst we slept, breakfast, the room, the view and so it goes on. .... We arrived at the Hotel by water taxi to be greeted by the owner, Mateo, A greeting so warm as to immediately put aside any trepidation. Mateo showed us to our room which loverlooked the Rialto bridge off a balcony and when I say overlooked "I mean in your face" - it was just stunning. Looking down on to the main riverway and all its water traffic there couldn't be a better outlook in the whole of Venice. The room was 5 star, spacious and I am talking normal spacious not Italian spacious; chandeliers and antique furniture and a great bed with 15 foot ceilings The breakfast was typical European, simple by many standards, fresh eggs cooked to your choice (Mateo makes great omelettes!) , fresh bread and meats and cheeses and lovely lovely coffee - expresso not jug boiled To wrap it up - our friends stayed at a 'very expensive' Venice Hotel and were very unhappy. We were absolutely delighted with The Ponte Antico, the surroundings, ambience and of course with Mateo who made us feel so welcome and very very special - we definitely got the better deal! We would always stay at Ponte Antico when in Venice - it is fantastic. Book here and you won't be dissapointed!!! Louis and Gail - Gold Coast Australia

Reviews.Title: “Magical Venetian Palace”
Reviews.Author: Mekki_E
Reviews.Content: Wow! We arrived by Water Taxi and no sooner had we pulled up to the Hotel when we were greeted by Matteo. He knew who we were and was expecting us. Things just got better from there. We were introduced to the staff and then went out to look out on the Grand Canal. The Rialto Bridge is right there. We had the opportunity to stay in 2 rooms. Each room has a theme. The first room was large; it has 18 foot ceilings, a large bathroom. It was clean; the decor was meticulous in its planning. On the second night we moved to one of the rooms overlooking the Canal. Again another large room that had windows that went almost from the floor to the ceiling (again 18 foot ceilings.) The staff is very attentive, very friendly and helpful. Over all the Hotel is very clean, beautiful, romantic and quintessentially Venetian. The breakfast was a lot more that the usual continental breakfasts that you typically get. In fact Matteo will prepare your eggs the way you want them (with eggs from his grandmothers). He will also cook you, the Italian version of a Crepe. Fantastic. I have to say that this is not just a Hotel it is the person and that person is Matteo. His is the Hotel and the Hotel is him. He lives it and pays attention to every little detail; it's all about professional service and a warm feeling. All his recommendations for around town were great, his knowledge of history and genuine love of the city is embodied in this place. Book it now, because in a year you probably won't be able to get into this place due to the long wait list. Thank you Matteo and we will see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MVPinBoynton
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this very special hotel. The location could not be better with the hotel sitting on the bend in the Grand Canal. When standing on the balcony you can look to the left and see the Rialto Bridge and look to the right and look down a full view of the Grand Canal. Being by the Rialto Bridge also makes it very easy to find your way back to the hotel, since there are signs everywhere directing you back to the Rialto. It is only a 5-10 minute walk to San Marco. Although the location is great, the service is even better. The owner, Matteo, takes care of you like you are one of his best friends. The rest of the staff are always smiling and trying to find ways to assist you, if needed. The included breakfast is not to be missed. Matteoâ€™s specialty is chocolate crepes. Just unbelievably good! He also serves eggs made any way you want. The eggs are the best I have ever had. I believe the secret is that he gets them from his grandmotherâ€™s farm a couple times a week. The room was very comfortable and beautifully appointed in with Venetian style furniture and fixtures. It was also quite a large room with a dressing area. We had been upgraded to a canal view room right behind the balcony. The hotel has a one person elevator for people that need some assistance getting up the stairs. The air conditioning worked wonderfully. We have pictures of the hotel in our trip review at [--] if you want to see more of the hotel and read about our experiences while staying there. If you are lucky enough to be able to book a room at this very special hotel, consider yourself most fortunate. It is an experience you will never forget.
